description: Talking about the best taco youve ever had in a restaurant is like talking about the best kiss youve ever had in a hospital. No matter how good it was, it would have been better somewhere else.

title: Highlights and Analysis: 2013 N.L. Wildcard  Pirates 6, Reds 2
description: Anyone who has even casually followed the Pittsburgh Pirates this season is probably familiar with one particular number: 21. Thats how many years it had been since the Pirates have made the postseason, let alone had a winning season.

title: As J.C. Penney Flounders, a Lack of Control Becomes Evident
description: The latest events at J. C. Penney provide a hard lesson: With todays public company, it is sometimes difficult to be sure who is in control.

title: Alexander McQueen: Spring 2014 RTW
description: Paris

title: Justices to Hear Raging Bull Copyright Appeal
description: WASHINGTON  The Supreme Court on Tuesday agreed to hear an appeal in a copyright dispute arising from the movie Raging Bull, and it added seven other cases to its docket.

title: George Will to Leave ABC News for Fox News
description: George Will, who has been a conservative presence on ABC News for more than three decades, is leaving for the Fox News Channel, the cable news network announced on Tuesday.

title: Betting on a Nobel Winner
description: Compared with, say, the Academy Awards or the Booker Prize, the Nobel Prize for Literature is shrouded in mystery. There is no list of nominees. Even the date of the announcement is kept secret. So how do bookmakers every year confidently put forward a list of odds for who will win the prize?

title: The Cecil Opens in Harlem, Michelin Star Rankings and More
description: Headliner

title: With Grand Canyon Closed, Cancellations Pour In for Arizona
description: PHOENIX  Train trips from Northern Arizona to Grand Canyon National Park have been canceled. Rafting expeditions along the Colorado River have been suspended. Hotels have relaxed refund policies for travelers who have booked rooms near one of the 24 national parks in the state that were closed on Tuesday.

title: Citing Efforts to Prevent Attack on Syria, Group Nominates Putin for Peace Prize
description: MOSCOW  He is credited with commanding a war to crush separatism in Chechnya, approving a full-scale attack on Georgia over a minor border dispute and complaining when NATO led an air war in Libya to stop Col. Muammar el-Qaddafi from killing thousands of Libyans. And he is still selling weapons to the murderous government of President Bashar al-Assad of Syria.

title: A Campaign to Make Route 66 Hip Once More
description: What better way to revitalize a stretch of Route 66, the historic highway stretching from Chicago to Los Angeles, than with a filling station and a motor-court cottage? The city of Springfield, Mo., has plans to turn both into the visitors center of a new roadside park it is building as part of an effort to help bring new life to run-down areas of the 12-mile stretch of highway that runs through the city.

title: When Writing Well Is Part of the Problem
description: The author of this past weekends Lives essay reflects on the most useful feedback she has received about writing fiction.

title: Internal Dissent Imperils Berlusconis Long Reign Atop His Party
description: ROME  For two decades, former Prime Minister Silvio Berlusconi has not just led Italys powerful center-right political movement; he has practically owned it. A billionaire media mogul, he has bankrolled campaigns and vetted his partys candidates. His power has been so absolute that even at age 77, he still has not truly groomed a successor.

title: The Courts and the Shutdown
description: The opening of a new Supreme Court term on the statutorily prescribed first Monday in October is always surrounded by a fair amount of drama having to do with the momentous legal issue the justices will be taking up. The government shutdown has imbued the start of the 2013-2014 term this coming Monday, Oct. 7, with a different sort of suspense.

title: Utah Senator Causes Uproar Among House Republicans
description: Senator Mike Lee, Republican of Utah, may have only been trying to support House Republicans, but some comments from Mr. Lee  one of the captains of the effort to defund the health care law  are upsetting the Republican ranks.

title: Roots of Current Impasse Go Back to 1974
description: WASHINGTON  Congress, at odds with the president, was struggling to assert more control over the federal government through the budget process but could not seem to wrap up its work on deadline. So the House and Senate voted to change the budget-making process, and lawmakers gave themselves a deadline extension to get their fiscal house in order.

title: Fantasy Football Week 5: Mining for Waiver Wire Gold
description: Welcome to the fantasy football quarter turn. Philip Rivers is a top five fantasy quarterback, Joique Bell has almost tripled C.J. Spillers fantasy output and Roddy White has one eighth of the fantasy points that Eddie Royal has. Just what was expected (or not).

title: Pictures of the Day: Washington and Elsewhere
description: Photos from Washington, Kenya, Afghanistan and the West Bank.

title: Lawyer Contests Casino Referendums Wording
description: ALBANY  Seeking to stop a November referendum that would allow more casinos across the state, a Brooklyn lawyer filed a suit here on Tuesday arguing that the ballot measures language is improperly slanted in favor of its passage.

title: Rio's Chicken Wings at Home
description: Melissa Clark recreates the spicy chicken wings from Ganso, a Japanese restaurant in Downtown Brooklyn, in the comfort of her kitchen.

title: Dreaming of Spicy, Crunchy Chicken Wings
description: The Restaurant Takeaway column is devoted to restaurant dishes you can make in your own kitchen, tested and tweaked for home cooks.

title: Austin, Tex., Stands Out in Hotel Recovery That Has Hugged Coasts
description: AUSTIN, Tex.  Skittish developers have delayed new hotels across much of the country until the economy returns to health, and financing does, too. But in Austin, developers arent that wary.

title: Effects of Shutdown Felt in the Final Frontier
description: One agency that has been particularly idled by the shutdown is NASA  the astronauts on the International Space Station and mission control are working, but relatively few other people are. NASAs popular television channel has gone dark, no longer showing feeds from space missions, and its various Twitter accounts are silent.

title: Vows Column Angers Readers With Mention of Childs Death as a Spiritual Milestone
description: With the government shutting down and Marine generals being forced out for negligence, the subject of a weddings-oriented column in The Times is, no doubt, relatively unimportant. But because it has been the subject of plenty of angry reader e-mail, I am taking it up here.

title: John Armleder, the Artist Who Believes in Everything
description: My dream is to go to a show and wonder, Who is that artist? and find out its my work, said John Armleder, the Swiss painter, sculptor and performance artist who spent the past few years recovering from the removal of a brain tumor. Before I got ill, I did wall paintings with models of brains, he said. Both myself and the guy who published those paintings landed up with brain problems. Now, the 66-year-old is back on the scene with an untitled, unthematic show at Nahmad Contemporary, on the Upper East Side. Unlike most artists, Armleder didnt oversee the installation. I consider the artwork to exist as itself, he said. Its the person who looks at it who gives its meaning. In fact this show was conceptualized and curated by Joe Nahmad, the 23-year-old art dealer and gallery owner whose older brother was implicated in an F.B.I. poker raid last April.

title: From a Tortilla, the Feeling of a Warm Embrace
description: My grandmother was working the day she met my grandfather on a garlic patch outside Mendota, Calif., in the flat fields of the San Joaquin Valley in the center of the state. It was 1942, and they were both 16. She liked to say  years later, standing in the kitchen of the house where she helped raise and feed us  that it was love at first smell. He was clipping garlic tops. She had just delivered lunch to some men in a nearby field.

title: Employees Without Health Care Coverage Looking to Exchanges
description: AURORA, Colo.  Angela Graham, 51, has not had health insurance for years, and is not covered by her job conducting telephone surveys.

title: An iPhone Case That Sharpens Your Photography Skills
description: Technology companies are rapidly improving camera functions and apps for smartphones, but one is focusing instead on how a smartphone case can improve photos.

title: Untangle Your Cords
description: Recoil, a company in Park City, Utah, has developed a way to keep the cords attached to technology devices from becoming a knotted mess.

title: Study of Hormone Use in Menopause Reaffirms Complex Mix of Risks and Benefits
description: Hormone therapy for menopause is one of the most divisive subjects in medicine, hailed by some as a boon to womens comfort and well-being, vilified by others as a threat to health.

title: The Softness, the Crunch, the Nostalgia of the Fish Taco
description: Some people get a faraway look in their eyes when they talk about fish tacos.

title: National Zoos Panda Cam Goes Dark
description: WASHINGTON  One casualty of the impasse in Washington is the publics look at the newborn panda at the Smithsonian National Zoo on the Giant Panda Cam.

title: In a Public Offering, a Symbol of New York Gains a Symbol: ESRT
description: King Kong swung from it. Cary Grant and Deborah Kerr planned to meet at its top in An Affair to Remember. And now, the Empire State Building has a new claim to fame: it has gone public.

title: But What Does the Shutdown Mean for Travelers?
description: If youre about to board a plane, take the Acela or go camping, youre probably wondering if the government shutdown means youre out of luck. The answer: only if your itinerary includes a visit to a destination entirely run by the government, Stephanie Rosenbloom reports in The Timess live blog on the fiscal crisis.

title: Whats In It | Doritos Locos Tacos
description: Taco Bells Doritos Locos Taco is a marriage made in processed-food heaven. It joins a perfectly engineered snack with a proven fast-food colossus. Michael Moss asks: whats in it?

title: That Nacho Dorito Taste
description: THE INVENTOR OF DORITOS, a longtime Madison Avenue executive named Arch West, first envisioned this snack in 1964 as more than a golden-hued chip. He saw it as a marketing powerhouse, a vehicle for delivering endless varieties of new flavors.

title: Into the Heart (and Other Assorted Body Parts) of Old Russia
description: A Young Doctors Notebook stands out on American television simply for being a serious adaptation of serious literature. Shakespeare aside, where have we seen that this year? Perhaps only in HBOs Parades End, an adaptation of the novels by Ford Madox Ford, unless you count Game of Thrones or Under the Dome.

title: Dropping In on Tragedy, as if You Were There
description: Films Beget Films is the title of Jay Leydas 1964 book about compilation films: new works stitched together out of old footage. In the case of Let the Fire Burn, its video that begets a riveting chronicle of the radical group Moves clash with Philadelphia authorities and a catastrophic siege of its headquarters in 1985. Seamlessly fashioned from television news footage, public hearings and other sources, the movie relives an incredible chapter in American history.

title: No Escape to Alcatraz
description: SAN FRANCISCO  The tourists arrived by the dozens carrying cameras and wearing sun hats only to be told that there would be no boats to the historic prison on Alcatraz Island.

title: Disabled, but Still Dangerous
description: The new Ironside really should have added a suffix rather than simply borrowing the title of the old series starring Raymond Burr. Something like Ironside on Steroids or Ironside: Angry and Annoying.

title: Comedies of Sensitivity and Squirms
description: Super Fun Night, an ABC comedy that stars Rebel Wilson as a loser looking for love, should be an easy sell. Everyone likes a Cinderella story, and, as Kimmie Boubier, a lawyer with a video diary and a weakness for jelly doughnuts, Ms. Wilson must be endearing.

title: At Valentino, Leather Espadrilles Fit for Wanderers
description: T plucks the best shoes right off the runway.

title: A Plucky Operas Poignant Death Rattle
description: After 70 years, New York City Opera has folded, and people are furious about it  not just the choristers, orchestra players and other dedicated company personnel, but countless fans who have depended upon the peoples opera for decades.

title: Netanyahu's U.N. Speech in 3 Minutes
description: Highlights from the speech by Israels prime minister, Benjamin Netanyahu, at the United Nations General Assembly.

title: Video of Israel and Iran Sparring at U.N.
description: Following an extended attack on the credibility of Irans new president by Israels prime minister in an address to the United Nations on Tuesday, an Iranian diplomat exercised his countrys right to reply with scathing remarks of his own, as my colleagues Somini Sengupta and Rick Gladstone report.

title: Missing Out on History in Boston
description: BOSTON  Vern Bengston, a retired teacher who made a pilgrimage from Idaho to Bostons historic Faneuil Hall, was hopping mad. The storied building, where the likes of Samuel Adams, Daniel Webster and Frederick Douglass once held forth, is collateral damage in the government shutdown.

title: Museum Celebrates an Artist Who Still Produces
description: When the Craft and Folk Art Museum in Los Angeles asked Gere Kavanaugh to be an honoree Sunday at its annual fund-raiser, the 84-year-old designer had one stipulation: She said, Fine, but people need to understand that Im not retiring, said Suzanne Isken, the museums executive director.

title: Living in Irvington, N.Y.
description: A riverfront community in Westchester with abundant greenery and an attractive commute.

title: Irvington, N.Y., Nature, Near the Upper West Side
description: The point of no return for Dr. Alton Barron, a Manhattan hand surgeon, came one day in the late 1990s. He was pushing his 3-year-old daughter, Chloe, in her stroller across Lincoln Park Plaza when the child spied a large grouping of leafless saplings in concrete containers and exclaimed, Look, Daddy, a forest!

title: Ally of Ivory Coast Strongman Sought by International Court
description: DAKAR, Senegal  Charles Bl Goud, a crucial ally of Laurent Gbagbo, the Ivory Coast strongman indicted on charges of crimes against humanity, is being sought on similar charges, the International Criminal Court said Tuesday.

title: Where Indie Game Producers Come Out to Play
description: Digital distribution has been driving sales of independent video games for nearly a decade. But the rise of the indies can be traced in no small part to IndieCade, a quirky, artful gathering that attracts people from around the world to an event thats known as the Sundance of games.

title: F.D.A. Bans Three Arsenic Drugs Used in Poultry and Pig Feeds
description: In resolving a longstanding dispute, the Food and Drug Administration has announced that it will rescind approval for three of the four arsenic drugs that had been used in animal feeds at the request of the companies that market them.

title: Backstage Beauty Report | A Real-Life Look for Stella McCartneys Lady on the Go
description: Stella McCartneys models were aglow with simple, soft makeup and hair. To make sure the eyes werent lost in otherwise neutral faces, Pat McGrath used a taupe brown eye liner to draw a pseudo-cat-eye, which popped under subtle but full eyebrows. The hairstylist Eugene Souleiman ditched styling products altogether to focus instead on a clean head of hair. Texturally, the hair is very light, he explained. Its freshly washed, blown out straight with a round brush. The hair is literally draped over one ear, and pulled into a very taut ponytail. The slightly messed tresses were in line with the shows celebration of the chic, ever-on-the-go woman. Souleiman achieved the humble detail by lightly massaging the scalp, just to bring out these little imperfections, he said.

title: Restaurant Report: Girasol in Los Angeles
description: When Alice Waters opened Chez Panisse in 1971, her philosophy was simple yet, for the time, radical: use seasonal, local ingredients whenever possible. The idea transformed eating in California and, eventually, the rest of the country. So what exactly is California cuisine these days?

title: Its No Longer on His Face, and Its Got Ambitions
description: William Kentridges 2010 staging of Shostakovichs first opera, The Nose, was one of the Metropolitan Operas most acclaimed productions of recent seasons, and for a critic just catching up with it when it was revived on Saturday afternoon, it was easy to see why. With unflagging energy and unfettered imagination, it powerfully seconds both the irreverent zaniness of the Gogol story on which the opera is based and the teeming exuberance of Shostakovichs music.

title: Like People You Know, Driven Yet Exhilarated
description: SEATTLE  The happily galvanized look of Pacific Northwest Ballets artists in Air Twyla, a triple bill of pieces by Twyla Tharp, is a marvel  and a sure sign of the inspirational effect this choreographer has upon dancers. Since its three works span 31 years, from Nine Sinatra Songs (1982) to Waiting at the Station (a world premiere), the program demonstrates much of the amazing diversity of Ms. Tharp, one of the very few living choreographers to whom the word great should be applied.

title: Ex-Employees Allege Sexual Harassment at Womens Networking Group
description: Four former employees of the National Association of Professional Women, a womens networking group, have sued the organization and three of its executives, claiming that a manager had sexually harassed them and that their paychecks had been docked in violation of New York State labor law.

title: Salsa Down the Decades
description: The great Puerto Rican salsa orchestra El Gran Combo has been around for 50 years, as the projected visuals of its current stage show tell you, or 51, as history tells you. Some of its songs have been in Spanish-speaking consciousness for so long that theyre bigger than the band, or bigger than what the band is now. And so El Gran Combo has a duty toward pageantry.

title: Hopes for a Street Resistant to Rebirth
description: For decades, its been a retail version of a hard-to-crack whodunit: What is wrong with West Eighth Street?

title: Movement Made for Listening
description: In the near darkness, it takes eyes awhile to adjust. Aural information dominates at first: rhythmic exhalations that sound human. As your pupils dilate, and the light very slowly brightens, four shapes, white and pulsing, grow discernible. The pace of the brightening doesnt quicken, but recognition, when it comes, dawns instantly. The shapes are heads, bobbing like derricks. The blacknesses below the heads are bodies.

title: Taco Crawl
description: The Aieee!!! taco is filled with a sauted andouille sausage, onions and chiles, mixed with black beans and rice and topped by picante salsa, crema and scallions.

title: Ziggy Stardusts Reading Habits
description: Plenty of music fans could have guessed that David Bowie was a fan of George Orwells Nineteen Eighty-Four, since Mr. Bowie once aspired to produce a musical based on the novel. Now we have 99 other book recommendations from the Thin White Duke.

title: A City in Limbo After the Shutdown
description: What happens to the nations capital when the government is shut down?

title: Home Kits for Tortillas, Purple Tomatillos and More
description: To Chop: Purple Tomatillos Inspire Stunning Shades of Salsa

title: Shutdown Q. and A.
description: The shutdown of the federal government has created widespread confusion. Here are some questions and answers about some of its specific and practical effects.

title: Shes 16, but Not Thinking of Sweet
description: What is Royals, by Lorde, the New Zealand songwriter who performed at Webster Hall on Monday night, doing in the Top 10 alongside Miley Cyruss Wrecking Ball and Katy Perrys Roar? Most of all, its insisting that pop listeners dont have to settle for clichs.

title: Ryan Links Budget Impasse to Debt Ceiling Fight
description: WASHINGTON  Representative Paul D. Ryan of Wisconsin, chairman of the House Budget Committee, suggested on Tuesday that the government shutdown may not be resolved for more than two weeks.

title: U.S. Military Deaths in Afghanistan
description: The Department of Defense has identified 2,264 American service members who have died as a part of the Afghan war and related operations. It confirmed the death of the following American recently:

title: For Your iPhone 5, a Personal Photo and Extra Juice
description: Battery cases and phone cases customized with photos you have taken are both staples of the phone accessory world. But not a battery case featuring a photo you have taken.

title: Banksy Announces a Monthlong Show on the Streets of New York
description: Hello, and welcome to Lower Manhattan, the message begins, as elevator music plays. Before you, you will see a spray art by the artist Ban-sky. Or maybe not; its probably been painted over by now.

title: Paris Fashion Week: Alexander McQueen Spring/Summer 2014
description: Scenes from the Paris Fashion Week photo diary of Kasia Bobula.

title: New York to Sue Wells Fargo Over Mortgage Settlement
description: Fielding complaints from borrowers struggling to save their homes, New Yorks top prosecutor is preparing a lawsuit against Wells Fargo, accusing the bank, the nations largest home lender, of flouting the terms of a multibillion-dollar settlement aimed at stanching foreclosure abuses.

title: With Lagerfeld, No Need to Look Below the Surface
description: PARIS  Fashion designers including Miuccia Prada and Marc Jacobs have collaborated with artists, and artists frequently sit in the front row. The other day Jeff Koons attended Stella McCartneys show. And sometimes the commercial trade-offs are as blunt as a handbag: in 2008, Louis Vuitton installed a shop at the Murakami retrospective at theBrooklynMuseum.

title: Facebook Now Allows Users to Search Timelines
description: Facebook clearly has some Google envy. Yet after Facebooks latest search additions to its Web site, Google probably has some Facebook envy, too.

title: Performances Canceled at Fords Theater
description: The Fords Theater Society receives no federal financing and employs no federal workers, but the site where President Abraham Lincoln was shot has been barred from hosting any shows or performances during the government shutdown.

title: What They Say Versus What They Mean
description: Over at Wonkblog, Lydia DePillis asks, Remember when Republicans were worried about economic uncertainty?

title: Federal Data Reveals Variety of Health Care Plans
description: As the much-anticipated health care exchanges opened amid bitter partisan debate and technical problems, the federal government released data late Tuesday showing that about 100 insurers were participating in the federally run marketplaces, offering more than 1,700 varieties of health insurance plans.

title: Closer Look at Polls Finds Views of Health Law a Bit Less Negative
description: On opening day of the new federal and state health insurance exchanges, a deeper look at how Americans view the Affordable Care Act shows that public opinion is not as negative as has been reported.

title: The Nacho Dorito
description: Michael Moss explains the psychology of what makes Nacho Cheese Doritos so alluring.

title: YES Viewers Say Their Goodbyes
description: The Yankees 85-77 record prevented them from making the American League playoffs. A disappointment, yes, but grounds to shun them? No.

title: Worried About Land Grabs, Group Presses 3 Corporations to Disclose Sugar Purchases
description: HONG KONG  Oxfam accused three big international food companies on Tuesday of buying sugar from what the advocacy group described as plantations that had unfairly taken land from farmers in Cambodia and Brazil without proper compensation.

title: Restricted Group Speaks Up, Saying Sex Crime Measures Go Too Far
description: LOS ANGELES  Larry Neely looked out across the expanse of an airport hotel conference room that usually holds conventions of labor unions, political groups or business executives.

title: Surviving Spouses With Reverse Mortgages Win Case
description: Its a jarring situation: Your spouse dies, and you end up facing the possible loss of your home through foreclosure--just because you arent listed as a borrower on a reverse mortgage on your home.

title: Dodgers Dont View Injuries as Obstacle
description: LOS ANGELES  As the Dodgers were put through their final workout Tuesday morning before leaving for Atlanta, much of the attention was focused on who will not be in the lineup when their National League division series begins Thursday.

title: Staunch Group of Republicans Outflanks House Leaders
description: WASHINGTON  They have had their fleeting moments on cable television. Their closed-door run-ins with Speaker John A. Boehner spill occasionally into the pages of Capitol Hill newspapers. But outside their districts, and sometimes even within them, few have heard of the conservative cadre of House Republicans who have led the charge to shut down the government.

title: For Federal Workers, Anxiety and Anger
description: Federal workers across the country staged protests on Tuesday to express their anger and frustration over the shutdown.

title: Hollywood Advancing Clinton Film
description: LOS ANGELES  Two television projects about Hillary Rodham Clinton collapsed under political pressure this week, but she may yet get her close-up on screen, this time from Hollywood.

title: Texas Governors Trips to Lure Jobs Stir Skepticism Over Motive
description: HOUSTON  Rick Perry is not the first governor to try to lure jobs from other states. Others have done it for decades, often with discretion, sometimes with gimmicks, like the time Arnold Schwarzenegger drove a moving truck down the Las Vegas Strip in 2004 while trying to woo businesses to California.

title: Rematch for Nassau Executive Could Be Bellwether of National Trend
description: A fair question to ask about the race for executive of Nassau County is: Why would anyone want the job?

title: Ministering on Death Row, and Feeling a New Confidence in Rome
description: This week, trailing a group of men walking through a prison, Sister Helen Prejean overheard bits of what they were discussing. I heard one saying, He is so honest, but I didnt catch who they were talking about at first, said Sister Prejean, a member of the Congregation of St. Joseph, an order of Roman Catholic sisters.

title: Groceries Are Cleaning Up in Store-Brand Aisles
description: Grocery store brands once carried a stigma. With no-frills white packaging that telegraphed bargain basement and low quality, they were a last resort for consumers on tight budgets.

title: Jellyfish Invasion Paralyzes Swedish Reactor
description: In an episode that evokes B-grade sci-fi movie plots from the 1950s, but actually reflects a continuing global problem, nuclear engineers in southeastern Sweden have been wrestling with a giant swarm of jellyfish that forced the shutdown of the worlds largest boiling-water reactor.

title: Well-Traveled Guard Offers the Knicks Direction
description: GREENBURGH, N.Y.  When Beno Udrih made his N.B.A. debut with the San Antonio Spurs in 2004, it quickly became apparent to his teammates that he was a different type of player. It had nothing to do with his passing skills or his dependable jump shot. It had everything to do with how he thought about the game.

title: Early Interest for Online Health Markets
description: On the day that health care exchanges went live, millions of Americans tried to go online to see how affordable their health care could be.

title: Spain Is Expected to Extradite Ex-Trader in JPMorgan Case
description: Federal authorities expect that one of the former JPMorgan Chase employees facing criminal charges in connection with the banks multibillion-dollar trading loss in London will eventually be extradited to the United States, a senior prosecutor said on Tuesday.

title: Losing Hope in Fukushima
description: More than two years after the nuclear meltdown in Fukushima Prefecture, thousands of refugees, desperate to return home, are losing confidence in the Japanese governments cleanup efforts.

title: Insider Trading Trial of Mavericks Owner Is Under Way
description: DALLAS  Mark Cuban is a righteous man whose stock trading practices are inconsistent with someone whos done something wrong. Or hes a brazen billionaire whose trading ran afoul of securities laws.

title: Its Not Citizens United
description: CAMBRIDGE, Mass.  ON Tuesday the Supreme Court is scheduled to hear arguments in McCutcheon v. Federal Election Commission, potentially the most significant federal campaign finance case since Citizens United in 2010.

title: Tax Cuts in the Mayors Race
description: On Friday, without many people noticing, Joseph Lhota, the Republican candidate for mayor of New York, slipped a little substance into the campaign.

title: Netanyahu Pushes Back on Iran
description: During an aggressive speech at the United Nations on Tuesday, Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu of Israel used sarcasm and combative words to portray Irans new president, Hassan Rouhani, as a smooth-talking charlatan, one who is determined to continue building a nuclear weapons arsenal.

title: Our Democracy Is at Stake
description: This time is different. What is at stake in this government shutdown forced by a radical Tea Party minority is nothing less than the principle upon which our democracy is based: majority rule. President Obama must not give in to this hostage taking  not just because Obamacare is at stake, but because the future of how we govern ourselves is at stake.

title: Dartmouth in the Glare of Scrutiny on Drinking
description: HANOVER, N.H.  It is a new school year, and there is a new president, Philip J. Hanlon, who no doubt would prefer to begin his tenure as the 18th president of Dartmouth College dealing with issues more lofty than binge drinking, sexual harassment and fraternity hazing.

title: Scenes From the de Blasio-McCray Wedding
description: A selection of scenes from the wedding of Chirlane McCray and Bill de Blasio.

title: Effort to Finance Veterans Programs Fails in the House
description: WASHINGTON  A bill to finance veterans programs failed in the House on Tuesday night. It was one of three measures from Republicans aimed at alleviating some of the effects of a government shutdown and forcing Democrats into negotiating.

title: Near Fukushima, a Human Crisis Quietly Unfolds
description: The 83,000 refugees evacuated from the worst-hit areas around the nuclear power plant are still unable to go home, two and a half years after the disaster.

title: Pope Assails Bureaucracy of Church as Insular
description: As Pope Francis convened a closed meeting on Tuesday with eight cardinals he appointed to overhaul the Vatican, he used his second revealing interview in two weeks to make a barbed indictment of the failings of the Roman Catholic Church, calling it overly clerical and insular, interested in temporal power and often led by narcissists.

title: Once Alienated, and Now a Force in Her Husbands Bid for Mayor
description: She was the seventh-grader too frightened to stand in front of the room because her white classmates would mock her, contorting their mouths to make their lips look big. She was the smoldering teenager who took to writing poems every day to wrestle with her isolation and anger. She was the eldest daughter of one of the only black families in Longmeadow, Mass., who arrived home to see their new house scrawled with racist graffiti.

title: Corrections: October 2, 2013
description: FRONT PAGE

title: In Banking, Should There Be a 'Public Option'?
Preventing Hate Crimes
description: To the Editor:

title: A New (Harder?) Admissions Option at Bard College
description: To the Editor:

title: Military Sex Abuse
description: To the Editor:

title: A Campaign Urges Listening to Those Torn by Mental Illness
description: ONLY 61 percent of Americans think it appropriate to tell family members about a mental illness diagnosis, according to a recent study commissioned by the New York City Metro chapter of the National Alliance on Mental Illness. Just 43 percent approve of telling friends about a diagnosis, and just 13 percent of telling co-workers.

title: Thats Not Amore
description: WASHINGTON  John Boehner wakes up in his English basement apartment on Capitol Hill, his head still in a merlot fog.

title: Japans Nuclear Refugees, Still Stuck in Limbo
description: NAMIE, Japan  Every month, Hiroko Watabe, 74, returns for a few hours to her abandoned house near the damaged Fukushima nuclear plant to engage in her own small act of defiance against fate. She dons a surgical mask, hangs two radiation-measuring devices around her neck and crouches down to pull weeds.

title: Concern for Accused Army Sergeants Emotional Health
description: The former Army sergeant known as Rambo, who has been charged with conspiracy to kill a federal drug agent, looked as if he was on the verge of tears before a court hearing on Tuesday, his lawyer said after the proceeding ended.

title: Woes Continue for Giants as Snee Considers Surgery
description: The Giants battered offensive line is not becoming any healthier, with the four-time Pro Bowl guard Chris Snee now considering season-ending hip surgery. Because two other starting linemen are injured as well, the Giants on Tuesday signed the former Philadelphia Eagles center Dallas Reynolds.

title: Google Accused of Wiretapping in Gmail Scans
description: SAN FRANCISCO  Wiretapping is typically the stuff of spy dramas and shady criminal escapades. But now, one of the worlds biggest Web companies, Google, must defend itself against accusations that it is illegally wiretapping in the course of its everyday business  gathering data about Internet users and showing them related ads.

title: Fixing Penn Station Without Rebuilding It
description: FOR commuters and travelers, New York Citys Pennsylvania Station is a disaster, as almost anyone who passes through it will tell you. The nations busiest transit hub is cramped, crowded, confusing and depressing. But now that the New York City Council has told Madison Square Garden that it has 10 years to vacate and find a new home, there is talk of rebuilding the rail station that lies beneath it.

title: Growth Forecast Is Trimmed for Developing Nations in Asia
description: HONG KONG  The Asian Development Bank lowered its growth forecasts for emerging nations in the region on Wednesday and called for more structural changes to support the local economies.

title: Shutdown Felt Far Beyond Washington
description: Tourists from Valley Forge to San Francisco were turned away from parks and monuments that were closed in the first government shutdown in nearly two decades.

title: In a Divided Country, a Teacher Seeks Escape in the World of Movies
description: Breathe deep and smell the rot. The signs of decay are everywhere  and I mean everywhere  at the Blenheim School in Durban, South Africa, the setting for Jon Robin Baitzs early play The Film Society, which opened in a welcome if slightly ponderous revival on Sunday night in a Keen Company production on Theater Row.

title: Puzzles As Gifts
description: WEDNESDAYS PUZZLE  Im going to go ahead and guess that 27 Across was the seed entry for Paula Gamaches fun, near-soundalike puzzle.

title: Harold M. Agnew, Physicist Present at Birth of the Nuclear Age, Dies at 92
description: Harold M. Agnew, the last surviving major figure to have been present at the birth of the nuclear age  a physicist who helped build the worlds first reactor and atomic bombs, flew on the first atomic strike against Japan, filmed the mushroom cloud, helped perfect the hydrogen bomb and led the Los Alamos National Laboratory at the height of the cold war  died on Sunday at his home in Solana Beach, Calif. He was 92.

title: Court Upholds a Settlement Affecting 20,000 City Renters
description: A federal appeals court has upheld a settlement affecting more than 20,000 rent-regulated tenants in New York City, clearing the way for them to seek individual compensation from their landlord for rent overcharges and other complaints.

title: Michael Shvo
description: Mr. Shvo, 40, is the chief executive of Shvo, a luxury residential development company that he founded in New York in 2004 after several years as a top-grossing broker for Douglas Elliman Real Estate. Mr. Shvos first major development project, in partnership with Victor Homes, is a condominium at 239 10th Avenue in West Chelsea, the site of a former Getty gas station near the High Line. He is an avid art collector.

title: Small Markets Find Ways to Compete
description: PITTSBURGH  From his crouch behind the plate at PNC Park on Tuesday, Russell Martin called for the first pitch of the baseball postseason. On Wednesday, some 130 miles away, the playoffs will continue at Progressive Field, with Nick Swisher taking part.

title: To Venezuelans, Heir of Chvez Is a Poor Copy
description: CARACAS, Venezuela  The start of the season for two premier teams in this baseball-loving nation was thrown into doubt after thieves stripped vast amounts of copper wire from the lights in this citys main stadium. Basic items are often so hard to find that when a truck driver slumped dead at the wheel after a highway accident last week, motorcycle-riding looters swarmed in to grab the cargo: tons of red meat.

title: 5 Members of a Family Die in a Colorado Rock Slide
description: DENVER  What started as a carefree family hike along a rustic mountain trail ended in tragedy on Monday, as two popular Colorado high school coaches, their daughter and two nephews were killed by a crush of falling boulders.

title: Justices to Weigh Key Limit on Political Donors
description: McCALLA, Ala.  The Supreme Courts Citizens United decision reshaped American politics by striking down limits on independent campaign spending by corporations and unions. But it did nothing to disturb the other main form of campaign finance regulation: caps on individuals direct contributions to candidates.

title: City Councilwoman Is Chosen in the Democratic Runoff for Public Advocate
description: Letitia James, a New York City councilwoman from Brooklyn with strong ties to labor unions, won a Democratic primary runoff for public advocate on Tuesday, a victory that makes her all but certain to become the first African-American woman to hold citywide office.

title: Northern Spy Lifts Cloak on Koreas Deadly Rivalry
description: SEOUL, South Korea  On Oct. 24, 1995, as a man now known as Kim Dong-sik hiked up a rain-slick mountain road in Buyeo, about 95 miles south of Seoul, he could not shake off a foreboding. He and another North Korean agent had sneaked into South Korea by boat 52 days earlier on a mission to bring home a Communist spy who had been working in the South for 15 years. The latest message from their superiors said the spy had been instructed to wait for Mr. Kim in a temple in Buyeo, disguised as a Buddhist monk named Jawoon.

title: Recent Commercial Real Estate
description: RECENT SALE

title: Catsimatidis Spent $419 for Each Vote in Primary
description: John A. Catsimatidis spent $419 a vote in losing the Republican mayoral nomination last month, more than double what Mayor Michael R. Bloomberg spent per vote in his 2009 re-election race, according to figures released this week.

title: Nets, Before Taking a Shot, Share a Kumbaya Moment at Training Camp
description: DURHAM, N.C.  The scene at the Nets team dinner late Monday night, hours after they arrived on the campus of Duke University to begin their weeklong training camp, resembled a support group or an intervention.

title: Practicing Self-Defense When Motorcyclists Make a Drive Dangerous
description: An uneventful  by New York City standards, anyway  sunny Sunday in your family sport utility vehicle turns instantly into something out of Mad Max when a group of motorcyclists surrounds and overtakes the vehicle, forcing it to stop on a West Side highway.

title: Wisconsin: Judge in Abuse Case Wont Step Down
description: A federal judge has refused to recuse himself from a case in which he ruled in favor of the Roman Catholic Archdiocese of Milwaukee in bankruptcy proceedings, and against creditors, who include hundreds of sexual abuse victims. Judge Rudolph T. Randa denied the creditors motion suggesting that he had a conflict of interest because his family members are buried in archdiocesan cemeteries. Judge Randa had ruled in late July that the archdiocese did not have to turn over millions of dollars in its cemetery trust fund to the abuse victims and other creditors, because it would substantially burden the churchs free exercise of religion. In denying the recusal motion on Tuesday, Judge Randa wrote that the care and maintenance of his parents burial crypts will not be substantially affected by his decision.

title: Arizona: Court Upholds School Funding Program
description: The state Court of Appeals on Tuesday unanimously upheld a lower court ruling affirming the constitutionality of a program that directs public money to private bank accounts to pay for private school tuition and educational services for some students. The Arizona School Boards Association and other groups sued to block the program, saying that it violated the states Constitution because it directed private funding to religious schools, among other arguments. The appeals court ruled that the program, designed by the Goldwater Institute, a conservative group, expands the options to meet the individual needs of children. Open to special-needs students at first, the program is available to one in five public school students in the state.

title: Tesco Plans Venture With Leading Chinese Grocery Chain
description: LONDON  Nine years after it first tried to crack the Chinese market, Tesco, the British grocery store chain, said on Wednesday that it would abandon its solo approach and form a partnership with a state-run supermarket operator in hopes of a stronger expansion in the country.

title: During Siege at Kenyan Mall, Government Forces Seemed Slow to Respond
description: NAIROBI, Kenya  When the first shots of automatic gunfire burst out, Raju, a member of a local gun club, was waiting in line in a bank at the Westgate shopping mall. He crouched down, pulled out his phone and feverishly pecked out a text message: I am inside and I can confirm this is not a robbery.

title: A Perk for Furloughed Employees (ID Required)
description: WASHINGTON  It was only a matter of time before somebody tried to commercialize the government shutdown that is playing havoc with the lives  and pocketbooks  of federal workers.

title: Airport in Florida Is Evacuated
description: Jacksonville International Airport in Florida reopened late Tuesday after it was evacuated for several hours because the authorities received reports of suspicious packages there.

title: Lottery Numbers
The Republicans Standing Their Ground
description: Conservative House Republicans have led the push to tie the dismantling of President Obamas health care law to the passage of a budget resolution.

title: Big Ten Network Makes Investment in College Hockey
description: ST. PAUL  Information about American college hockey was scarce in British Columbia when Curtis Gedig, a senior defenseman at Ohio State, grew up and played junior hockey there. Local news media did not cover it. Few college games were televised. Michigan State and Boston College might as well have been in a different solar system.

title: Quotation of the day for Wednesday October 2, 2013
description: I am patient. Thats how you get stuff done. You are patient.

title: How the Auto Industry Fared in September
description: Auto sales in September 2013.

title: Petke Sobered by Clubs Checkered Past
description: The rookie coach Mike Petke has been with the Red Bulls/MetroStars through bad times, worse times and sheer debacles. That is why he is guardedly sanguine about his teams current state.

title: Are Our Political Beliefs Encoded in Our DNA?
description: In December 2008, The New York Times Magazine reported on the emerging science of genopolitics.

title: Howard University President Is Retiring
description: Sidney A. Ribeau, president of Howard University since 2008, announced on Tuesday that he will retire at the end of the year. The universitys board of trustees appointed Wayne A. I. Frederick, who previously served as provost, as interim president and said it would conduct a national search for a new president.

title: Israel Gutman, Who Survived and Documented Holocaust, Dies at 90
description: JERUSALEM  Israel Gutman, who took part in the Warsaw ghetto uprising, survived three Nazi concentration camps and became a prominent historian of the Holocaust, died on Tuesday at his home here. He was 90.

title: Arnold Burns, Who Left Justice Dept. in Protest, Dies at 83
description: Arnold I. Burns, a top Justice Department official under President Ronald Reagan who resigned in protest of what he and others viewed as improper acts by Attorney General Edwin Meese III, died on Tuesday in Manhattan. He was 83.

title: Claims That Google Violates Gmail User Privacy
description: A federal judge last week refused to dismiss most of a lawsuit against Google over accusations that it improperly scanned the contents of e-mails in order to target ads.

title: Oscar de la Renta Comes to a Hotel Bathroom Near You
description: On Monday evening, minutes before stepping into the Peninsula New Yorks lavish 25th anniversary party, Oscar de la Renta was seated comfortably in a sprawling suite 15 floors above the booming street performance that kicked off the nights festivities, admiring the new amenity line he just created for the hotel group. The collection consists of shampoo, conditioner, body and shower gel, body lotion, and soap, all laced with his newest scent, a unisex blend of citrusy mandarin with warm bergamot and bright jasmine. When asked how long it took to create this particular smell, the designer, who has been making fragrances since 1977, said cheekily, a lifetime and a few years.

title: Blackout for Reds, as Pirates Move On
description: PITTSBURGH  It was everything the Pittsburgh Pirates could have dreamed, and the best part, for them, is that now there is more to come. The Pirates, after two decades of losing seasons, have stormed into the National League division series.

title: District of Columbia Says It Can Meet Payroll for Two Weeks
description: A bill to continue the financing of Washingtons city government went down to defeat in the House on Tuesday night, but the District of Columbia Council vowed to continue operating despite the financial obstacles.

title: How Intense Study May Harm Our Workouts
description: Tire your brain and your body may follow, a remarkable new study of mental fatigue finds. Strenuous mental exertion may lessen endurance and lead to shortened workouts, even if, in strict physiological terms, your body still has plenty of energy reserves.

title: The Tax Equation in the Health Care Law
description: Casey B. Mulligan is an economics professor at the University of Chicago. He is the author of The Redistribution Recession: How Labor Market Distortions Contracted the Economy.

title: Shutdown Could Worsen Budget Deficit, Analysis Says
description: At first blush, it might seem that a government shutdown would have a positive effect on the budget deficit, reducing its growth by constraining spending. But not so fast.

title: Word of the Day | fallacious
description: fallacious \f-la-shs\ adjective

title: Home Sales Rose in Tighter Manhattan Market, Report Says
description: As Manhattans residential sales inventory continued to plunge in the past three months, dropping to its lowest level in 13 years, sales took off in the opposite direction, with buyers determined to make their move before mortgage rates and home prices commence the inevitable tandem escalation experts have predicted.

title: How to Improve a Statue Thats Been Made to Dazzle? Tone It Down
description: No one has ever accused New York City of understatement.

title: BlackBerry Filing Describes a Global Slide
description: OTTAWA  In a delayed regulatory filing issued on Tuesday evening, the smartphone maker BlackBerry revealed that customers are turning against its products in what had been its one remaining bright spot, the developing world.

title: Whats on Wednesday
description: 2 P.M. (HBO) IN GOOD COMPANY (2004) A 51-year-old advertising executive (Dennis Quaid) finds his life turned upside down when a young shark (Topher Grace, above right, with Mr. Quaid) arrives on the scene to take over his department and his office  and sleep with his daughter (Scarlett Johansson). This engagingly lightweight drama, written and directed by Paul Weitz, is a gently revisionist fairy tale about good versus evil set on the battlefield of contemporary corporate culture, a site of our leading blood sport, Manohla Dargis wrote in The New York Times. Mostly, though, the movie is about men. Men without fathers, men without sons, men with wives who work and make them feel like less than a man and men with wives who, like Dans wife, Ann (Marg Helgenberger), give them the gift of both an exquisitely preserved figure and a fertile womb. She added, I dont believe for a single second how Mr. Weitz ends his fairy tale, but I mean it as a compliment to say that I wish I did.

title: News Quiz | October 2, 2013
description: See what you know about the news below. To prepare, you might scan the articles or summaries on todays front page. Good luck!

title: U.S. and South Korea Set Defense Strategy for North Korean Threat
description: SEOUL  Defense Secretary Chuck Hagel said Wednesday that the United States had devised a strategy with South Korea to deter the growing threat of North Koreas nuclear and chemical weapons programs.

title: Reports Say Obama Scraps Malaysia Trip Because of Crisis
description: Malaysian news media reported Wednesday that President Obama had decided to cancel his trip to that country next week because of the fiscal crisis back in the United States, quoting the nations leader as saying Secretary of State John Kerry would be representing the president.

title: Former Japanese Leader Declares Opposition to Nuclear Power
description: TOKYO  Japans flagging antinuclear movement received an unexpected new recruit this week when one of the nations most popular figures, former Prime Minister Junichiro Koizumi, made a very public about-face from his previous embrace of atomic power.

title: Live Stream | Louis Vuitton Spring 2014 Collection at Paris Fashion Week
Calling the President? Good Luck
description: Trying to reach President Obama or his aides through the White House switchboard? Dont bother.

title: Test Yourself | Math, Oct. 2, 2013
description: Our weekly math problems are written by teachers at Math for America.

title: 6 Qs About the News | Government Shutdown Begins as Health Insurance Exchanges Open
description: In House G.O.P. Stands Firm on Shutdown, but Dissent Grows, Jeremy W. Peters writes about the politics of the first day of the government shutdown.

title: The Type Who Takes Her Time
description: Melissa Cacciola speaks slowly, deliberating over each word, sometimes going back to tweak a phrase or clarify a thought. Its like her photographic medium  the tintype  which produces a single, unique image in the time you could shoot hundreds with a digital camera.

title: Should Colleges Use Admissions Criteria Other Than SAT Scores and Grades?
description: Bard College, a prestigious liberal arts college in upstate New York, will offer students admission if they can write four 2,500-word research papers that earn a B+ or better by the colleges standards. That means no need to worry about low grades or SAT scores.

title: Daniel Radcliffes Next Trick Is to Make Harry Potter Disappear
description: Before Daniel Radcliffe became the most famous child actor in history, he was just a child: an only child, a poor sleeper, a nonstop talker, a picky eater. He was also disarmingly sweet. In the screen test he took at age 10, in 2000, for the first Harry Potter film, Harry Potter and the Sorcerers Stone, he smiles brightly, ebullient, his delight in being there apparent; he is concentrating, concentrating so hard at one point that he mouths words under his breath while waiting to deliver a line, but even still, when he does finally speak, he is all natural sincerity. His face is a flawless little-boy face, his eyes huge and cerulean blue. One eye occasionally blinks more slowly than the other, but no matter. He turns, compliantly, this way and that when asked. About four minutes into the footage, someone places the iconic round glasses on him, and there he is: Harry Potter, boy wizard, the chosen one. The adult voice on the video says: Those look good.

title: New York Today: A Day at the Races
description: With the Democratic runoff on Tuesday, New York City woke today to a presumed new public advocate, Letitia James.

title: Ah, Theres Nothing Like New Baby Smell
description: Nature provides plenty of reasons for parents to adore their newborns. The giant eyes, the adorable coos, the flawless skin.

title: SAP Ventures Raises $650 Million Fund
description: Seventeen years ago, SAP created a venture arm with the aim of gaining a toehold in promising new start-ups. Now that business is aiming to continue branching out from its parent company.

title: Mutiny Halts Italian Gambit by Berlusconi
description: ROME  He seemed stunned, if immaculately tailored in a dark suit that sheathed him like armor.

title: Louis Vuitton: Spring 2014 RTW
description: Paris

title: Obama Cancels Trip to Philippines and Malaysia
description: The White House announced on Wednesday that President Obama had canceled his trip next week to the Philippines and Malaysia because of the budget standoff in Washington. Secretary of State John Kerry will lead delegations to both countries, instead of Mr. Obama.

title: Citizen Journalism Grows in Indias War-Torn Tribal Belt
description: On an August afternoon, Mastram Ghosh, a lanky young man from Tikamgarh in the central Indian state of Madhya Pradesh, stood on Jantar Mantar Street near the Indian parliament in central Delhi. A huge crowd protesting an Indian government move to amend the countrys revolutionary Right to Information Act (R.T.I.) filled the street. Mr. Ghosh was reporting on the protests, shouting his dispatch on the phone to Central Gondwana Net Swara (CGNet Swara), a phone-based, rural community news provider in the tribal areas of central India.

title: Obama Sets Conditions for Talks: Pass Funding and Raise Debt Ceiling
description: WASHINGTON  In their first meeting since a budget impasse shuttered many federal operations, President Obama told Republican leaders on Wednesday that he would negotiate with them only after they agreed to the funding needed to reopen the government and also to an essential increase in the nations debt limit, without add-ons.

title: Marc Jacobs to Leave Louis Vuitton
description: PARIS  The fashion designer Marc Jacobs is leaving Louis Vuitton after 16 years to concentrate on his namesake line, according to Bernard Arnault, the chairman and chief executive of LVMH Mot Hennessy Louis Vuitton, which has a majority stake in Mr. Jacobss company.

title: Never Mind. Ill Find Someone Else.
description: Im not sure exactly what tipped me over the edge. Maybe it was the traffic on the way into work. Maybe it was the hour I wasted trying to get my printer to complete a scan over the wireless network. Or maybe it was just residual anger after receiving some shabby treatment from a colleague, a sales person and a job applicant  all of which led me to write a few honest e-mails to these malefactors. My first honesty-gram was directed at someone who owns a used furniture outfit nearby. He had asked me whether I could take a look at a damaged table that he had acquired and possibly repair and refinish it. Which led to the following exchange:

title: Daily Report: Lawsuit Accuses Google of Wiretapping in Gmail Scans
description: Wiretapping is typically the stuff of spy dramas and shady criminal escapades. But now one of the worlds biggest Web companies, Google, must defend itself against accusations that it is illegally wiretapping in the course of its everyday business  gathering data about Internet users and showing them related ads, Claire Cain Miller reports.

title: Russia Accuses Greenpeace Activists of Piracy
description: MOSCOW  Defying complaints from international human rights and environmental organizations, as well as the apparent wishes of President Vladimir V. Putin, Russian prosecutors brought piracy charges on Wednesday against 13 Greenpeace activists and a journalist who covered their protest.

title: Live Stream | Miu Miu Spring 2014 Collection at Paris Fashion Week
description: A live stream of the latest womens collection from Miu Miu at Paris fashion week, scheduled to go live at 2 p.m. local time, 8 a.m. Eastern Standard Time.

title: With Inflation Low, the European Central Bank Holds Rates Steady
description: PARIS  The European Central Bank left its benchmark interest rate unchanged at a record low on Wednesday, but indicated it was ready to take steps if needed to protect the euro zone from political turmoil in the United States.

title: Doctoroffs to Give University of Chicago Law School $5 Million
description: The University of Chicago Law School is expected to announce on Wednesday a $5 million gift to create a business leadership program.

title: Advice About  Sleep Deficiency in Midlife, Part 2
description: Orfeu Marcello Buxton, a neuroscientist, has been answering reader questions about sleep deficiency. More than 200 people sent questions (most can be read here).  Part 1 of his answers is here. [Update: Part 3 can be found here.] Because of the volume of questions, not all may be answered.

title: Shutdown Savings and the Debt Ceiling
description: Could the government shutdown now under way actually help avert, or at least delay, the much bigger threat of a debt default by Washington?

title: Wells Fargo Braces for Suit on Foreclosures
description: New Yorks attorney general is preparing a lawsuit against the nations largest home lender, Wells Fargo, accusing the bank of flouting the terms of a multibillion-dollar settlement aimed at stopping foreclosure abuses, Jessica Silver-Greenberg reports in DealBook. The lawsuit, which claims Wells Fargo violated the guidelines of last years agreement between five big banks and 49 state attorneys general, is expected to be filed as early as Wednesday.

title: Do These Pants Make My Rear End Look Flat?
description: Some of you may accuse me of navel-gazing with my latest problem, but as you will shortly see that is an anatomical impossibility: my behind has flattened out.

title: Back in Asia, Hagel Pursues Shift to Counter Chinas Goals in Pacific
description: SEOUL, South Korea  In the four years since he announced a shift in American foreign policy and defense strategy to counter Chinas ambitions in Asia, President Obama has found himself perpetually sidelined from his goals by a series of escalating conflicts in the Middle East and budget crises at home. A long-planned trip to the area has been cut back because of the government shutdown that began Tuesday.

description: Dear Diary:

title: Mark Hurd, Oracles Master Salesman, Wants Your Business
description: SAN FRANCISCO  Mark Hurd, co-president of the Oracle Corporation, has a big Starbucks coffee in a cold room in the Moscone Center. Thats how he likes a room, cold. Hes focused that way.

title: New Yorks Biggest Costume Party
description: Comic-book fans nearly cracked the Internet in half with reactions to the news that Ben Affleck would play the masked crusader in a forthcoming Superman/Batman film. Many of the impassioned, no matter their favorite Dark Knight (West, Keaton, Kilmer, Clooney or Bale), can be found at New York Comic Con. The four-day festival, which runs Oct. 10-13 in the Jacob K. Javits Convention Center in Manhattan, celebrates the dedicated writers and artists, passionate fans and, yes, the commerce of comics. The showroom gets densely packed and the lines for events extremely long, but the vibe remains upbeat and nerdily earnest, with double-takes from passers-by as Supermen, Captain Americas and Doctor Whos roam the nearby streets.

title: Image of the Day: October 2
Paris Fashion Week: Elements | Character
description: Explore the many characters of Paris Fashion Week.

title: Who Will Heal the Doctors?
description: In my previous column, I reported on the problem of widespread burnout among doctors and medical students  and I described a response that, in recent years, has spread to half the nations medical schools: a course called The Healers Art, created by a physician, Rachel Naomi Remen, to help doctors and students discover and reconnect to the deep meaning of their work and maintain their commitment for it. The article touched a sore spot. Hundreds of readers  patients, medical students, doctors and spouses and children of doctors among them  contributed comments describing their personal experiences, many of them raw with emotion.Some of the most poignant notes came from doctors themselves, and their words revealed a deep sense of betrayal.

title: In Test Project, N.S.A. Tracked Cellphone Locations
description: WASHINGTON  The National Security Agency conducted a secret pilot project in 2010 and 2011 to test the collection of bulk data about the location of Americans cellphones, but the agency never moved ahead with such a program, according to intelligence officials.

title: Case Against Greek Far-Right Party Draws Critics
description: NIKAIA, Greece  For over a year, 30 Kaisareias Street bustled with activity. Burly, black-clad members of the neo-fascist Golden Dawn party converted part of the nondescript white building into a headquarters, holding frequent meetings and fanning out for military-style neighborhood patrols armed with batons and heavy poles wrapped in the Greek flag.

title: Air France-KLM Could Aid a Struggling Alitalia
description: PARIS  The chief executive of Air France-KLM, the largest foreign shareholder in Alitalia, said on Wednesday that he had not ruled out the possibility of participating in a fresh bailout of the struggling Italian flagship carrier as it scrambles to produce a plan to shore up its dwindling cash reserves.

title: Buy Low, Sell High
description: My Its the Economy column for the next issue of The New York Times Magazine looks at one venue through which the financial crisis helped the rich get richer and simultaneously wounded the middle class: real estate.

title: Icelands Romance With Electric Cars on Display at a Wedding
description: REYKJAVIK, Iceland  Newlyweds may choose to depart the marriage ceremony in a horse-drawn carriage, a limousine or a classic car, but none of those seemed quite right to Tomas Kristjansson and his new wife, Berglind Anna Zoega, electric-car enthusiasts who exchanged vows at Reykjaviks postcard-worthy Hallgrimskirkja Church on Sept. 7.

title: Sea Change
description: Something Big,written by the Swiss author Sylvie Neeman and illustrated by Ingrid Godon, is an unusual book, both in look and content. Godon, a Belgian illustrator, uses oil pastels, mostly loden green, persimmon red and a pale teal, to sketch simple figures on a white background. Where a broader expanse of color is called for, she rubs the oils across the page. The effect is almost like something drawn by a child, but on a second look, far from artless.

title: House to Vote on Bills to Finance Parts of Government
description: WASHINGTON  The House on Wednesday will vote on bills to reopen national parks and museums, restart veterans programs, fund medical research, pay the National Guard and Reserves, and finance services in the District of Columbia.

title: The Landscape of Small-Business Health Insurance
description: Five years ago, a start-up called Liazon began offering businesses a new way to provide health insurance to employees. On Liazons Bright Choices, an online marketplace, a company can specify how much money it wants to spend on each employees benefits, and employees can use that contribution to buy the plan of their choice.

title: A Short History of the Highrise: Part 1
description: In the first episode of a four-part series, "Mud" traces the roots of the residential highrise, from the biblical Tower of Babel to New York's tenement buildings.

title: Re/Max Rises in Debut, While Empire State Trust Is Subdued
description: Updated, 4:24 p.m. | Stock market investors are showing an appetite for real estate  and discount coats.

title: Furloughed Employees Hold Shutdown Parties
description: On Tuesday evening, approximately 15 furloughed government employees gathered in the Port Tobacco, Md., home of Ashley Brincefield, a 29-year-old federal employee who works for Customs and Border Protection, for what Ms. Brincefield called a survive the government shutdown party.

title: Lew Renews Warning to Lawmakers About Default
description: WASHINGTON  With Congress engaged in an all-consuming fight over financing the government, Treasury Secretary Jacob J. Lew has implored legislators not to forget about the countrys debt ceiling, which needs to be raised in a matter of weeks to avoid what might be a financial market calamity.

title: Carnegie Hall Opening Gala Canceled Because of Stagehand Strike
description: They are among the highest-paid performers at Carnegie Hall, even though they do not play a note: they are the stagehands of Local 1, whose average total compensation of more than $400,000 a year is more than some of the halls top executives earn. Little happens on Carnegies stages without them.

title: Man Charged With False Report After Airport Closing
description: The Jacksonville International Airport in Florida was closed for several hours Tuesday evening after a man told an airport official he had a bomb in his bag. On Wednesday the man was charged with making a false report about planting a bomb, the authorities said.

title: Obama to Meet With Congressional Leaders at White House
description: WASHINGTON  On Wednesday, the second day of the government shutdown, President Obama summoned the Republican and Democratic leaders of Congress to the White House for an afternoon meeting to urge the passage of measures financing the government and increasing the nations borrowing limit  without extraneous add-ons like limiting his health care law.

title: Loeb Raises Stake in Sothebys and Seeks Board Seat
description: The activist investor Daniel S. Loeb said on Wednesday that he wanted to join the board of the auction house Sothebys and called for the chief executive to step down.

title: A Child Shocked by the Shutdown, and a Parent Who Would Like to Be
description: The federal government has blown my 12-year-olds mind.

title: Why Labeling Health Plans Gold, Silver or Bronze Doesnt Help
description: This week marks the somewhat limited debut of the health insurance exchanges established by the Affordable Care Act to help small businesses buy insurance for their employees. The Small Business Health Options exchanges, as they are known, went live on Tuesday, and businesses that go browsing  they wont be able to buy online until November  are discovering a new concept for comparing the offerings: metal levels.

title: Some Head Start Programs Close, and Others May Soon
description: The National Head Start Association estimates that nearly 19,000 children from low-income families have lost or are at risk of losing services in 11 states because of the government shutdown, according to its analysis  of the impact of the shutdown.

title: Paris Fashion Week: Valentino Spring/Summer 2014
description: Scenes from the Paris Fashion Week photo diary of Sonny Vandevelde.

title: More Patriotic Than Scrupulous
description: Today, many Civil War battlefields resemble sculpture gardens. Where soldiers once fought and died, monuments commemorate their battle-tested regiments. But what about those regiments that failed the test? No elaborate memorials celebrate the deeds of the 11th New York Heavy Artilleryand the reason is clear. In the summer and fall of 1863, the promising new unit fell apart, largely thanks to the ambitions of its officers.

title: The Nomads No Mans Land
description: FREE ZONE, Western Sahara  Some parts of the Sahara are more of a no mans land than others. The most extreme example is the so-called Free Zone, a strip in the Western Sahara, with territory occupied by Morocco to the west and Algeria to the east. Strewn with mines and inhabited by just a smattering of nomads, the area is controlled by the Polisario Front, a state in exile that has been based in refugee camps in southwestern Algeria since 1976, when Morocco annexed Western Sahara after Spains colonial forces withdrew.

title: James Whiteside Promoted to Principal Dancer at American Ballet Theater
description: James Whiteside  who created a stir dancing the roles of Romeo in Romeo and Juliet, Prince Siegfried in Swan Lake and Prince Dsir in The Sleeping Beauty since joining American Ballet Theater as a soloist last fall  is being promoted to principal dancer with the company, its artistic director, Kevin McKenzie, announced on Wednesday. Mr. Whiteside, who danced previously with Boston Ballet, was praised this year in The New York Times by the newspapers chief dance critic, Alastair Macaulay, who asked, What newcomer to New York has ever invaded a repertory more surely than James Whiteside? The promotion will take effect on Oct. 30  the night he is scheduled to dance the male lead of George Balanchines Theme and Variations at a gala to kick off the companys fall season at the David H. Koch Theater at Lincoln Center.

title: Readers Ask About Subsidies and Other Health Care Law Provisions
description: The Times is answering readers questions about the new health care exchanges in the Your Money column. The latest one covered many of the basics. You can find earlier installments on In Practice.If youre still not sure how the law affects you and your family, please e-mail your questions to tsbernard@nytimes.com.

title: Second Banksy Work Appears in New York After First Is Painted Over
description: A new work by Banksy, the elusive British street artist, typically earns a lot of attention. (And sometimes, despite the artists wishes, his works earn more tangible things.)

title: Tom Clancy Dies at 66
description: Mr. Clancys military novels made him one of the worlds best-selling and best-known authors.

title: Mick Mulvaneys Shutdown Message, Annotated
description: WASHINGTON  Representative Mick Mulvaney, Republican of South Carolina and one of the Houses most ardent conservatives, released a statement to his constituents this morning. Cutting through the Washington clutter, we offer an annotated version:

title: Like This Jacket, Honey?
description: LOVE MEANS NEVER having to get dressed alone. It means an eye you trust. It means the acceptance of a worldview and aesthetic other than your own. It means moving through life with the confidence that at least one other person cares as much about how you look as you do.

title: Arrest in U.S. Shuts Down a Black Market for Narcotics
description: Nearly everything about Silk Road was shrouded in secrecy.

title: Missed Opportunity in Syria Haunts U.N. Official
description: UNITED NATIONS  Locked in a disagreement with the Syrian government over access, the United Nations missed an opportunity six months ago to investigate the first suspected chemical weapons attack in that countrys civil war, the organizations top disarmament official said in an interview on Wednesday.

title: The Icing on the Cake
description: My mother lives in Scottsdale, Ariz., so packing for a summer 90th birthday visit was easy: Loose linen clothes, a sheet of baking parchment, and a three-ounce bar of Scharffen Berger bittersweet chocolate because my sister wasnt sure shed bought enough.

title: Updates Work, Except When They Dont
description: Your responses to the question of whether Shakespeare is best appreciated in productions that dress up the original plays in modern settings, or hew more closely to classical tradition, contained almost as many viewpoints as youd get if you gathered a hundred theater directors in a room and started them arguing.

title: Herms: Spring 2014 RTW
description: Paris

title: A Hotel Rewards Program for College Towns
description: Many families of college students will be heading to college towns across the country for visits during homecoming and parents weekends (not to mention four years of pickups and drop-offs), but choosing a hotel often involves a trade-off.

title: In Vienna, New Energy Amid Old-World Charm
description: In Viennas bohemian Seventh District, craftspeople, artists and shopkeepers are breathing new life into a handful of old cobblestone streets known as Spittelberg. Steps from the MuseumsQuartier, the citys museum district, the neighborhood overflows with Old World charm and hidden garden restaurants. It wasnt always picturesque. Named after a hospital built here in the 1500s, the hill filled in over the centuries with low-rent housing, taverns and brothels. By the 1970s, the red light district was headed for demolition, but locals insisted on preservation instead. Restored Biedermeier buildings on pedestrian lanes now house galleries, boutiques, bars and restaurants. With summer tourists gone, Viennese enjoy strolling and dining outside on pleasant autumn evenings.

title: Finding Inspiration Through Exploration
description: He was a rebel  no question about that, Sven-Olof Lindblad, founder of Lindblad Expeditions, said of his father, Lars-Eric.

title: Hotel Review: The Reeds at Shelter Haven in Stone Harbor, N.J.
description: Rates

title: Excerpt: 'The Michael J. Fox Show'
description: The NBC series stars Mr. Fox as a news anchor with Parkinson's disease returning from a medical hiatus.

title: For Sale: Brownstone Tied to the Revival of Brooklyn
description: The beginning of the end for the brownstone at 272 Berkeley Place in Park Slope  as far as the legions of admirers it welcomed for decades are concerned  came in 2006, when Evelyn Ortner, its co-owner and chief preserver, died of breast cancer. The houses other owner, her husband, Everett, died last year. And two weeks ago, after being denuded of many of the Ortners books, knickknacks and papers from five decades of Brooklyn boosterism, their house was put up for sale.

title: White House Enlists Business Leaders to Pressure Republicans
description: WASHINGTON  The Obama administration mounted a full-court press on Wednesday to enlist the nations business leaders to pressure Congressional Republicans to agree to finance the government and increase the nations borrowing limit without demanding other measures in exchange.

title: Get Back, and Just Let Miley Cyrus Grow Up
description: Enough already. Enough with the nose-in-the-air repudiations and the false moral panics. Enough of the finger pointing and the slut shaming. Enough with the using of Miley Cyrus as a punching bag.

title: As Demand Stays High, Officials Try to Address Problems in Exchanges
description: Federal and state officials moved Wednesday to strengthen the computer underpinnings of the new online health exchanges, which proved inadequate to handle a flood of consumer inquiries that began as soon as the system opened on Tuesday and continued into the next day.

title: 1890: Commuter Rage
description: On Feb. 16, 1890, The New York Herald reported on the accident-ridden journey of a certain Mrs. Lanarkshire and her daughter, who:

title: For Laurel and Hardy Fans, a Club With Plenty of Guffaws
description: The cookies were laid out on paper plates, a 70-year-old print of The Chimp was threaded into the aging film projector, and the Sons of the Desert were filing into the Players Club on Gramercy Park South on a recent weeknight.

title: Technology Firm From India Will Be New York Marathon Title Sponsor
description: The New York City Marathon sponsor ING will end its decade-long relationship with the race and be replaced by Tata Consultancy Services, the Indian technology giant, race organizers said Wednesday.

title: Wheelies: The Help Me Hyundai Edition
description: In which we bring you motoring news from around the Web:

title: On Park Avenue South, a Layout for a Photographer
description: For nine years Andrew Matusik, a fashion photographer, lived and worked in a Chelsea rental.

title: App Smart: D.J. Apps
description: Kit Eaton reviews Edjing, DJ Studio 5 and Party Monster, three apps aimed at mobile users looking to mix music on the go.

title: Paris Fashion Week: Louis Vuitton Spring/Summer 2014
description: Scenes from the Paris Fashion Week photo diary of Sarah Aubel.

title: Getting a Party Started With D.J. Apps
description: At my university, a friend decided to learn to be a disc jockey, for fun. She was talented, learned fast and became one of my universitys most popular D.J.s. If I had tried to learn that skill, it would have taken me a long time, I know. But the world has advanced and your smartphone and tablet can manage a lot of the tasks of mixing music for you  whether youre a real D.J. or just a musical amateur keen to liven up a party.

title: Health Care Panic, Again
description: Eduardo Porter is getting a lot of attention for his piece in todays paper suggesting that what Republicans fear most is that Obamacare might succeed. He deserves it: its a very good piece. But I guess Im surprised that so many people seem to find this a surprising and new insight. I thought it was obvious. Heres a column I wrote back in July predicting more or less what is now happening, for exactly the reason Porter gives: GOP panic over the prospect of successful health reform.

title: Like a Tom Clancy Novel
description: Tom Clancy, who died on Tuesday, was so popular  17 of his novels were No. 1 New York Times best sellersthat his name meant something even to people who had never read a word of his work, a rare achievement for a contemporary writer. His name was a byword signifying spies, military equipment and covert plots against the American government.

title: In San Francisco, 3 Days of Shopping for $106
description: San Francisco is not, generally speaking, known for its egg coddlers.

title: Reid Says Hell Negotiate Once House Drops Demands
description: WASHINGTON  Senator Harry Reid of Nevada, the majority leader, called House Speaker John A.
