description: Rufus Norris, a veteran theater director, is to replace Nicholas Hytner as director of Londons National Theater, the theater announced on Tuesday.

title: Export Fair in China Loses Steam
description: GUANGZHOU, China  With nearly as much floor space as five McCormick Places in Chicago, the sprawling Canton Fair, which opened in Guangzhou Tuesday morning, is a monument to Chinas industrial versatility and export prowess.

title: Assessing a Businesss Mistakes in a Case of Credit Card Fraud
description: At the most recent She Owns It business group meeting, the owners talked about protecting their businesses from credit card fraud.

title: SoftBank Buys 51% of Finnish Mobile Game Maker for $1.5 Billion
description: Updated, 3:27 p.m. |

title: Busting Chinas Bloggers
description: BEIJING  A frequent topic of conversation among my friends here has been: Who will be arrested next?

title: Britain Aims to Ease the Way for Chinese Banks in London
description: LONDON  The British government announced a plan on Tuesday that was intended to make it easier for Chinese banks to do business in London as part of an expanded effort to make the city a global center for investing and trading Chinas currency.

title: Intersection: Free Style in Tel Aviv
description: In Tel Aviv's Jaffa neighborhood, Tmima Svitelman, an accountant, embraces an older eclectic style inspired by the area's famous flea market.

title: More Ugly Disagreements
description: Its been barely a month since my last litany of subject-verb agreement errors, but the file is overflowing once again. The topic is tedious, the errors exasperating. Readers notice and find it hard to understand why we make so many rather rudimentary mistakes. A good question.

title: My Face Is Stuck in the 70s
description: I dont wear makeup, and by that I dont mean what most women mean when they make that claim, which is that they dont wear much  make-up.

title: In Performance: Eric Bogosian of 100 (Monologues)
description: In this weeks video, the Obie Award-winning playwright Eric Bogosian performs an excerpt from his show 100 (Monologues), a collection of scenes from his popular one-man shows from the 1980s and 90s, including Sex, Drugs, Rock & Roll and Pounding Nails in the Floor With My Forehead. The monologues, which are also in a new book, will differ at each performance.

title: Art Matters | A Treasure Trove of Decorative Arts Goes to Auction
description: The illustrious Art Deco dealer Flix Marcilhac is selling off his own collection of treasures.

title: Senators Restart Talks as Default Looms
description: WASHINGTON  With the federal government on the brink of a default, a House Republican effort to end the shutdown and extend the Treasurys borrowing authority collapsed Tuesday night as a major credit agency warned that the United States was on the verge of a costly ratings downgrade.

title: Citigroup Hurt by Lower Fixed-Income Trading
description: Updated, 8:46 p.m. | Grappling with a tepid mortgage market and a broad slowdown in its fixed-income business, Citigroup reported disappointing third-quarter earnings growth on Tuesday.

title: One Song (Royals). Six Takes.
description: Val Haller, a music-obsessed baby boomer and the founder of the Web site Valslist.com, matches tracks from her generation to those of her 20-something sons generation.

title: Victim Becomes a Cycling Samaritan
description: Dear Diary:

title: No Consensus on JPMorgans Chief
description: As JPMorgan Chases legal woes have mounted, some in the pundit class have called for Jamie Dimon, the banks chief executive and chairman, to pay with his job. Yet there is an almost bizarre disconnect between the headlines and what the people who matter  the investors, analysts, board members and, yes, even regulators  are seeking. None of them want him fired, Andrew Ross Sorkin writes in the DealBook column.

title: Getting the Fed to Explain Itself Better
description: Jared Bernstein is a senior fellow at the Center on Budget and Policy Priorities in Washington and a former chief economist to Vice President Joseph R. Biden Jr.

title: House Outlines Plan on Spending and Debt Limit
description: WASHINGTON  House Republicans on Tuesday put forward the outline of a response to a Senate proposal that would end the government shutdown and raise the debt limit into next year, but would also make some changes to the health care law.

title: A Day to Remember the First Computer Programmer Was a Woman
description: In 1842, Ada Lovelace, known as the enchantress of numbers, wrote the first computer program.

title: Barclays Compliance Chief to Take Leave of Absence
description: LONDON  Barclays said on Tuesday that Hector W. Sants, the banks compliance chief and a former head of Britains financial regulator, would take a leave of absence because of exhaustion and stress.

title: Unclear Whether Plan Has Backing From Republicans
description: WASHINGTON  It was far from clear whether enough House Republicans, a group that is deeply divided over raising the debt ceiling at all, would get behind the plan.

title: Today in Small Business: 12 Angry Women
description: Whats affecting me, my clients and other small-business owners today.

title: Supreme Court to Hear Challenge to E.P.A. Rules on Gas Emissions
description: WASHINGTON  The Supreme Court on Tuesday agreed to hear a major case challenging Environmental Protection Agency regulations of greenhouse gas emissions from stationary sources like power plants. The justices declined to hear a variety of related attacks on the agencys authority to address climate change.

title: Fictional Smash Musical Hit List Will Get Real-Life Debut
description: Fans of the NBC musical comedy-drama Smash  they were out there, and you know who you are  were bereft when this ratings-challenged series was canceled last spring, leaving audiences forever in the dark about the future of its roster of fictional Broadway stars and striving performers.

title: Dear Twitter, Please Like This
description: Social media Web sites sure do like to copy one another. Facebook adopted the hashtag and follow features from Twitter. Twitter knocked off fancier profile pages from Facebook. Instagram added Twitters @-symbol. Twitter introduced filters after Instagram.

title: A Little Bit Pregnant: The Numbers Game
description: They say you cant be a little pregnant, but apparently thats not true for IVF patients, where half the work is already done: the embryo has been placed inside your uterus; its job is to implant for you to be considered pregnant. But getting those two pink lines on the pregnancy test stick is not the same as actually having a viable pregnancy  a euphemism for a live, healthy baby.

title: A Push to Sell Testosterone Gels Troubles Doctors
description: The barrage of advertisements targets older men. Have you noticed a recent deterioration of your ability to play sports? Do you have a decrease in sex drive? Do you have a lack of energy?

title: Aston Martin Shops for High-Flying Customers
description: Aston Martins dont fly in quite the same way that Learjets do, but the maker of high-end sports cars hopes to appeal to the same crowd. Thats how I, a writer who normally covers the aviation industry, found myself plodding along the Henry Hudson Parkway last week in a $200,000 Aston Martin DB9 Volante.

title: Fey and Poehler to Host Golden Globes for 2 More Years
description: At least in the case of hosts, the Golden Globes organizers know a hit when they see one, so they jumped at the chance to bring back Tina Fey and Amy Poehler to headline their annual awards show for the next two years.

title: Think Back: The Republican Insurgency
description: One of the major conflicts in American politics occurs within a single party. The Timess Sam Tanenhaus explains how the fight between establishment conservatives and insurgents has shaped the G.O.P.

title: CMJ: The Deluge Begins
description: Just look for the guitar cases in being toted in midafternoon on Ludlow Street on the Lower East Side. As sure as autumn leaves or candy corn, they are the sign of an October ritual: the CMJ Music Marathon, five days and nights of band showcases that starts Tuesday in New York City, centered on the Lower East Side and Williamsburg.

title: Listen Up | Cut Copys Billboard-Topping Strategy
description: To announce their fourth record, Free Your Mind (out Nov. 5 on Loma Vista/Modular), the Australian dance-rockers Cut Copy decided to forgo the usual marketing approach. Putting a song up on YouTube seemed like a bit of anticlimax, said Tim Hoey, the groups guitarist and sampling maestro. Instead, they unveiled a multimedia campaign that began on Sept. 6, when they put up billboards emblazoned only with the words free your mind in six far-flung locations around the globe: a small town in South Wales, the mountains of Chile, Mexico City, Detroit, a California desert and a village in the Australian outback.

title: The GOP Tax
description: Macroeconomic Advisers has a new report out about the effects of bad fiscal policy since 2010  that is, since the GOP takeover of the House. The way its written, however, might confuse some people. They say that combined effects of uncertainty in the bond market and cuts in discretionary spending have subtracted 1% from GDP growth. Thats not 1% off GDP  its the annualized rate of growth, so that were talking about almost 3% of GDP at this point; cumulatively, the losses come to around $700 billion of wasted economic potential. This is in the same ballpark as my own estimates.

title: Battling Cancer in Taiwan, a Popular Microblogger Comes Under Attack in Beijing
description: Kai-Fu Lee, the former head of Google China, has nearly 52 million followers on Sina Weibo, Chinas Twitter equivalent, and over a million on Twitter itself. He is an immensely popular speaker on the university lecture circuit in China; a celebrity who has criticized censorship on Chinas heavily censored Internet; a Big V, for verified Weibo personality, in this Weibo-mad country. In fact, hes one of the biggest of the Big Vs, with only four others, all movie stars, with larger followings.

title: Wheelies: The Anchorman Edition
description: http://www.youtube.com/watch?feature=player_embedded&v=SC_Up3zrKjE

title: Policy and the G.O.P. Civil War
description: Late last week, as the G.O.P. descended ever-deeper into civil war, Matt Yglesias and Jonathan Chait both had pieces up marveling at the absence of any actual policy disagreement between the populists driving the shutdown and the establishment/leadership/Senate Republicans trying to find a way out. Intra-party schisms are usually rooted in policy, Chait wrote, but mainstream Republicans and the tea party have fallen out almost entirely over political tactics. Yglesias agreed, contrasting the partys split on foreign policy, where theres a big substantive gap between the Rand Paul/Justin Amash/Mike Lee libertarian wing and the more hawkish old guard, with the purely tactical split on economic policy:

title: Republican Leaders Back Off New Plan
description: WASHINGTON  House Republican leaders struggled on Tuesday to devise a new proposal to reopen the government and alter parts of the presidents health care law after a plan presented behind closed doors to the Republican rank and file failed to attract enough support immediately to pass.

title: In Our Pages: October 16
description: 1913 Trapped Miners Found Dead

title: As Panthers Shed Caution, a Rebound May Take Shape
description: We will have to check back in three months for the final answer, but there are signs that the Carolina Panthers, a disappointment at 2-3, could become one of the N.F.L.s breakout teams.

title: Where Is the Great American Novel by a Woman?
description: Each week in Bookends, two writers take on pressing and provocative questions about the world of books. This week, Jennifer Szalai and Mohsin Hamid challenge notions of what makes certain literature great.

title: Bond Traders Shift Bets With Political Wind
description: Updated, 4:48 p.m. |

title: Five On The Floor
description: Were coming up on the fifth anniversary of an important moment: the point at which US interest rates hit the zero lower bound, and we entered a liquidity trap. Five years! Yet many people, even many economists, are still in denial over what that means.

title: Exploring Dick Cheneys Spiritual Side
description: In this past weekends issue, Peter Baker, the chief White House correspondent for The Times and a contributing writer for the magazine, wrote about the final confrontation between George W. Bush and Dick Cheney. It was adapted from his book, Days of Fire: Bush and Cheney in the White House, to be published by Doubleday on Oct. 22.

title: Escalating War of Words in Tire Deal
description: Apollo Tyres still wants to acquire Cooper Tire and Rubber. It just wants to have a little chat about the agreed-on $2.5 billion price.

title: Lawyer Leaves Williams & Connolly to Start Sports Firm
description: James L. Tanner Jr., a lawyer at the Washington law firm Williams & Connolly whose N.B.A. clients include Tim Duncan, Jeremy Lin and Shane Battier, has left to form his own sports management company.

title: The Gun Report: October 15, 2013
description: Eight-eight people have been shot in Providence, R.I., so far this year, a city with a population of 178,432. An investigation conducted by The Providence Journal has calculated the cost of this violence, and its findings are presented this week in a three-part series, The Cost of a Bullet.

title: A Crisp, Assertive White for a Bracing Sauce
description: While the technique for marinating this chicken may be vaguely northern Indian, the spicing is not, except for the lively bitterness of the lime zest. The dominant flavor comes from the basil, particularly if you pour more green sauce over your cooked chicken.

title: The Real Rebels of the Civil War
description: War is always accompanied by a battle for truth, and combatants for truth wield language as their weapon. In the Civil War, words were often misused. Connotations changed. Strictly speaking, it wasnt even a civil war, since the battle was not about who would control the entire United States, but whether part of the country could secede.

title: Edited Viral Video Used for Motivation at Apple
description: It may be true that imitation is the sincerest form of flattery. But a popular filmmaker in New York was not flattered when he learned that part of his movie had been recut and used as a motivational video for Apple employees.

title: T FALL DESIGN
description: The unrestrained glitz and urbane glamour of the 1970s jet set has re-emerged as a sophisticated staple of contemporary design.

title: Republican Says House May Be Forced into Senate Plan
description: WASHINGTON  Representative Adam Kinzinger, Republican of Illinois, said that if House Republicans could not rally behind the proposal their leadership rolled out Tuesday morning, they would probably be forced to accept the plan taking shape in the Senate  something many Republican House members have already said is unacceptable.

title: The Watchful Years, Before the Howling Began
description: Long before Allen Ginsberg became the benevolent, bearded Buddha of the counterculture  and one of the most beloved American poets  he was a skinny, anxious Columbia freshman who fell in with a group of literary rebels. John Krokidass debut feature, Kill Your Darlings, is intent on studying these not-yet-Beats in their fledgling state, as they write the first drafts of their own legends.

title: Democracy After the Shutdown
description: Heres the question we should be asking ourselves right now: What next?

title: Bipartisan Group Could Demand Action on Senate Plan
description: House Democrats, along with one moderate House Republican, met Tuesday morning with the chief negotiators of a bipartisan Senate deal to reopen the government, signaling movement to force the plan to a vote in the House if it passes the Senate.

title: Negative Initial Market Reaction to Changes at Top of Burberry
description: Burberrys executive makeover leaves the British apparel maker with plenty to prove. Angela Ahrendts, chief executive of the $11 billion fashion house, is leaving next year to run Apples retail operation. News of her departure lopped 4.5 percent off Burberry shares on Tuesday morning.

title: The N.S.A. May Have Your Address Book
description: I long ago lost track of the number of times the Obama administration has assured everyone that its vacuum-cleaner approach to electronic surveillance does not threaten the privacy or the rights of Americans. In her column today, Sylvie Kauffman of the French newspaper Le Monde, one of our new Op-Ed contributors, recalled this quote from President Obama: With respect to the Internet and e-mails, this does not apply to U.S. citizens and it does not apply to people living in the United States.

title: E.U. Takes Final Step on Unified Bank Regulation
description: LUXEMBOURG  The European Union on Tuesday took another step to shore up its battered banking sector after Britain agreed to new rules placing many of the largest lenders in the euro area under the supervision of the European Central Bank.

title: Annual Enrollment for Medicare Opens
description: If you have health insurance through Medicare, the federal health care program for those 65 and older, your annual open enrollment period  the time when you can change your coverage  starts today and runs through Dec. 7. Choices you make now will take effect Jan. 1.

title: A Closer Look at the Reinsurance Fee
description: Though a tax on medical devices has been a point of contention in the negotiations over the fiscal standoff, the Senate proposal that would end the government shutdown and raise the debt limit is likely to include instead a one-year delay of another tax associated with the Affordable Care Act  the so-called reinsurance tax, which employers pay.

title: Paying a Premium for the Leica Name
description: The new Leica C point-and-shoot camera has a restrained elegance and the Leica logo, which speaks to a rich heritage of imagery from photographic greats like Henri Cartier-Bresson.

title: Collins Says Senate Must Press On
description: WASHINGTON  With a House proposal to end the fiscal standoff in limbo, Senator Susan Collins, Republican of Maine, said the Senate had to press forward with a bipartisan plan to reopen the government and avert a default, and then hope a strong vote will force Speaker John A. Boehners hand.

title: Ex-Mayor of San Diego Pleads Guilty to Charges of Sexual Harassment
description: SAN DIEGO  Bob Filner, the former San Diego mayor forced out of office in a storm of sexual harassment allegations, pleaded guilty on Tuesday to a series of false imprisonment and battery charges involving three women.

title: The Impasse Over Liability Clause in Indo-U.S. Nuclear Deal
description: Following Prime Minister Manmohan Singhs visit to the White House last month, President Obama announced that the first commercial agreement between an American company and India had been achieved. The details of this agreement reportedly worth just $16 million  are more modest than Mr. Obamas rosy language might suggest. Some propriety information will be transferred from Westinghouse to the public-sector Indian Nuclear Power Corporation, but the signing of a reactor contract remains a long distance away.

title: States Begin to Open National Parks
description: Several national parks and attractions that had been closed because of the government shutdown have reopened this week, after the Department of the Interior and the National Park Service gave state officials approval to use state funds and, in some cases, donations from local corporations, to run the facilities, The Associated Press reported.On Saturday, Grand Canyon National Park saw its first tourists since it closed on Oct. 1; on Sunday, the Statue of Liberty welcomed visitors again; and on Monday, Mount Rushmore followed suit. Other states have joined them, including Utah, which committed $1.67 million to reopen five national parks for a 10-day period that began on Friday.

title: Seeing Colorados Sights, After the Deluge
description: Colorados tourism industry has suffered a one-two punch this fall. After floods and landslides that began on Sept. 11 inundated the area near Rocky Mountain National Park, the government shutdown, which began on Oct. 1, forced it to close.

title: A Reno Neighborhood Drinks in Style
description: As Nevadas second city, Reno was once a boomtown of gambling, vice and quickie divorces. The city struggled as tribal casinos proliferated in neighboring California in the last decade, sapping the demand for just-across-state-lines slot machines and blackjack tables. Never as cosmopolitan as its Biggest Little City motto suggests, Reno has long had a night life dominated by second-rate casinos, strip clubs and the diviest of dive bars. Those days, however, are disappearing.

title: Study Finds Wives Often Struggle With Stepchildren Over Caregiving
description: Her husbands dementia worsens. Bills are piling up, and knotty daily and long-term decisions must be confronted. The wife is exhausted, overwhelmed, lonely. She needs support from the family. So she turns to the adult children  his, from a previous marriage.

title: For Some, an Appliance; for Others, Art
description: You may not remember (or have been alive) when electric mixers came with pea-shelling attachments and had atomic-bomb styling or fins like those on classic cars. Yet a surprising number of them are still purring and whirring on kitchen counters today, thanks to an enthusiastic community of collectors.

title: Prospect of U.S. Default Keeps European Business on Edge
description: FRANKFURT  Businesspeople around the world are generally a pro-American lot. But there is rising concern among them that, even if the White House and Congress find a way out of their debt-ceiling impasse in the coming hours or days, the world economy may suffer damage that may not be so easy to reverse.

title: Thinking the Unthinkable in London
description: LONDON  Like many people, professional investors here do not really think the United States will default on its debt.

title: Boehner Says No Decision Is Reached
description: As the government shutdown continues, Speaker John A. Boehner said Tuesday that talks between the two parties were still under way and no decisions had been reached.

title: Invitation to a Dialogue: When Doctors Slip Up
description: To the Editor:

title: Image of the Day: October 15
Romrio, a World Cup Champion, Is Now a World Cup Dissenter
description: RIO DE JANEIRO  He has never been like the others. It is not his way. When Romrio de Souza Faria was a boy playing soccer on the streets of Jacarezinho, he dominated the neighborhood pickup game, the pelada, day after day after day. When he became a star for club and country, he sometimes arrived for training in a helicopter. When his career was at its peak and he became an icon throughout the world, he reveled in a social life so rambunctious that he once said, If I dont go out at night, I dont score.

title: Second Medal of Honor for 2009 Afghan Battle
description: WASHINGTON  President Obama on Tuesday awarded the militarys highest honor for valor to a former Army captain who battled through an ambush in Afghanistan despite failing to receive the air and artillery support he had requested.

title: Faces of Breast Cancer: A Global Community
description: This year more than 1.4 million women around the world will learn they have breast cancer. The disease is the biggest cancer killer of women in developed regions like North America and Europe as well as the developing world, like Africa, where many women are diagnosed at a late stage of the disease.

title: Happy Birthday to Us: The Learning Network Blog Turns Four
description: On Oct. 15, 2009, The Learning Network, which began as a New York Times sub-site in 1998, was reborn as a blog.

title: By Design | Sourcing Ralph Laurens Home Collection
description: The Old World artisans and ateliers that Ralph Lauren has sourced around the globe to produce the fine detail work for his fashion collections are often the very same ones he calls on to produce his furniture line.

title: Conservatives Look to End Health Contributions for Congress Members and Staff
description: A group of House Republican conservatives met midday on Tuesday to discuss an acceptable alternative to a House proposal to reopen the government that was abandoned earlier in the day for lack of support.

title: Simple Syrup
description: Melissa Clark discovers this cocktail staple is anything but simple after visiting with Joaqun Sim, the co-owner of Pouring Ribbons in the East Village.

title: Simple Syrup Can Add More Than Sweetness to the Mix
description: The Restaurant Takeaway column is devoted to restaurant dishes you can make in your own kitchen, tested and tweaked for home cooks.

title: Citigroups Meager Returns
description: Citigroup, under Michael L. Corbat, has taken a step backward. The banks chief executive ends his first year in charge with third-quarter earnings below estimates and a meager 6.4 percent return on equity. Granted, markets over the summer were hardly amenable. But the breaks Citi got elsewhere make the banks overall performance look that much worse.

title: Children With Learning Disabilities Dont Need More Opportunity to Fail
description: We want to see what your child can really do, the teachers tell us in the eighth-grade parent orientation meeting.

title: Where Theres Smoke
description: World Cup qualifying is almost done. If England wins its match against Poland today, it gets to play in Brazil next summer. Then it can start asking what it has to do to be truly competitive with the worlds top soccer nations, teams like Spain and Germany and Italy. If England doesnt win today, it will almost certainly have to go through a difficult, last-ditch playoff next month. Then, no matter how things turn out  Brazil or staycation  it can start asking what it has to do to be truly competitive with the worlds top soccer nations, teams like Argentina and Brazil.

title: An iPhone Case That Doubles as a Charger
description: If you are the sort of person who is always short a charging block and cable, the PocketPlug may be just what you are looking for.

title: Felony Counts for 2 in Suicide of Bullied 12-Year-Old
description: MIAMI  For the Polk County sheriffs office, which has been investigating the cyberbullying suicide of a 12-year-old Florida girl, the Facebook comment was impossible to disregard.

title: For Cruises, a Week of Sales and Perks
description: Autumn has barely whispered hello, and the cruise industry is at the ready, with visions of warm Christmases and travelers sipping drinks adorned with mini-umbrellas.

title: Dan Zanes to Help Brooklyn Conservatory Connect With Kids
description: Conservatories normally focus their efforts on training the already talented, transforming them from promising young musicians to polished players able to build careers. The Brooklyn Conservatory of Music has long been interested in moving back the starting point and broadening its reach: the school says that it serves 15,000 people through instruction, music therapy and concerts.

title: Arrest Is Made in Dry Ice Explosions at Los Angeles Airport
description: Last Update, Wednesday, 1:04 p.m. Police in Los Angeles arrested a 28-year-old airport worker in connection with the dry-ice devices that exploded in an employee restroom at Los Angeles International Airport on Sunday night and near an aircraft on Monday.

title: Weekly News Quiz | Oct. 8  15, 2013
description: Answer the 10 questions below to see what you know about the people and events making news this week.

title: Trucks and Architecture: Fords Design Chief Chats With Architects
description: The pickup wars seem to be at their peak, or close to it. Ford, General Motors and Chrysler duked it out at the Texas state fair recently, unveiling even more chrome trim and special model options.

title: Irans Foreign Minister Invokes 9/11 Attack to Argue for Collective Security
description: Before the start of talks on Irans nuclear program in Geneva on Tuesday, the Iranian foreign minister, Mohammad Javad Zarif, referred to what he called a lesson of the terrorist attacks in the United States on Sept. 11, 2001 in an interview with NBC News.

title: Yellen on Long-Term Unemployment
description: Janet L. Yellen addresses long-term unemployment at the 2013 National Association for Business Economics Policy Conference.

title: House Republicans Look to Vote on New Bill
description: House Republican leaders rushed out a new proposal Tuesday afternoon that would reopen the federal government through Dec. 15, extend the governments borrowing authority until Feb. 7 and eliminate government contributions to all lawmakers, White House officials and their staff, who must already purchase health insurance on the health care laws insurance exchanges.

title: Le Bilboquet Reappears, and More Restaurant Openings
description: Headliner

title: Holiday Weekend Gives Broadway Shows a Lift
description: The producers of several hit Broadway shows capitalized on audience demand over the Columbus Day weekend, selling more premium-priced tickets than usual  at costs of up to $477 a seat  and breaking box-office records in some cases.

title: Coming Tonight: Fact-Checking the Debate
description: The New York Timess political unit will be live-blogging the first televised debate between the two leading candidates for New York City mayor: Bill de Blasio, a Democrat, and Joseph J. Lhota, a Republican. Throughout the 60-minute debate, we will be illuminating the shades of truth and exaggeration in what the candidates say, and calling out any inaccuracies or out-and-out howlers in the assertions they make.

title: Signs of Affection, or Not, at the Old Ballgame
description: Rules of grammar need not be obeyed. Sloppy penmanship and cornpone humor are welcome. The bigger the better.

title: Living in Bound Brook, N.J.
description: This low-lying riverside community, with roots dating to the Revolutionary War era, has benefited from recent investment in a flood abatement system.

title: In Bound Brook, Reaching a Truce With Floodwaters
description: To some New Jerseyans devastated a year ago by Hurricane Sandy, locales inland may have seemed enviably safe. But storms take many forms and can strike anywhere. Although Sandy wasnt seriously damaging to Bound Brook, 35 miles southwest of New York City and 40 in from the potentially punishing surf of the Jersey Shore, the same could not be said of Hurricane Floyd, an entirely different kind of storm, when it hit in 1999.

title: The Frenzy and Swagger of Chinas Restaurant Scene
description: A handful of standout restaurants from Shanghai, Beijing and Hong Kong.

title: U.S. Ends Panamas World Cup Run and Saves Mexico
description: It was the perfect end to a bizarre day of World Cup qualifying: the United States saved Mexico.

title: Ultra Dining at Ultraviolet
description: At the restaurant Ultraviolet in Shanghai, the chef Paul Pairet has taken dining and turned it into theater, adding ambient music, unorthodox utensils and enhancing scent.

title: Carey Mulligan Favors the Brighter Side of Autumn
description: The Girl: The actress glowed in a sunny yellow strapless matte silk and wool crepe dress at the premiere of her new film Inside Llewyn Davis today at the 57th BFI London Film Festival.

title: A Push to End Securities Fraud Lawsuits Gains Momentum
description: A group of pro-corporate forces has begun a behind-the-scenes fight at the Supreme Court. You may not have heard about it, but it could just end shareholders ability to sue companies for securities fraud.

title: Top Earners Recover Their Losses, and Then Some
description: FOR most Americans, the economy over the last 10 years has felt like a slog interrupted by a punch: the recession came amid years of stagnation. But for Americas top earners, the experience has been more like whiplash: a boom followed by a bust followed by a boom.

title: Through Yahoo Earnings, a Window Into Alibabas Performance
description: Want to know how the Alibaba Group is doing, as the Chinese Internet giant moves forward with its potentially enormous initial public offering?

title: Seeing Its Own Money at Risk, China Rails at U.S.
description: WASHINGTON  China has become shrill in its criticism of the fiscal train wreck in the United States, arguing that the answer to a potential government default is to begin creating a de-Americanized world. Beijings alarm is understandable, given that it is the worlds largest investor in American public debt, with at least $1.3 trillion in holdings.

title: Menu-Inspired Note Cards, Manchego Cheese and More
description: To Send: A Line of Printed Products Borrows From the Past

title: Captured in Libya, 1998 Bombing Suspect Pleads Not Guilty in a Manhattan Court
description: A reputed Al Qaeda operative who was recently captured in Libya made his first public appearance on Tuesday in a packed courtroom in Manhattan, seeming far more dour and haggard than defiant.

title: Chinas Dining Acrobatics
description: SHANGHAI  Some restaurants place you close to the surf, its perfume in the air and its music in your ears, while others nestle you in the woods. Some put you next to the Seine, others beside aquariums bursting with tropical colors.

title: Intel Reports Earnings Drop as Its Industry Changes
description: SAN FRANCISCO  This used to be Intels world. Now Intel just lives in it, hopefully at a solid profit.

title: Fantasy Football Week 7: Mining for Waiver Wire Gold
description: Each waiver wire week seems to have a different theme (running backs benched for fumbling, little-known players having huge games, a change in starting quarterbacks, free agents signed off the street), and this weeks theme is injured starters.

title: Boehners Last Stand
description: The nature of Speaker John Boehners final battle with the White House on the budget crisis is now clear: It doesnt matter what House Republicans win in exchange for raising the debt ceiling and re-opening government, as long as they win something.

title: Sondheim Working on a Revised Version of Company
description: The acclaimed composer Stephen Sondheim and the Tony Award-winning director John Tiffany (Once) are collaborating on a major revision of Mr. Sondheims celebrated 1970 musical Company, a project that Roundabout Theater Company is eyeing for a possible production, according to Mr. Sondheim and others involved.

title: Pictures of the Day: Washington and Elsewhere
description: Photos from Washington, Italy, Russia and India.

title: Traveling Through Time to Fight Witchcraft Mania
description: Work, God and his book, violence and fear: these made up the staple diet of most of the residents of Salem, Mass., back in the Puritan way back. At least they do in Adriano Shaplins tart but overloaded play Sarah Flood in Salem Mass, at the Flea Theater.

title: Developers End Fight Blocking 2 More Luxury Towers in Midtown
description: The transformation of a once dowdy stretch of 57th Street into Billionaires Row reached new heights on Tuesday, as two of New York Citys leading developers reached a truce that paves the way for two more ultraluxury towers on the northern edge of Midtown.

title: The Agony of an Artists Commitment
description: The brutally austere films of the French director Bruno Dumont scrutinize human behavior with a chilly, quasi-scientific detachment that borders on misanthropy. His characters are pitiable creatures whose baser instincts are in conflict with their spiritual aspirations. The sexual couplings in his movies are anti-romantic; his lovers rut like farm animals.

title: BlackBerry Breaks Silence in Open Letter
description: OTTAWA  Weeks after announcing that it was up for sale and soon after announcing a $1 billion quarterly loss, BlackBerry broke its silence on Tuesday to allay growing concerns about the companys future.

title: Ad Share Slips Again at Yahoo
description: SAN FRANCISCO  The honeymoon is over.

title: Khe-Yo and Whiskey Soda Lounge Ny
description: Inside two new places that are turning New Yorkers on to Asian dishes that might have been treated with extreme caution not long ago.

title: Carson, as Seen by Sidekick (Not Ed)
description: Henry Bushkins Johnny Carson is that rare celebrity tell-all by an author who knows whom and what hes talking about. Though early readers have been shocked, just shocked, by Mr. Bushkins treachery, they have also been drawn ravenously to his book.

title: The Erosive Effect of Expenses on a Portfolios Value
description: THE punishing impact of investment expenses on wealth is like wind, sun and rain pounding on painted wood over time. There is a lot of damage.

title: Have to Ask What the App Costs? Its Not for You
description: THE superrich have always had magazines, hotels and retailers catering to the special needs of their stratosphere. So its no surprise that the digital world has caught up.

title: Closed-End Funds Offer Bargains to Careful Buyers
description: THERE may be no free lunch, but if you place an order for an obscure type of investment called a closed-end fund, you stand a good chance of buying stocks or bonds at well below the going price.

title: Gay Marriage Ruling Brings New Planning Choices
description: BEYOND its psychological and political impacts, the Supreme Court ruling last June that married same-sex couples were entitled to federal benefits and tax advantages is prompting many to rethink their financial arrangements.

title: Rich Americans Snap Up Irish Castles for Love and Discounts
description: FIRST-TIME visitors to Humewood Castle in Kiltegan, County Wicklow, cant help it. They simply say, Wow.

title: Help in Planning Investments Meant to Outlive You
description: IT was Mark Antony in Shakespeares Julius Caesar who said the evil that men do lives after them, the good is oft interred with their bones.

title: Advisers Go Extra Lengths to Keep Wealthy Clients
description: KAREN McNEILL has a Ph.D. in history from the University of California, Berkeley, and is considered one of the foremost authorities on Julia Morgan, the architect who designed Hearst Castle, William Randolph Hearsts 90,000-square-foot coastal retreat. Ms. McNeill has written extensively about Morgan, who designed some 700 buildings and helped open the field of architecture to women.

title: Blasts Kill 2 and Injure an American in Myanmar
description: BANGKOK  A series of unexplained blasts across Myanmar over the past several days has left two people dead and raised anxiety in the countrys main city, Yangon, where an explosion on Monday at a luxury hotel injured an American tourist.

title: At 28, Writer Is Youngest to Receive Booker Prize
description: Eleanor Catton was awarded the Man Booker Prize on Tuesday for The Luminaries, an immersive tale set in 19th-century New Zealand that explores identity, greed and human frailty.

title: Coast Guard Stops Renewing Ship Certificates
description: In better times, vessels over five tons were supposed to have a valid certificate of documentation, the maritime version of a cars registration papers. But with the government shutdown, the Coast Guard has stopped renewing them.

title: A New Terminal at Incheon Airport
description: South Koreas Incheon International Airport broke ground late last month on a new terminal, set to open in 2018 before the Winter Olympics in Pyeongchang.

title: Office Romance: Broadsheet Silhouette
description: As part of her series capturing the beauty in everyday office life, Kathy Ryan photographed Marvin Orellana, a photo editor at the magazine, reading the debut issue of The International New York Times this morning.

title: Europeans Are Faulted Over Using Funds to Support Like-Minded Voices
description: BRUSSELS  During heated wrangling late last year over the size of a new long-term budget for the European Union, Notre Europe, a Paris-based policy group, wanted to make its voice heard. So it put one of its researchers on a small radio station in the French city of Nantes to answer questions and promote its vision of a more effective  and bigger  budget controlled by Brussels.

title: Mother of American Imprisoned in North Korea Leaves Without Him
description: The mother of Kenneth Bae, the ailing American missionary serving a 15-year sentence of hard labor in North Korea, said on Tuesday that it broke my heart to leave him behind after the North Korean authorities had permitted her to visit him in a Pyongyang hospital.

title: The Crunchy Lure of Southeast Asia
description: Crunching on grilled pig snouts at a Thai restaurant in Brooklyn the other night, I reflected on how far New York has come.

title: A Sequel to Tempt Flute Fans
description: Pamina is in trouble. The Queen of the Night and her three ladies have abducted her in the midst of her greatest trial. Who will help Tamino rescue her so that he can be reunited with her under the benevolent eye of Sarastro? Dont count on Papageno. Hes fallen prey to the bewitching sister of Monostatos, that cunning slave. With her marriage to Papageno in doubt, Papagena is jealous and alone; perhaps the time is ripe for Monostatos to make his move. Pamina may just have to rescue herself.

title: The Most Lucrative Form of Flattery
description: I grew up in Iowa: when your entire world is drugstore makeup, you dont know the difference between a knockoff and the original, said Dagny Heimisdottir, 23, an administrative assistant who now lives in Minneapolis and can spot copycat cosmetics immediately, and often writes about them on her beauty blog.

title: Heirs Press Austria to Return Looted Klimt Frieze
description: Over the last decade, Austria has made significant progress in restoring art and property looted by the Nazis during World War II. Now the governments commitment to that goal is facing a new test, with the filing of a claim on Tuesday for the return of one of the nations most celebrated artworks: the Beethoven Frieze, by Gustav Klimt.

title: Tech Rivals Lay Down Arms for Youth Coding
description: Its somewhat rare for Amazon, Microsoft, Apple and Google to agree on something, so its noteworthy when they pause for a kumbaya moment over something like educating youth programmers.

title: Twitter Reports Sharp Rise in Revenue
description: As Twitter prepares to hit the road to begin peddling its stock to the public, the company disclosed new revenue numbers on Tuesday that may help it persuade investors to buy the shares.

title: NBA 2K14, Infinity Blade III, Rain, Pokmon X and Pokmon Y
description: NBA 2K14

title: Mexico Takes Bloomberg-Like Swing at Soaring Obesity
description: MEXICO CITY  Rosa Isela Sandate kicked her drinking habit about six months ago and swears she will never go back.

title: Credit Agency Places U.S. on Ratings Watch
description: WASHINGTON  Just days before the government could default on some of its obligations, the credit rating agency Fitch has put the United States on a negative ratings watch. Fitch reaffirmed the countrys sterling AAA credit rating, but warned that Congressional intransigence has put the full faith and credit of the government at risk.

title: Whats a Group of Nice Toys Like You Doing in a Creepy Hotel Like This?
description: Once the annual avalanche of Halloween-themed episodes, specials and movies overtakes TV, you probably dont expect to be using the word charming very often. But charming perfectly describes one such entry, Toy Story of Terror!, on Wednesday night on ABC.

title: The Cancer Divide: Jessy
description: Jessy Acen, 30, who has advanced breast cancer, contends with her own poverty and with Uganda's limited resources in her fight to stay alive.

title: Many Dramas, Now Playing With Food
description: Neil LaBute has written some fine plays, including reasons to be pretty. But Full Circle, a rare foray into television, mostly proves that even he cant make anything consistently interesting out of a bunch of insufferable people yacking over dinner about problems of their own making.

title: Reporter Tied to Snowden Leaks to Leave Guardian
description: Glenn Greenwald, the lawyer and writer who provided the biggest journalistic disclosure of the year when he published revelations from Edward J. Snowden about government surveillance, said on Tuesday that he would be leaving The Guardian, the British daily, for a new journalistic venture.

title: Breast Cancer as Death Sentence in Uganda
description: Lynsey Addario, a contract photographer for The New York Times, went to Uganda in July on assignment with Denise Grady, who was pursuing a story about early cancer detection and treatment in Uganda. An interactive feature, where you can share your own stories about surviving breast cancer or stories about someone you know who has or had breast cancer, is viewable here, and Ms. Gradys story appears in Wednesdays paper. Ms. Addario, reached via phone from London, where she lives, spoke with James Estrin. Their conversation has been edited.

title: A Spark Snuffed by Drink and Ire
description: Tempestuous love affairs cool down. Even Elizabeth Taylor couldnt remain, as Richard Burton once described her in his diary, an eternal one-night stand.

title: Williamstown Artistic Director to Lead Friends of the High Line
description: Jenny Gersten, the artistic director of Williamstown Theater Festival, will step down at the end of the year to become executive director of Friends of the High Line, the nonprofit organization that runs the former elevated railway, the festival announced on Tuesday.

title: Belafonte Sues Heirs of Martin Luther King Jr.
description: Harry Belafonte is 86, an age that tends to focus the mind on putting ones affairs in order. And that is why, Mr. Belafonte says, he has filed a lawsuit in federal court against the three surviving children of one of his closest friends: the Rev. Dr. Martin Luther King Jr.

title: Uganda Fights Stigma and Poverty to Take On Breast Cancer
description: KAMPALA, Uganda  Mary Namata unbuttoned her dress in an examining room at Mulago Hospital, revealing a breast taut and swollen with grape-size tumors that looked as if they might burst through the skin.

title: Without Taking Sides, Vets Call for End to Shutdown
description: WASHINGTON  Jon Kromer knows all too well the threat the government shutdown poses to military veterans and their families.

title: For a Young Woman, Late Treatment and a Grim Diagnosis
description: KAMPALA, Uganda  Related Article: Uganda Fights Stigma and Poverty to Take On Breast Cancer

title: JPMorgan Expected to Admit Fault in London Whale Trading Loss
description: Updated, 10:25 p.m. | For JPMorgan Chase, fines totaling billions of dollars are no longer sufficient to placate the government. Now the banks regulators want something stiffer: a mea culpa.

title: Two Windows Into Cancer, the Imperiled Moose
description: New research tries to break through cancers protective shield and women with breast cancer in Uganda face terrible challenges; the weather turns on North Americas forest giant.

title: Todays Scuttlebot: Angela Ahrendts Earns Her Stripes, and Eric Schmidts Face on Google Ads
description: Every day, The New York Timess staff scours the Web for interesting and peculiar items.

title: U.S. Military Deaths in Afghanistan
description: The Department of Defense has identified 2,271 American service members who have died as a part of the Afghan war and related operations. It confirmed the death of the following American recently:

title: Can Marfa Bring Its Magic to Manhattan?
description: You dont have to be a scientist, engineer or policy maker to weigh in on the impact of climate change. Right now, all around New York City, visual artists, architects and performers are tackling the subject as part of Marfa Dialogues/New York, a two-month series of environmentally engaged public events.

title: Oregon Fathers Memorial Trek Across Country Ends in a Familys Second Tragedy
description: DENVER  As he made his way across the country, Joe Bell walked through rain squalls, slept in ditches and talked to anyone who would listen about how his gay son had killed himself after being taunted and bullied at school.

title: Yet Another Way to Mock Chinas New Rich
description: When Apple introduced the iPhone 5s in China last month, demand was predictably overwhelming. Less predictable, however, was the online reaction when the gold-colored version of the phone sold out almost instantly.

title: Fact-Check: Lhota and Republicans
description: Mr. de Blasio and Mr. Lhota argue about whether Mr. Lhota shares the views of the national Republican Party. Mr. de Blasio says he does; Mr. Lhota says he doesnt.

title: Fact-Check: New Yorkers Living at or Near Poverty Line
description: Pointing to massive inequality in the city, Bill de Blasio said that 46 percent of New Yorkers live at or near the poverty line. Indeed, according to an analysis by the Bloomberg administration in April, about 46 percent of New Yorkers were making less than 150 percent of the federal poverty threshold  a benchmark intended to include families who are poor and those who are not officially poor but who struggle to get by.

title: Fact-Check: De Blasio on Charter Schools
description: Mr. Lhota said Mr. de Blasio had flip-flopped in his views on charter schools. He suggested Mr. de Blasio had waited until after winning the Democratic nomination to fully describe his plan to charge rent to charter schools using public space. And he said Mr. de Blasio had only recently made clear his plan to stop charter schools from sharing space with traditional schools.

title: Fact-Check: Lhotas Experience on Crime
description: Asked why he believed Mr. de Blasio would make New York City less safe, Mr. Lhota never quite answered the question, but he did assert that he himself had played a role in 1994 in the creation of CompStat, the Police Departments vaunted database system for responding quickly to crime and holding precinct commanders accountable for the results.

title: Fact-Check: Financing de Blasios Prekindergarten Plan
description: Mr. de Blasio expressed confidence that the state government would pass a bill that would increase taxes to help pay for universal access to prekindergarten.

title: Fact-Check: De Blasio and Atlantic Yards
description: Mr. de Blasio said he had pressed the developer of Atlantic Yards, Bruce C. Ratner, to follow through on his promises to build hundreds of units of affordable housing there, none of which have yet materialized.

title: Fact-Check: De Blasios Experience
description: Mr. de Blasio was asked point-blank whether he had enough experience to be mayor, especially compared with Mr. Lhota, a former budget director, deputy mayor and chairman of the Metropolitan Transportation Authority.

title: Fact-Check: M.T.A. Fares Under Lhota
description: A viewer question posed to Mr. Lhota brought up the issue of fare and toll increases during his tenure as chairman of the Metropolitan Transportation Authority, saying that fares were raised astronomically under Mr. Lhotas watch.

title: Finding Common Ground
Fact-Check: De Blasio Raising Taxes
description: Mr. Lhota charged that Mr. de Blasio has a history of raising taxes. Indeed, in 2003, while Mr. de Blasio was in the City Council, the Council voted to raise property taxes by 18.5 percent, as well as to increase the city sales tax and the income tax for top earners. Mr. de Blasio voted for the tax increases, which were part of a budget deal reached between Mayor Michael R. Bloomberg and the City Council speaker, Gifford Miller, in order to close a budget gap.

title: A Digitally Smart Designer Takes the Reins at Burberry
description: LONDON  As the British fashion retailer Burberry lost Angela Ahrendts, its star chief executive, to Apple on Tuesday, Christopher Bailey, the companys multitasking digitally skilled designer, stepped up to take her place.

title: Fact-Check: Bloomberg and Unions
description: Mr. de Blasio said Mayor Michael R. Bloomberg had attacked the citys labor unions, hampering contract negotiations. It is true that Mr. Bloombergs relationship with several unions deteriorated in recent years. But earlier in his tenure, he enjoyed amicable relations with many unions. He awarded large raises to city workers, including teachers, during his first term.

title: Lhotas Vision for the East River
Justices Weigh Michigan Law and Race in College Admissions
description: WASHINGTON  Just four months after the Supreme Court largely ducked the question of whether the University of Texas may take account of race in its admissions decisions, the justices heard arguments on Tuesday about whether Michigans voters violated the Constitution by forbidding race-conscious admissions plans at that states public universities.

title: Fact-Check: Upper East Side Waste Transfer Station
description: When asked about their positions on a proposed waste transfer station on the Upper East Side, Mr. de Blasio and Mr. Lhota offered different responses.

title: For New Jersey, Odd Day to Elect a New Senator
description: The special election to fill New Jerseys open seat in the United States Senate has caused so much confusion that even the Republican National Committee sent out a Twitter message earlier this week encouraging voters to go to the polls on Tuesday.

title: Fact-Check: De Blasios Sports Allegiances
description: While Mr. de Blasio, who grew up in Massachusetts, was forced to defend his allegiance to Boston sports teams like the Red Sox, Mr. Lhota took care to highlight his local roots.

title: In Friendlier Time Zone, Rangers Hope Fortunes Turn
description: GREENBURGH, N.Y.  Maybe the answer to the Rangers early-season problems is a simple matter of geography. They spent most of the preseason away, mainly in the West, and racked up a 1-5 record while being outscored, 22-9. After that long trip, they returned home briefly, and then returned to the West to start the regular season. They went 1-4 and were outscored, 25-9.

title: Thats a Wrap
description: The debate is now over, and with it, our live fact-checking. The two candidates will face off again on each of the next two Tuesday nights, at 7 p.m. Oct. 22 on WCBS, and at 7 p.m. Oct. 29 on WNBC, and the election is Nov. 5. In the meantime, you can catch up on our profiles of the candidates, our fact-checks of the campaign commercials and all the latest polling on the race. Thanks for joining us.

title: Video Start-Up Co-Founded by Cory Booker Is Set to Be Acquired
description: Waywire, the troubled video start-up co-founded by Cory A. Booker, has found an exit.

title: Club Monaco Will Offer Books and Coffee Alongside Fashion
description: Offer the coziness of a library, a cup of coffee or an Art Deco fireplace in a ladies lounge as a gateway to a shopping spree. Thats the new vision for Club Monaco, which is opening a sprawling flagship store on Fifth Avenue in the Flatiron district on Monday.

title: Lost Youths Are Found, but Ranch Director Is Sought Amid Claims of Beatings
description: DENVER  The Tierra Blanca Ranch billed itself as a place where the hearts of troubled youth could be healed, a cattle ranch in rugged southern New Mexico that could instill responsibility and respect when families failed.

title: Court Rejects Appeal Bid by Writer in Leak Case
description: WASHINGTON  A federal appeals court on Tuesday declined to hear an appeal by James Risen, an author and a reporter for The New York Times, who was ordered in July to testify in the trial of a former Central Intelligence Agency official accused of leaking information to him.

title: De Blasio, Attacking Lhota, Dominates in Their First Debate
description: Bill de Blasio, not content to rest on a lopsided lead in the race for New York City mayor, relentlessly pounded his rival Joseph J. Lhota in their first televised debate on Tuesday, repeatedly linking him to what he called an obstructionist national Republican Party and the divisive mayoralty of Rudolph W. Giuliani.

title: New York City Ballots Tiny Print Is Criticized
description: Elected officials and government watchdog groups criticized the New York City Board of Elections on Tuesday after it decided to print the ballots for the November elections with candidates names in a miniature, six-point font.

title: Group Says Haitian Garment Workers Are Shortchanged on Pay
description: MEXICO CITY  Garment factories in Haiti, the backbone of an effort to revive the countrys earthquake-shattered economy, have seriously shortchanged workers of their wages to keep costs of their T-shirts and other export goods low, according to a report to be issued Wednesday by a labor rights group.

title: Vote Wednesday in New Jersey
description: The special election to replace the late United States Senator Frank Lautenberg is being held Wednesday in New Jersey. Our choice is Cory Booker, the Democrat in this race. The polls are open from 6 a.m. to 8 p.m.

title: Banksys New York Welcome
description: The pseudonymous British street artist Banksy is in New York for the month of October with a project hes calling Better Out Than In, after Paul Czannes pronouncement that all pictures painted inside, in the studio, will never be as good as those done outside. His stencils and graffiti epigrams are popping up across the city, creating a sort of scavenger hunt for admirers.

title: Europes Populist Backlash
description: The politics of populist anger are on the march across Europe, fueled by austerity, recession and the inability of mainstream politicians to revive growth.

title: Thinking Sensibly About Charter Schools
description: Mayor Michael Bloomberg has been a full-throated supporter of charter schools, of which there are about 180 in New York City. The debate over how the next mayor should handle charters has been part of the campaign from the very beginning.

title: Climbing Beyond Boehners Reach
description: YOSEMITE WEST, Calif.  THE limit of John Boehners reach is defined by a line of orange traffic cones and a forest green and white S.U.V. thats parked, lights flashing, beneath a stand of ponderosa pines on the edge of a scenic meadow in Yosemite Valley. Directly overhead lies the southeast face of El Capitan, also known as the Dawn Wall  a monolith of cleaved gray granite rising more than 2,800 feet that is, for legions of rock climbers around the world, without peer.

title: Stalemate Puts Strain on a Vital Debt Market
description: During the financial crisis of 2008, the vast and shadowy machinery of the financial system seized up, making a bad situation worse.

title: Verlander Good, but Lackey Is Better as Red Sox Beat Tigers
description: DETROIT  The Detroit Tigers starters had been almost untouchable in their past three games. Justin Verlander, Anibal Sanchez and Max Scherzer had carried no-hitters deep into their previous starts. They had struck out 35 batters in 21 innings, each outdoing the last.

title: House Democrats Discuss Fiscal Impasse
description: After a meeting with President Obama at the White House, Nancy Pelosi, the House minority leader, blamed House Republicans for hurdling bipartisan efforts to reopen the federal government.

title: Should You Eat Chicken?
description: I tell this friend about the latest salmonella outbreak, and she asks me, Should I stop eating chicken?

title: Sorry, Kids. We Ate It All.
description: Eventually this shutdown crisis will end. And eventually the two parties will make another stab at a deal on taxes, investments and entitlements. But theres one outcome from such negotiations that I can absolutely guarantee: Seniors, Wall Street and unions will all have their say and their interests protected. So the most likely result will be more tinkering around the edges, as our politicians run for the hills the minute someone accuses them of fixing the deficit on the backs of the elderly or creating death panels to sensibly allocate end-of-life health care. Could this time be different? Short of an economic meltdown, there is only one thing that might produce meaningful change: a mass movement for tax, spending and entitlement reform led by the cohort that is the least organized but will be the most affected if we dont think long term  todays young people.

title: Signs Indicate That Obamas Debt Ceiling Gamble May Be Paying Off
description: WASHINGTON  More than two years ago, President Obama was still in the thick of his previous showdown with Republican House leaders over the nations debt limit when he called five senior advisers into his office. He did not ask their advice, one said. Rather, he told them, in a way that brooked no discussion: From now on, no more negotiating over legislation so basic and essential to the economy, and the country.

title: An Unfair Game
description: There is something unfair about football in England.

title: An Unfair Game
description: This short film explains a troubling situation in English football, where ticket prices have risen to levels so high that many of the fans can no longer afford them.

title: Death in Hong Kong Fuels Feelings of Discrimination
description: He still remembers the words, the handwriting even, of the slur scrawled on a whiteboard in his dormitory: mainland dogs. After moving to Hong Kong in 2010 for college, Wilson Liu Yu, a native of the central Chinese city of Wuhan, had slowly grown aware of the disdain directed at him by some local residents.

title: Group Behind Music Festival Is Sued Over Failed Merger
description: On Tuesday, 1,400 aspiring bands began to descend on New York for the 33rd annual CMJ Music Marathon. Little known to them is that the small organization behind it is facing a lawsuit of nearly $1 million over a failed merger.

title: Pope Trumps President
description: WASHINGTON  Id heard about a medical malady you can get from watching too much cable news. You start feeling jittery and apprehensive about the future.

title: Racing to See Banksy Graffiti, While It Can Still Be Seen
description: Ilyssa Fuchs, a lawyer whose office is just below City Hall, logged onto Facebook at lunchtime on Tuesday and immediately bolted from her desk. She asked two other lawyers in her suite if they were interested in joining her on a six-tenths-of-a-mile dash, and not to get to some emergency hearing in court.

title: Amid All the Strikeouts, One Big Swing
description: DETROIT  Major league hitters struck out 36,710 times during the regular season. That was a record, breaking the one set just last year.

title: A Muzzled Chinese Artwork, Absent but Speaking Volumes
description: BEIJING  A wood sculpture of a larger-than-life mans head whose gaping mouth is stuffed with a plug  a piece of Chinese protest art from more than 30 years ago  was supposed to be a star attraction at a retrospective here.

title: With G.O.P. Badly Divided, Boehner Is Left Herding Cats
description: WASHINGTON  After House Republicans began their closed-door meeting on Tuesday with an impromptu rendition of Amazing Grace, Speaker John A. Boehner stood up with what he hoped would be an equally inspiring message.

title: Alaskas King-Crab Fleet Is Left in Port by Shutdown
description: SEATTLE  The nations king-crab fishing fleet, prepared to deploy off the coast of southwest Alaska for the start of a season that supplies holiday tables and restaurants around the world, was instead stalled in port on Tuesday by the federal government shutdown.

title: Quotation of the Day for Wednesday, October 16, 2013
description: Its very, very serious. Republicans have to understand we have lost this battle, as I predicted weeks ago, that we would not be able to win because we were demanding something that was not achievable.

title: Marketers Wax Enthusiastic Over Bees and Honey
description: COINCIDENCE or not, as the denizens of Madison Avenue seek to generate buzz  positive word of mouth  among consumers, they are increasingly turning to bees and honey as marketing tools.

title: Panel to Investigate State Democratic Party
description: A commission appointed by Gov. Andrew M. Cuomo to investigate political corruption, which has been accused of shying away from scrutinizing his allies, agreed on Tuesday to issue a subpoena to the State Democratic Party, according to people with knowledge of the matter.

title: Judge in Landmark Case Disavows Support for Voter ID
description: It is the kind of thought that rarely passes the lips of a member of the federal judiciary: I was wrong.

title: Imagining the Dollar Without Its Privilege
description: Remember the last time the country came to the brink of default? It was August 2011. For the first time in history, Standard & Poors, the ratings agency, downgraded United States government debt.

title: Are 'Trans Rights' and 'Gay Rights' Still Allies?
Business of Health Care
description: To the Editor:

title: Remembering The Herald Tribune in Its Glory Days
description: To the Editor:

title: The Slow Lane, U.S.-Style
description: To the Editor:

title: Place a Fee on Carbon
description: To the Editor:

title: The High Cost of Asthma in America
description: To the Editor:

title: Gambling Opponents Take Sledgehammer to a Slot Machine
description: ALBANY  They may not have much money, manpower or media presence. But for one day, at least, the opponents of more gambling in New York did have a sledgehammer.

title: Real Estate Heating Up in Indonesia
description: JAKARTA, Indonesia  Gita Wirjawan, Indonesias trade minister, made a steeply rising motion with his right hand, like an airplane soaring into the sky, when asked about the surging real estate market in this country. Scary, isnt it? he said.

title: As Search Goes On for Queens Boy With Autism, Adults at His School Face Questions
description: Eleven days after a teenager with autism walked away from his school in Queens in the middle of the day, a senior police commander, Chief of Department Philip Banks III, said on Tuesday that an intensifying search had failed to turn up even a trace of the student.

title: Corrections: October 16, 2013
description: FRONT PAGE

title: Its True: There Be Dragons
description: There they are again, Max and Lola, framed in the doorway of a pitch-black room, the light behind them and the darkness ahead. Their wariness about taking the first step inside seems unreasonable, given that where theyve arrived is a spick-and-span, soothingly generic condo in Florida. But Max and Lola arent wrong to hesitate. Monsters wait in the dark for this elderly couple; they always have and they always will.

title: Call It Quits
description: WEDNESDAYS PUZZLE  Samuel A. Donaldson is a relative newlywed; he married his longtime love about two years ago, so its only appropriate that he hang out the HIS and HERS TOWELs that they must have received as gifts.

title: In Argentine Soccer, a Rivalry Cleaves a City
description: ROSARIO, Argentina  Ask a soccer fan to name the fiercest rivalry in Argentina, and it is a near certainty the reply will be Boca Juniors versus River Plate, the battle for Buenos Aires popularly known as el superclsico. Another capital derby, Independiente versus Racing, ignites the industrial suburb of Avellaneda, where those clubs stadiums are separated by a single city block.

title: Ranchers Suffer Major Loss of Cattle
description: A blizzard killed as many as 20,000 cows and climbing in South Dakota.

title: Lottery Numbers for Oct. 15, 2013
Brooklyn Pool to Double as Ice-Skating Rink
description: When the McCarren Park Pool in Brooklyn reopened in the summer of 2012, there was a peculiar concrete plaza, called the beach by parks officials, that jutted into the center of the pool. It became a popular spot for running through the spray fountains there and keeping an eye on toddlers and novice swimmers.

title: Promise Invites Lessons Aplenty for Knicks Rookie
description: In a long and storied N.B.A. career that has spanned all of three exhibition games, Tim Hardaway Jr. has already experienced highs and lows.

title: South Dakota Ranchers Face Storms Toll, but U.S. Helping Hands Are Tied
description: UNION CENTER, S.D.  The cattle lay in heaps of tangled hooves, collapsed against fences and submerged in creeks. Some had curled up behind hay bales, hiding from 70 mile-per-hour winds that scattered herds for miles, struck by hypothermia weeks before they were scheduled to go to market.

title: Steve Berkowitz
description: Mr. Berkowitz, 55, is the chief executive of Move Inc., a public company based in San Jose, Calif., that operates real estate Web sites for consumers and professionals, like Realtor.com and ListHub.com.

title: Librarians Love of Books Began in Her Struggles to Read
description: Patricia Ann Kettles did not read her first book until she was 10. She knows what it is to struggle with the very act of reading, trying to make sense of words on a page long past an age when other children can polish off a thick Harry Potter or Twilight novel as quickly as a wedge of cake.

title: Resurgent Wilson Is at Cutting Edge of Baseballs Beard Movement
description: LOS ANGELES  When the bullpen gates opened and Brian Wilson, bushy black beard and all, made his way to the mound in Game 3, the capacity Dodger Stadium crowd  itself dotted with dozens of synthetic bushy black beards  roared with delight.

title: 11 Charged in Lower Manhattan Drug Ring
description: Along Avenue D in Manhattan, Dwayne Mitchell was known as Dubbs, an affable ladies man who drove an Infiniti and had fathered several children with different girlfriends. He won the affection of many residents by paying for block parties and throwing barbecues. He even took neighborhood children to amusement parks like Six Flags.

title: 2 Automakers Fear Effects of Shutdown on Sales
description: DETROIT  As the government shutdown enters its third week, some automakers are expressing concern that it will slow the industrys robust growth this year.

title: Two New Knicks Take Manhattan, With 22 Youngsters
description: Metta World Peace stepped out of a black car on Tuesday afternoon, tilted his head and gazed at Madison Square Garden. He was ready to entertain an audience, although he did not enter the building and did not need a basketball.

title: Funeral for Ex-Nazi in Italy Is Halted as Protesters Clash
description: ROME  To shouts of assassin and murderer, the hearse bearing the corpse of Erich Priebke, the former Nazi who died under house arrest in Rome last Friday, wound on Tuesday through the streets toward a church in a tiny hilltop town 20 miles south of Rome. Police officers in riot gear had to hold back enraged citizens who kicked and punched the vehicle as it passed.

title: Reunion for Players and a Win for the Nets
description: A blockbuster trade this summer between the Nets and the Boston Celtics ensured that the teams would seem unnaturally entwined this season, that an extracurricular awkwardness would characterize what might otherwise be humdrum contests between them.

title: The Political-Monetary Complex
description: IN its landmark 1976 decision Buckley v.Valeo, the Supreme Court affirmed the constitutionality of laws aimed at the prevention of corruption and the appearance of corruption spawned by the real or imagined coercive influence of large financial contributions on candidates positions and on their actions if elected to office.

title: Recent Commercial Real Estate
description: RECENT SALE

title: Viewing U.S. in Fear and Dismay
description: MEXICO CITY  The word many Mexicans now use to describe Washington reflects a familiar mix of outrage and exasperation: berrinche. Technically defined as a tantrum, berrinches are also spoiled little rich kids, blind to their privilege and the effects of their misbehavior.

title: Kumar Pallana, Who Went From Yoga to Film, Dies at 94
description: Kumar Pallana, an Indian plate spinner turned Texas yoga instructor turned  in his late 70s and long beyond  sought-after character actor in films by Wes Anderson, Steven Spielberg and others, died on Thursday at his home in Oakland, Calif. He was 94.

title: M.L.B. Seeks Records on a Rodriguez Doctor
description: A federal judge in Buffalo is weighing whether to grant Major League Baseballs request to unseal grand jury testimony in the case of Anthony Galea, a Toronto-based doctor who pleaded guilty in 2011 to smuggling human growth hormone into the United States.

title: In a Competitive Dance, Lhota Searches for a Tune
description: Pity Joseph J. Lhota his disability.

title: Chinas Red Flag Woos Luxury Car Buyers
description: As the first Red Flag built by First Automobile Works was being driven to a company gathering for its unveiling on Army Day, Aug. 1, 1958, it steadily leaked oil.

title: Hans Riegel, Marketer of Gummi Bears, Dies at 90
description: Hans Riegel, who made the rainbow-colored, fruit-flavored, teddy bear-shaped gelatin sweets known as gummi bears a global favorite, died on Tuesday in Bonn. He was 90.

title: Some News Organizations Decline to Publish Minors Names
description: The liberal public records laws that have made Florida a helpful destination for media organizations divided journalists this week over the question of whether some public information is too public.

title: Me Generation Aesthetics Are Back and Better Than Ever
description: The unrestrained glitz and urbane glamour of the 1970s jet set has re-emerged as a sophisticated staple of contemporary design.

title: Aging, Taxes and the State of the Labor Market
description: Casey B. Mulligan is an economics professor at the University of Chicago. He is the author of The Redistribution Recession: How Labor Market Distortions Contracted the Economy.

title: Nirvana Leads Nominees for Rock Hall of Fame
description: Nirvana, the Replacements, Kiss, Linda Ronstadt, Peter Gabriel and Yes are among the 16 nominees for the 29th annual Rock and Roll Hall of Fame induction ceremony, to be held in April in New York, the hall announced.

title: Word of the Day | impiety
description: impiety \()im-pi--te\ noun

title: Afghans Fend Off Taliban Threat in Pivotal Year
description: KABUL, Afghanistan  When the Taliban announced the beginning of their spring offensive, they saw few limits to their ambitions: to kill top Afghan officials across every major ministry, to plot even more infiltration attacks against Americans and to bloody, break and drive off the Afghan security forces who were newly in charge across the country.

title: De Blasio and Lhota Face Off
description: In the first of three television debates, the mayoral candidates Bill de Blasio and Joseph J. Lhota attacked each others record and plans for New York City.

title: Chasing Ghosts, Cardinals Are Step Closer
description: LOS ANGELES  The failures of October, coming as they do on baseballs central stage, are often burnished for years on the psyche of players and the consciousness of fans. For the unfortunate few, they remain there for careers and beyond.

title: Britain: Former Liberian President Is Transferred to British Prison
description: Former President Charles Taylor of Liberia arrived in Britain on Tuesday to serve the remainder of his 50-year sentence in an unspecified prison. After a four-year trial by the Special Court for Sierra Leone, temporarily based in The Hague, an appeals court recently upheld his conviction for aiding and abetting war crimes and crimes against humanity in Sierra Leone. The 65-year-old former leader had tried in vain to be sent to Rwanda. In a recent letter to the court he said it would be easier for his family to visit him in Africa. He also said he feared being attacked in a British prison by people from West Africa, where he had long operated as a warlord.

title: Whats On Wednesday
description: 8 P.M. (Epix) SCHOOLED: THE PRICE OF COLLEGE SPORTS (2013) This documentary  adapted from the 2011 book The Cartel and the Atlantic article The Shame of College Sports, by Taylor Branch, the Pulitzer Prize-winning civil rights scholar  examines the N.C.A.A.s treatment of athletes and amateurism, and how college sports became a billion-dollar industry. Among those interviewed are Domonique Foxworth, president of the N.F.L. Players Association; Arian Foster of the Houston Texans; Johnathan Franklin, above, of the Green Bay Packers; Jeff Locke of the Minnesota Vikings; the former N.B.A. player Ed OBannon; and Devon Ramsay, the former University of North Carolina fullback whose eligibility case was one of the most controversial in recent N.C.A.A. history. Also weighing in are the sportscaster Bob Costas; the ESPN analyst Jay Bilas; Joe Nocera, a columnist for The New York Times; Dave Zirin, a correspondent for The Nation; the Sports Illustrated journalists Frank Deford, George Dohrmann, B. J. Schecter and Michael Rosenberg; and the former college sports marketer Sonny Vaccaro.

title: Early Promise in Drug Trial for Fighting Cholesterol
description: A new type of lipid-lowering drug being developed by Sanofi and Regeneron Pharmaceuticals cut cholesterol levels by about half in its first late-stage clinical trial, the companies will announce on Wednesday.

title: Immigrant Held in Killing of Russian Claims Self-Defense, Officials Say
description: MOSCOW  An Azerbaijani man arrested in the killing of a 25-year-old Russian man that set off an anti-immigrant rampage over the weekend in Moscow confessed to the crime, Russian officials said Wednesday, but he told investigators that he acted in self-defense after trying to intervene in an argument between the man and his girlfriend.

title: News Quiz | October 16, 2013
description: See what you know about the news below. To prepare, you might scan the articles or summaries on todays paper. Good luck!

title: Pounding Pavement by Heel or Toe
description: Heel strike or toe strike?

title: London Mayor Applauds the Beijing Subway
description: Clean, efficient, crowded. That was how the mayor of London, Boris Johnson, described the Beijing subway system to local reporters during a short ride Tuesday. And it wasnt even rush hour.

title: Test Yourself | Math, Oct. 16, 2013
description: Our weekly math problems are written by teachers at Math for America.

title: 6 Qs About the News | Shutdown Interrupts Scientific Research
description: In the article An American Shutdown Reaches the Earths End, John Schwartz writes about the government shutdowns effect on scientific research.

title: First Water, Then Soldiers, Flood a Chinese Town
description: There was no trace of them during the disaster, but to restore stability they came down from above like Gods army.

title: Injured Kangaroo Finds Treatment in Australian Airport Pharmacy
description: An injured kangaroo managed to make its way into Melbourne Airport in Australia on Wednesday, ending up, fittingly, in a pharmacy.

title: America, the Melancholy
description: Christopher Morris was continually on the move during the 1990s, dashing from conflict zone to disaster zone, fueled by adrenaline and danger. As a contract photographer for Time magazine, he documented the most important stories of the period and landed scores of covers.

title: Will Musical Training Make You More Successful?
description: Focus. Discipline. Collaboration. Problem-Solving.

title: Navalny Is Spared Prison Term in Russia
