description: The morning before the opening of The Color Inside at the University of Texas, Austin, last week, James Turrell, the artist, was pushing melon around his fruit plate and holding forth on the psychology of perception.

title: College Football Around the Country
description: TYLER LOCKETT The Kansas State receiver, right, caught three touchdown passes in a 35-12 home victory over West Virginia.

title: Rice Offers a More Modest Strategy for Mideast
description: WASHINGTON  Each Saturday morning in July and August, Susan E. Rice, President Obamas new national security adviser, gathered half a dozen aides in her corner office in the White House to plot Americas future in the Middle East. The policy review, a kind of midcourse correction, has set the United States on a new heading in the worlds most turbulent region.

title: Few Problems With Cannabis for California
description: LOS ANGELES  In the heart of Northern Californias marijuana growing region, the sheriffs office is inundated each fall with complaints about the stench of marijuana plots or the latest expropriation of public land by growers. Its tranquil communities have been altered by the emergence of a wealthy class of marijuana entrepreneurs, while nearly 500 miles away in Los Angeles, officials have struggled to regulate an explosion of medical marijuana shops.

title: In Response to Storm, New York Will Create a Gas Reserve
description: New York is creating a gasoline reserve to prevent shortages during disasters, Gov. Andrew M. Cuomos office announced in a news release on Saturday.

title: Corrections: October 27, 2013
description: FRONT PAGE

title: Quotation of the Day for Sunday, October 27, 2013
description: If were going to play classical music to our babies in the womb and teach them foreign languages at an early age, then were going to want to expose babies to fine art and literature.

title: Momentum Shifts in Congos Battle Against Rebels
description: Until last summer, rebels had the upper hand in their battle against the Congolese government. But the government, backed by the United Nations, has brought new leadership and vigor to the fight.

title: A Reason for Hope in Congos Perpetual War
description: GOMA, Democratic Republic of Congo  Rocket after rocket ripped across the sky. By Saturday evening, after two straight days of pitched battle with artillery, tanks and mortars, the Congolese Army had driven the M23 rebels out of the strategic town of Kibumba.

title: Rodriguez Inquiry Defended by Selig
description: Commissioner Bud Selig said he was satisfied baseballs investigators did nothing wrong in obtaining evidence against Alex Rodriguez in the Biogenesis case.

title: Elizabeth Eraker, Miles Palley
description: Elizabeth Carin Lois Eraker and Miles Knight Palley were married Saturday at Northbrae Community Church in Berkeley, Calif. Dr. Pascal Kaplan, a preceptor in Sufism Reoriented, performed the ceremony.

title: Deborah Clayman, Lawrence Raiman
description: Deborah Jill Clayman, the daughter of Roberta Clayman of Philadelphia and the late Morton Clayman, was married Saturday evening to Lawrence David Raiman, the son of the late Vivian Raiman and the late Jesse Raiman of Harrisburg, Pa. Rabbi Rachel Aranoff officiated at the Ritz-Carlton Central Park in New York.

title: Melissa Schwartz, Joshua Friedberg
description: Melissa Fay Schwartz and Joshua Andrew Friedberg were married Saturday night by Rabbi Joel Mosbacher at Paramount Country Club in New City, N.Y.

title: Chuck Fischer and Bill Evans
description: Chuck Fischer and Bill Evans were married Thursday by John W. Kellogg, a Universal Life minister, on the Bliss, a chartered yacht docked at the Chelsea Piers in New York.

title: Daria Foster and Eric Wallach
description: Daria Lo Presti Foster and Eric Jean Wallach were married Saturday by Kathy Bloomfield, a Universal Life minister, at the New York Public Library.

title: Ronald Bausman, Arthur Wagner
description: Ronald Hills Bausman and Arthur Leland Wagner were married Saturday at their home in Petaluma, Calif. Eric M. Bausman, a son of Mr. Bausman who is a Universal Life minister, officiated.

title: Emma Presler and Steven Lee
description: Emma Butterfield Presler and Steven Yong Lee were married Saturday at Grace Church in New York, where they met. The Rev. J. Donald Waring, an Episcopal priest and the rector of the church, performed the ceremony.

title: Anne Becker, Randy Wolfe
description: Anne Michael Becker and Randy Jason Wolfe were married Saturday evening by Rabbi Alan LaPayover at the Franklin Institute in Philadelphia.

title: A Declaration of Love (Easy on the Garlic)
description: Alexandra Fogolin Fetissoff and Linden Michael Zakula were married Saturday at the Rainbow Ranch Lodge in Gallatin Gateway, Mont. Dr. Kenneth S. Schwartz, a friend of the brides family who became a Universal Life minister for the ceremony, officiated.

title: Sometimes, It Pays to Break the Rules
description: Dr. Sari Jaclyn Burns and Harry Charles Waisbren were married Saturday in Brooklyn. Rabbi David B. Cohen officiated at the Liberty Warehouse, an events space.

title: Krista Dahl, Julius Kusuma
description: Krista Lynn Dahl and Julius Kusuma were married Friday by the Rev. Kevin K. Baxter at the Swedenborg Chapel in Cambridge, Mass.

title: Emilie Williams, David Snyder
description: Emilie Frances Williams and David Lewis Snyder were married Saturday evening at the Holy Name of Jesus Church in New Orleans. The Rev. Clyde LeBlanc, a Roman Catholic priest and an uncle of the bride, performed the ceremony.

title: Cicely Williams, Tarek Fadel
description: Dr. Cicely Williams and Tarek Fadel are to be married in New York Sunday by KeithR.Gugliuzza, a minister of the Church of Human Spiritualism, at Summit Rock in Central Park.

title: Jennifer Wells, Samuel Goodhue
description: Jennifer Lilian Wells and Samuel Hawks Goodhue were married Saturday evening at the Boca Raton Resort and Club in Florida by Terry R. Sgammato, a notary public and an uncle of the bride.

title: Katherine McManmon, Robert Hoyt Jr.
description: Katherine Butler McManmon and Robert Earl Hoyt Jr. were married Saturday evening at the Ocean Reef Club in Key Largo, Fla. The Rev. Phil De Rea, a Roman Catholic priest, officiated.

title: Stephen Brodheim, John Mannino
description: Stephen Michael Brodheim and John Joseph Mannino were married Tuesday at the Manhattan Marriage Bureau in New York. Damaris Acosta, a deputy city clerk, officiated.

title: Lauren Fine, Benjamin Morrissey
description: Dr. Lauren Cortell Fine, a daughter of Nina Cortell and Dr. Robert L. Fine of Dallas, was married Saturday evening to Dr. Benjamin Richard Morrissey, a son of Kathy Morrissey and Richard E. Morrissey of Sparta, N.J. Dr. Barry C. Simon, a colleague and friend of the couple who became a Universal Life minister for the occasion, officiated at the Trinity River Audubon Center in Dallas.

title: Joanna Loewenstein, Leon Skornicki
description: Dr. Joanna Elisabeth Loewenstein, the daughter of Claudia W. Loewenstein and Dr. Joel B. Loewenstein of Lawrence, N.Y., was married Saturday night to Leon Claudio Skornicki, the son of Marina Skornicki and Dr. Jonas Skornicki of Aventura, Fla. Rabbi Mendel Weitman officiated at the Seawane Club in Hewlett Harbor, N.Y.

title: Lesley Klein, Matthew Baer
description: Lesley Corwin Klein and Matthew Haynes Baer were married Monday at the Manhattan Marriage Bureau in New York by Jaime Chirichella, the deputy counsel to the city clerk. On Saturday evening, Paul M. Corwin, the brides maternal uncle and president of the Park Avenue Synagogue in New York, led a religious ceremony at the Sol East Resort in Montauk, N.Y.

title: Tiffany Lynch, Daniel Kimicata
description: Tiffany Alexis Lynch and Daniel Mark Kimicata were married Saturday at the Boathouse in Prospect Park, Brooklyn. Carlos J. Ruiz Gomez, a friend of the couple who became a Universal Life minister for the event, officiated.

title: Amanda Senatore, Parker Hatfield
description: Amanda Leigh Senatore and Parker Franklin Hatfield were married Saturday evening at the Boston Harbor Hotel by the Rev. Michael J. Ebner, a Methodist minister.

title: Susan Lester and Petra Mertens
description: Susan Elizabeth Lester and Dr. Petra Antonia Mertens were married Saturday at their home in San Diego. William E. Lester, a brother of Ms. Lester who became a Universal Life minister for the occasion, officiated.

title: Alyssa Cass and Sam Howard
description: Alyssa Claire Cass and Sam Duvall Howard were married Saturday at the Prairie by Rachel Ashwell, a bed-and-breakfast in Round Top, Tex. Daniel L. Alterman, a friend of the couple who became a Universal Life minister for the ceremony, officiated.

title: Joseph Gale, William Hopkins
description: Judge Joseph Harold Gale and William Dewar Hopkins were married Thursday in Washington. Chief Judge Michael B. Thornton of the United States Tax Court officiated in Judge Gales chambers, in Washington.

title: Ralph Pellecchio, James Wernz
description: Ralph Lee Pellecchio and Dr. James Carter Wernz were married Saturday evening at the Supreme Court in Washington. Justice Ruth Bader Ginsburg officiated in her chambers.

title: Caroline Huddleston, Brian Haley
description: Caroline Bunker Huddleston and Brian Joseph Haley were married Saturday evening in Driftwood, Tex. The Rev. William Walker, a Presbyterian minister, officiated at the Salt Lick Vineyards.

title: Rachel Pomerance, David Berl
description: Rachel Leah Pomerance and David Isaac Berl are to be married Sunday evening by Rabbi Joshua Heller at the InterContinental Buckhead hotel in Atlanta.

title: Jessica Kreps, Adam Rothenberg
description: Jessica Sarah Gracia Kreps and Adam Ian Rothenberg were married Saturday evening by Rabbi Andy Bachman at the Brooklyn Museum.

title: Amy Metzger, Hootan Yaghoobzadeh
description: Amy Jill Metzger, a daughter of Ellen J. Metzger and Bruce S. Metzger of East Brunswick, N.J., is to be married Sunday to Hootan Yaghoobzadeh, a son of Mehri and Nasser Yaghoobzadeh of Old Westbury, N.Y. Rabbi Alan B. Lucas is to officiate at Guastavinos, an event space in Manhattan.

title: Michelle Gelber, Mandy Spiller
description: Michelle Marie Gelber and Mandy Lynn Spiller were married Saturday on the beach at Fourth Avenue in Asbury Park, N.J. The Rev. Trish Woods, a minister ordained by the Sanctuary of the Beloved, officiated.

title: Getting Off on the Right Foot
description: Miriam Liora Ganz and Rabbi Daniel Seth Horwitz are to be married Sunday at Birch Hill, an event site in Schodack, N.Y. Rabbi Dan Ornstein is to officiate, with Rabbi Joshua Foster participating.

title: Alexandra Libby, Jason Wool
description: Alexandra Billington Libby and Jason Robert Wool were married Saturday at Dumbarton House in Washington. Joseph B. Townsend, a friend of the couple who became a Universal Life minister for the event, officiated at a ceremony that incorporated Jewish traditions.

title: Gamecocks Change Passer, and Fortune
description: COLUMBIA, Mo.  It seemed like a desperate move. South Carolina was trailing in the third quarter, 17-0, and quarterback Dylan Thompson had looked lost and claustrophobic against Missouris swarming defense. So the Gamecocks turned to Connor Shaw, usually the teams starter, who had sprained his knee a week earlier.

title: In a Bizarre Finish, the Cardinals Stumble Into a Victory
description: ST. LOUIS  Of all the teams participating in this sloppy World Series, only the one in blue seems at the top of its game.

title: 3 Dead in Reported Brooklyn Stabbing
description: Three people were killed and three others were wounded in a reported stabbing in Brooklyn on Saturday night, officials said.

title: 1975 Redux for Red Sox: Do You Agree With Obstruction Call?
description: The Red Sox win Game 1 of the World Series at home, by a lopsided score.

title: Before Carnage, Frantic Warnings of Relatives Odd Behavior
description: The phone calls came in rapid succession, each call more frantic than the last, made by a woman intent on warning her relatives that her husbands 25-year-old cousin, who had been staying with their family only a few days, was not acting right.

title: Momentum Shifts in Congos Battle Against Rebels
description: Until last summer, rebels had the upper hand in their battle against the Congolese government. But the government, backed by the United Nations, has brought new leadership and vigor to the fight.

title: Chinese Newspaper Apologizes for Articles by Detained Reporter
description: Days after it used its front page to campaign for the release of a detained reporter, a Chinese newspaper has again taken to its front page, this time to admit that the reporter had been paid off to write a series attacking a prominent company. To all walks of society we hereby express our profound apology, The New Express, a tabloid based in the southern Chinese city of Guangzhou, said Sunday in a notice at the bottom of its front page.

title: Wave of Car Bombs Kills Dozens in Baghdad
description: BAGHDAD  Ten car bombs struck Shiite neighborhoods in Baghdad, the Iraqi capital, on Sunday morning, all exploding within 40 minutes.

title: Blasts Fail to Deter a Rally in India
description: NEW DELHI  A series of low-intensity bombs exploded on Sunday in the northeastern city of Patna, apparently targeting a vast rally featuring the opposition leader Narendra Modi, whose Bharatiya Janata Party hopes to unseat the long-dominant Congress Party in national elections next spring.

title: The Food Writer and Her Picky Eater
description: Some children are omnivorous, equally enthusiastic for broccoli and brownies. Mine, on the other hand, is non-nivorous. For almost five years now, since he turned 2, Harrys will-eat list has allowed fruit, snacky things, plain pasta with olive oil, yogurt and mozzarella (shredded only, thank you very much), and sometimes chicken. Oh, and hot dogs. His favorite vegetables: olives and capers.

title: A Year of Recovery After Hurricane Sandy
description: Times Documentaries presents Coming Back: A Year of Recovery After Hurricane Sandy. A video portrait of four neighborhoods struggling in the aftermath of the 2012 storm.

title: Coming Back: A Year of Recovery
description: For all the heightened alarm and panicky warnings that a monstrous storm was heading New York Citys way, no one was quite prepared for the deadly lashing that Hurricane Sandy delivered one year ago, on Oct. 29, 2012, to the coastline stretching from Connecticut to New Jersey.

title: The Choices That Haunt Bostons Manager
description: ST. LOUIS  If the Boston Red Sox win this World Series, they will not do it here, as they did nine years ago, when they broke an ancient curse and forged a bold new identity. If they lose, the twists and turns of Game 3 will be dissected and debated until the moment they win their next championship.

title: PPP and Japanese Inflation Expectations (Extremely Wonkish)
description: Im doing a bit of work on Abenomics, which will surface in a week or so. One thing I discovered along the way is that nobody much likes any of the existing measures of inflation expectations, as this New York Fed post by Mandel and Barnes explains. In particular, the Japanese market in inflation-protected securities is considered too thin to rely on.

title: Disruptions: Are Eager Investors Overvaluing Tech Start-Ups?
description: Pinterest is a kind of Internet message board where people post their favorite images of clothes or furniture. Its a three-year-old company and though it has an estimated 50 million unique monthly users, it doesnt have any revenue yet.

title: Concussions and the Classroom
description: Because of heightened awareness about the hazards of sports-related concussions, many states have implemented standards determining when an injured student may resume playing contact sports. But only a few states have begun to address how and when a student should resume classwork.

title: Vows: The Anti-Bachelorette
description: Tequila shots and strip clubs make way for apple picking and pie baking at Katie Dickens's summer camp-themed alternative bachelorette party.

title: Whats on Sunday
description: 10 P.M. (A&E) THE GOVERNORS WIFE Edwin Edwards, now 86 and popularly known as the King of Louisiana for his four terms as governor, and Trina Grimes Scott, now 35, both above, became pen pals when he was serving an eight-and-a-half-year prison sentence for extortion. They married after his release, to the chagrin of his 60-something daughters, Anna and Victoria. This series follows Ms. Edwards, already a mother of two teenage sons, as she tries to get pregnant using sperm Mr. Edwards froze a decade earlier; get along with stepdaughters nearly twice her age; and disarm skeptics who think shes a gold digger. (Her desire to jump out of a cake at her husbands 85th birthday party doesnt help.) The family feuding is played for laughs, Alessandra Stanley wrote in The New York Times, but there is some pathos peeking out of the margins.

title: Syria Meets Deadline for Submitting Destruction Plan for Chemical Weapons
description: GENEVA  Syria submitted a formal declaration of its chemical weapons program and its plans for destroying its arsenal three days ahead of the deadline, the international chemical weapons watchdog said Sunday.

title: In Our Pages: October 28
description: 1963 Buddhist Burns Self To Death at Cathedral

title: Johnny Knoxville and Latest Jackass Movie Are No. 1 at Theaters
description: The vulgarity-loving masses returned to North American multiplexes over the weekend, powering Jackass Presents: Bad Grandpa and its star, Johnny Knoxville, to $32 million in ticket sales, easily enough for first place. This R-rated comedy cost $15 million to make and ended a dry spell for Paramount Pictures, which last released a movie in June. Bad Grandpa, the fourth film in a franchise that started 13 years ago on MTV, did not deliver the same kind of box-office euphoria as its series predecessor: Jackass 3D took in $50.4 million over its first three days in October 2010.

title: Of Fact, Fiction and Cheneys Defibrillator
description: In a chilling episode of Homeland last year, a terrorist killed the vice president with a fiendishly clever weapon: a remote-control device that attacked the computerized defibrillator implanted in his chest.

title: Joe on WNYCs Money Talking: Oct. 25, 2013
description: President Obama was in Brooklyn this weekend to visit P-Tech, a technical high school where students earn a diploma and associates degree in six years. WNYCs Money Talking examines this new model of schooling, which promises to prepare students for jobs in our changing economy.

title: Lawmaker Offers Strong Defense of U.S. Surveillance Efforts in Europe
description: WASHINGTON  The chairman of the House Intelligence Committee, Representative Mike Rogers, on Sunday offered one of the most vigorous defenses of American surveillance activities in Europe, saying that much of the anger and resentment they have engendered were the result of misunderstandings.

title: Outsider Whose Dark, Lyrical Vision Helped Shape Rock n Roll
description: Lou Reed, the singer, songwriter and guitarist whose work with the Velvet Underground in the 1960s had a major influence on generations of rock musicians, and who remained a powerful if polarizing force for the rest of his life, died on Sunday at his home in Amagansett, N.Y., on Long Island. He was 71.

title: Colombia Rebels Free American Hostage
description: CARACAS, Venezuela  Colombias largest rebel group has released a United States citizen it held hostage for more than four months, Secretary of State John Kerry said Sunday in a statement from Washington.

title: Second Win Has Giants Humble but Hopeful
description: PHILADELPHIA  The unforeseen bliss of a two-game winning streak has not exactly gone to the Giants heads. On Sunday, in the waning moments of their second victory in seven days, their sideline was not a party zone. The sting of six losses to start the season remained.

title: The Economics of Rip Van Winkle
description: Binyamin Applebaums piece on the growing acknowledgment that moderate inflation can help, especially under current circumstances. But I cant help thinking, only now they notice? I mean, this was all worked out and carefully explained fifteen years ago.

title: Growing Giants of the Sea
description: Cruise ships have grown bigger and bigger in recent years as cruising has become ever more popular.

title: A Lion of the Left Wing Celebrates Six Decades
description: When Irving Howe and Lewis Coser started Dissent in 1954 as a quarterly magazine of independent left-wing thought, they imagined they would be lucky to last a year. Their budget was too small, and the forces against them  both the McCarthyism of national politics and the sectarian dogmatism of the broader American left  were too strong.

title: The Crusader Leaps Back Into the Past
description: Video games and comic book superheroes ought to be an irresistible combination, like chocolate and peanut butter, pancakes and maple syrup, anger and Dr. Bruce Banner. Instead, comics and games have gotten along about as well as Superman and Kryptonite.

title: Compositions Created to Be Seen ... as Well as Heard
description: In the solo concerto musical interest is aroused and sustained on the basis of an opposition between one instrument and many, Abraham Veinus wrote in The Concerto, a 1944 study. In this sense it has been described as a musical reflection of the everyday and ever-engrossing human drama of the individual lost in, emerging from, and pitted against the multitude. From Vivaldis groundbreaking Estro Armonico of 1711 to today, attributes of theater have adhered to the genre.

title: A Festival Thats Rich in Music but Puzzling in Name
description: The White Light Festival is back at Lincoln Center for a fourth season: another opportunity for music lovers to try to puzzle out the exact meaning of the title. Not that the first classical program  Handels little-known dramatic cantata Aci, Galatea e Polifemo, performed by Le Concert dAstre on Saturday evening at Alice Tully Hall  was much help.

title: Treasury Auctions Set for the Week of Oct. 28.
description: The Treasurys schedule of financing this week includes Mondays regular weekly auction of new three- and six-month bills and an auction of four-week bills on Tuesday.

title: Leve des Conflits Extended
description: Dancers performed the work by the French choreographer Boris Charmatz, in the atrium of the Museum of Modern Art.

title: When the Numbers Dont Add Up, a Movement Has to Be Left Out
description: Several times this past weekend, 24 people sat in the atrium of the Museum of Modern Art and scrubbed the floor with circling hands. Sometimes they did this in near unison. Sometimes one person did the scrubbing, while the other 23 did 23 other actions: rocking, rolling, running, spinning, leaping. Sometimes 24 actions were happening, and scrubbing wasnt one of them.

title: A Long Time Ago, in a Universe More Analog
description: In August, the director-producer J. J. Abrams released a video teaser for his latest mystery project, S. Shot in inky black and white, the video featured a strange man staggering out of the ocean, as a narrator intoned, Who is he?

title: Straight From Baden-Baden, Its Opera-Opera-Opera-Opera
description: Is reality TV art? asked the mezzo-soprano Jennifer Rivera, dressed as a Kim Kardashian look-alike in heels and a leopard-print dress, tossing a long black mane while flouncing around the Gerald W. Lynch Theater on Wednesday evening.

title: Economic Reports for the Week of Oct. 28
description: APPLE EARNINGS Apple has become one of the most valuable companies in the world largely because of the success of iPhones and iPads. But over the last year, the growth of its profit has slowed as fewer people have been upgrading their smartphones each year, and as more competitors have produced low-cost tablets. In response, Apple in September introduced not one, but two new iPhones. When the company announces its third-quarter earnings on Monday, investors and analysts will watch closely to determine whether the new iPhones have given Apples profit a much-needed lift.

title: Cavendish Open Pairs in Monaco Won by Bulgarian Team
description: The winners of the Cavendish Open Pairs in Monaco last week were Rossen Gunev and Ivan Nanev of Bulgaria. In the auction, they went for 14,000 euros ($19,300), and the purchasers received 185,000 euros ($255,400) in return: a 13-for-1 increase. Almost as good was the payoff for the second-place pair of Krzysztof Martens and Dominic Filipowicz of Poland: 110,000 euros ($152,000) for 10,000 ($13,800) paid. Third place was not nearly so profitable. To buy Tor Helness and Geir Helgemo of Monaco cost 52,000 euros ($72,000) and brought in 75,000 euros ($103,500).

title: Chris Brown Is Charged Again
description: Chris Brown was arrested early Sunday in Washington after a fight broke out near the W Hotel, The Associated Press reported.

title: Joyce Theater Plans
description: The New York City Ballet principal Wendy Whelan, DanceBrazil and Pilobolus are among those slated to perform on the Joyce Theater stage in 2014. Joyce officials are to announce on Monday that the spring and summer season will kick off Feb. 19 to 23 with Jessica Lang Dance, followed by Brazil Festival from Feb. 26 to March 16. The festival is to feature four contemporary companies, including DanceBrazil, a group founded in 1977 and specializing in Afro-Brazilian movement, contemporary dance and capoeira. From April 1 to 6, the Joyce will host the New York City premiere of Ms. Whelans Restless Creature, a suite of four duets. The summer season will wrap up with an annual appearance from Pilobolus, based in Connecticut, from July 15 through Aug. 10. The company is to perform two programs, including a New York premiere of a collaboration with Etgar Keret, an Israeli author.

title: Too Big to Sail? Cruise Ships Face Scrutiny
description: One of the largest cruise ships in 1985 was the 46,000-ton Carnival Holiday. Ten years ago, the biggest, the Queen Mary 2, was three times as large. Todays record holders are two 225,000-ton ships whose displacement, a measure of a ships weight, is about the same as that of a Nimitz-class aircraft carrier.

title: Celebrity Apologizes for Blackface Costume
description: Julianne Hough (Dancing With the Stars, Safe Haven) was criticized over the weekend after donning blackface at a Halloween party in Beverly Hills, Calif.

title: Hiding Within His Own Words
description: You see, I still dont really know quite what I want to do, Leonard Bernstein wrote to a friend in 1939, when he was 20. Conduct, compose, piano, produce, arrange, etc. Im all of these and none of them.

title: Keeping Score: Molina Dashes Ambitions of Bostons Base Stealers
description: Updated, 12:44 a.m. |

title: Verbal Feedback
description: MONDAYS PUZZLE  Evolution is inevitable, and perhaps the puzzles are evolving. Last Monday we had a relatively smooth puzzle except for an entry that I would categorize as a non-Monday word (FUMET), and today we have another: PLENA, which has appeared before, but only once on a Monday, and that was back in 1996.

title: Better Than a Tweet? In Four Characters, a New World of Meaning
description: There is a Chinese idiom that might be used to describe the place of idioms in Chinese literary tradition: jianding buyi (), meaning firm and unchanging. The use of such expressions, especially the classical set phrases known as chengyu (), has long been seen as a mark of erudition in China. Most chengyu consist of only four characters, but they dont follow the grammar and syntax of modern Chinese, and as many frustrated Mandarin students can tell you, they are often indecipherable without some knowledge of their origins, often in ancient Chinese literature that preceded the birth of Christ.

title: Lou Reed, 1942-2013
description: Mr. Reed, a disciple of Andy Warhol and of the poet Delmore Schwartz, claimed his niche as musics eternal New York bohemian.

title: NATO Reduces Scope of Its Afghanistan Plans
description: BRUSSELS  After months of tense negotiations over the size and role of a postwar presence in Afghanistan, senior North Atlantic Treaty Organization officials say they are planning a more minimalist mission, with a force consisting of fewer combat trainers and more military managers to ensure that billions of dollars in security aid are not squandered or pilfered.

title: Obama Eases Pakistans Worries Over Drones
description: Obama finds a solution to the drone problem.

title: Marathon as Melting Pot
description: On a recent foggy Sunday in Central Park, a group of runners lingered near the finish line of a half-marathon, recounting their efforts in Spanish. They had finished the 13.1-mile course before many entrants reached the halfway point.

title: Is the Dumb Jock Really a Nerd?
description: In the frequent debates over the merits of science and philosophy, or the humanities in general, it is often assumed that the factual grounding and systematic methodology of the sciences serve as a corrective to the less rigorous wanderings of the humanities. And while many take the position that the humanities can provide their own important path to enlightenment, few argue that considerations from philosophy can or should correct the considered judgment of scientists. Even most defenders of the humanities hold that the sciences are directed at truth, whereas the humanities have an alternate goal, perhaps the molding of ideal citizens.

title: Winning Lottery Numbers for Oct. 26, 2013
Currency Regimes, Capital Flows, and Crises (Wonkish) (Link Fixed)
description: Update: Link fixed

title: Fast, Diverse, and Striving
description: The West Side Runners Club comprises a diverse group of immigrants who train rigorously despite working long hours.

title: Georgia Elects New President, but Real Power Will Rest With Next Premier
description: TBILISI, Georgia  Georgian voters chose a new president on Sunday, but with billionaire Prime Minister Bidzina Ivanishvili planning to step down shortly in favor of an unnamed successor, it remained unclear who would hold the prime ministers post, now the most powerful political office in the country.

title: The Music of Lou Reed
description: The music career of Lou Reed spanned several decades, and his work with the Velvet Underground in the 1960s is often cited as a major influence for many rock musicians.

title: Blast Kills at Least 17 in Restive Afghan Province
description: KABUL, Afghanistan  A minivan carrying nearly two dozen civilians to a wedding in eastern Afghanistan struck a roadside mine on Sunday, killing at least 17 people, mostly women.

title: Road-Weary Rangers Are Back Home at Last
description: Rangers defenseman Marc Staal was asked after practice Sunday how it felt to be back at Madison Square Garden. I think I got lost coming in here, he said, a response meant to be humorous, although he might not have been entirely kidding.

title: Mondays Matchup: Seahawks at Rams
description: Seahawks (6-1) at Rams (3-4)

title: Gomes Sends Red Sox to 4-2 Victory Over Cardinals in Game 4
description: David Ortiz led with his actions on the field and his pep talk in the dugout, and Jonny Gomes got the message.

title: Dogs Tale: From Death Row to Doorstep
description: SALEM, Mo.  It might have played out like an ordinary story of a family dog accused of biting someone elses child, until a mysterious man wearing a baseball cap and a fake beard showed up at the home of Patrick and Amber Sanders, talking about secret codes and safe houses.

title: Preparing Teachers for the Classroom
description: To the Editor:

title: Is Economics a Science? Its a Tricky Question
description: To the Editor:

title: British Tabloids on Trial, Along With Ex-Editors
description: LONDON  The ethics of the once mighty and still powerful British newspaper industry went on trial here on Monday, with two former top editors from Rupert Murdochs media empire facing criminal accusations involving phone hacking and obstructing justice.

title: New York, Take Note
description: To the Editor:

title: Comparing Dreams
description: To the Editor:

title: A Fans Mission: Resurrect a Little-Watched Movie
description: LOS ANGELES  There are those who didnt much care for The Assassination of Jesse James by the Coward Robert Ford. They include The New York Times critic Manohla Dargis, who called it lachrymose and another gauzy chapter to the overtaxed James myth.

title: Wikipedia China Becomes Front Line for Views on Language and Culture
description: HONG KONG  The Chinese-language version of Wikipedia has become more than an online encyclopedia: it is a battlefield for editors from China, Taiwan and Hong Kong in a region charged with political, ideological and cultural differences.

title: NFL Networks 10-Year Gains: 13 Games and 72 Million Homes
description: When the NFL Network celebrates its 10th anniversary next week, uphill battles and predictions of doom will be distant memories for those who kept the National Football Leagues channel from going under during its early cliffhanger years.

title: Jets Up-and-Down Pattern Holds, and Crumples Them
description: CINCINNATI  It was not the Bengals first touchdown that epitomized their domination of the Jets on Sunday. Or their second. Or their third. Or even their fourth, though all were worthy candidates.

title: The Big Kludge
description: The good news about HealthCare.gov, the portal to Obamacares health exchange, is that the administration is no longer minimizing its problems. Thats the first step toward fixing the mess  and it will get fixed, although its anyones guess whether the new promise of a smoothly functioning system by the end of November will be met. We know, after all, that Obamacare is workable, since many states that chose to run their own exchanges are doing quite well.

title: Ruling Doubles Paycheck for 1,375 Employees at High-Grossing Queens Slot Parlor
description: Jeannine Nixon looked as if she had hit the jackpot. Ms. Nixon, a customer relations representative at Resorts World Casino in Queens, had just learned that she would be making $40,000 a year, up from $22,300.

title: Gawker Kicks Open the Closet, but Its Disclosure Barely Reverberates
description: What if Gawker tried to out an anchor at Fox News and no one cared?

title: South Carolinas Clowney Savors a Rare Moment of Joy
description: COLUMBIA, Mo.  Jadeveon Clowney hobbled down the hill leading from the visitors locker room here, headphones around his neck, a pizza box in his left hand, a smile on his face. At the bottom of the hill was his family. And beyond them, a few dozen South Carolina fans were waiting behind metal fences, calling his name.

title: Twitter Prepares to Feed New Hunger for I.P.O.s
description: When it was preparing to go public in 2012, Facebook kindled hopes that the broad interest in the company would accelerate a slow rise in new stock offerings.

title: On Way to Wild Final Act, Three Protagonists Have Faced Rough Spots
description: ST. LOUIS  Allen Craig, Will Middlebrooks and Jim Joyce will be long connected by what happened at third base Saturday night at Busch Stadium, by their roles in one of the wildest endings to a World Series game.

title: Shelter From the Storms
description: WHEN the floodwaters rose around New Orleans hospitals after Hurricane Katrina in 2005, doctors wondered whom to rescue first. Sick babies? Critically ill adults? The elderly?

title: Data Suggests Push to Spy on Merkel Dates to 02
description: BERLIN  New details about the monitoring of Chancellor Angela Merkels cellphone by the National Security Agency further stoked the German governments anger on Sunday and raised two questions: Why did the United States target her as early as 2002, and why did it take five years for the Obama administration to put a halt to the surveillance?

title: The Costumes We Choose
description: BELGRADE LAKES, Me.  SALES of President Obama masks at Party City in Augusta, Me., are down this Halloween season, way down. Its not that popular an item, said a sales clerk when I visited a few weeks ago. Youd think this would be a bad sign for the Democrats, but on the other hand, there werent any John Boehner or Mitch McConnell masks in the store. The public has spoken: no one fantasizes about being a politician anymore. The most popular costume at that Party City? The minions from Despicable Me.

title: Octonauts Series Adds Federal Partner in Ocean Awareness
description: Octonauts, the animated preschool series about a crew of eight undersea adventurers whose motto is explore, rescue and protect, is getting a seal of approval of sorts from a unit of the National Oceanic and Atmospheric Administration.

title: Not One More
description: President Obama urged Congress on Thursday to revive immigration reform, which is not dead but not moving, either. He was talking mostly to House Republicans, though he also urged business, labor and religious groups to keep putting the pressure on all of us to get this done.

title: Disney Show Will Appear First on App for Tablets
description: LOS ANGELES  A cat in a pink cowboy hat is leading Disneys television operation deeper into the Wild West of mobile viewing, where it hopes to connect with the companys core audience.

title: Why Prisons Are Shrinking
description: The mandatory sentencing movement that swept the United States beginning in the 1970s drove the state prison population up from less than 200,000 to about 1.4 million today and made corrections the second-fastest-growing state expense after Medicaid. But bipartisan sentencing reforms in a growing number of states are starting to reverse that trend  causing the prison population to decline by about 3.8 percent since 2009.

title: Health Sites Woes Could Dissuade Vital Enrollee: the Young and Healthy
description: WASHINGTON  Sean Jackson, like tens of thousands of other Americans, has had trouble signing up for medical coverage using the HealthCare.gov insurance marketplace, despite several attempts.

title: For Extending New Yorks Judicial Terms
description: The judicial retirement ages embedded in New York States Constitution are a relic of a time when average life expectancy was much shorter than it is today. A sensible proposal on the Nov. 5 ballot, Proposition 6, would modestly extend the age limits for certain state judges and help ease court system backlogs by allowing seasoned judges to stay on past age 70. We urge voters to approve the change.

title: Game 3s Decisive Play: Why Call Was Obstruction
description: You think baseball is not intricate? Consider the difference between interference and obstruction. The dictionary says that in some cases, the words are interchangeable.

title: A Real Job in Make-Believe
description: Its called faking New York  making a movie or television show in some other city with locales ginned up to resemble the one and only. A lot of people were faking New York, says Katherine Oliver, the commissioner of the Mayors Office of Media and Entertainment, looking back over the last 11 years. They were making a movie about Rudy Giuliani in Montreal! Ridiculous.

title: F.D.A. Shift on Painkillers Was Years in the Making
description: When Heather Dougherty heard the news last week that the Food and Drug Administration had recommended tightening how doctors prescribed the most commonly used narcotic painkillers, she was overjoyed. Fourteen years earlier, her father, Dr. Ronald J. Dougherty, had filed a formal petition urging federal officials to crack down on the drugs.

title: Forging an Art Market in China
description: BEIJING  When the hammer came down at an evening auction during China Guardians spring sale in May 2011, Eagle Standing on a Pine Tree, a 1946 ink painting by Qi Baishi, one of Chinas 20th-century masters, had drawn a startling price: $65.4 million.

title: Corrections: October 28, 2013
description: NEW YORK

title: Strong Finish by Williams in Capping a Dominant Year
description: ISTANBUL  Pushing past the lingering lethargy from her grueling season, Serena Williams finished her 2-6, 6-3, 6-0 victory against Li Na in the final of the WTA Championships with a backhand down-the-line winner into the open court, then fell to her knees in relief.

title: Media Outlets Embrace Conferences as Profits Rise
description: Financially struggling media companies are racing to add conferences, festivals and other live events to their business strategy, convinced they can provide a reliable revenue stream and expand the reach of their brands.

title: Caught Between Sudans, Region Tries to Pick Side
description: KHARTOUM, Sudan  Residents of the disputed Abyei region, on the border of Sudan and South Sudan, began voting in a referendum Sunday on which country to be part of. Though the voting was largely symbolic, and likely to be heavily one-sided, it could have very real consequences if it raises tensions and prompts further conflict in an area plagued with violence.

title: Is Glenn Greenwald the Future of News?
description: Much of the speculation about the future of news focuses on the business model: How will we generate the revenues to pay the people who gather and disseminate the news? But the disruptive power of the Internet raises other profound questions about what journalism is becoming, about its essential character and values. This weeks column is a conversation  a (mostly) civil argument  between two very different views of how journalism fulfills its mission.

title: Threesome to Tantalize and Behold
description: So just how sexy is it? Oh, admit it. Thats the biggest question on your mind. You didnt pay all that money for tickets to Betrayal because it was written by the Nobel Prize-winning playwright Harold Pinter, the great master of existential dread and the vagaries of memory.

title: A Tap-Dancer in Training With Hopes as High as Falling Stars
description: Dancing With the Stars it most definitely is not. And thats part of what makes Tina Satters House of Dance, at the Abrons Arts Center, so very refreshing.

title: Video Offered to Back Claim of Cairo Attack
description: CAIRO  A little-known Islamic extremist group released a video over the weekend providing evidence that it orchestrated a deadly car bombing here last month, while seeking to enlist others in a violent revolt against the military-backed government that ousted President Mohamed Morsi of the Muslim Brotherhood.

title: For Many, Free Subway Rides on Anniversary of Hurricane
description: It was conceived as a good-will gesture from Gov. Andrew M. Cuomo to the subway riders whose lines had been disrupted by Hurricane Sandy: Let R train riders in Brooklyn and A train riders from Howard Beach and the Rockaways in Queens travel without paying on Tuesday, the anniversary of the storm.

title: Arthur C. Danto, a Philosopher of Art, Is Dead at 89
description: Arthur C. Danto, a philosopher who became one of the most widely read art critics of the Postmodern era, championing avant-garde artists like Andy Warhol and proclaiming the end of art history, died on Friday at his home in Manhattan. He was 89.

title: Robinson Risner, Ace Fighter Pilot, Dies at 88
description: Brig. Gen. Robinson Risner, one of the nations most decorated pilots in the Korean and Vietnam Wars, who spent seven and a half years in the infamous Hanoi Hilton prison after being shot down, died on Tuesday at his home in Bridgewater, Va. He was 88.

title: Marcia Wallace, Comic Actress on The Simpsons, Dies at 70
description: Marcia Wallace, the bubbly comic actress who greeted doctors and group-therapy patients on The Bob Newhart Show in the 1970s and burnished the image of jaded, substance-abusing fourth-grade teachers as the Emmy Award-winning voice of Edna Krabappel for more than two decades on Foxs animated hit The Simpsons, died on Friday in Los Angeles. She was 70.

title: Rare Giants Takeaway Alters Game
description: PHILADELPHIA  Giants defensive back Terrell Thomas saw the football dangling there, like an apple hanging from a limb  said limb being Matt Barkleys extended right arm.

title: Winning Lottery Numbers for Oct. 27, 2013
Harvard and Harvey Mudd: Both Best Value Colleges, Depending on the List
description: Top ten lists that ranked colleges based on the best value for students vary widely.

title: If Jews Skip Synagogue and Christians Skip Church
This Time, a Nascar Breakthrough Remains in Full View
description: It took 65 years for a black driver to make it to victory lane in Nascar. On Saturday, it finally happened.

title: Lists That Rank Colleges Value Are on the Rise
description: Looking out over the quadrangle before him as students dashed from one class to the next, James Muyskens was feeling proud one recent afternoon, and why not?

title: Popular Demand
description: There were 16.1 million desktop and laptop computers sold in the United States in the third quarter  the back-to-school shopping season  up 3.5 percent compared to the same period in 2012.

title: News From the Advertising Industry
description: Accounts

title: Skakel Lawyer, in a TV Twist, Is Talk Fodder
description: For two decades, when the tribulations of the famous and the notorious have aired on television, Mickey Sherman has been there to talk and talk: about O. J. Simpson, Martha Stewart, Michael Vick, Casey Anthony, Michael Jackson, just to name a few whose legal cases he analyzed for the camera. When Nancy Grace needed help explaining how a man accused of murder had walked free even after the victims bodies were found in his backyard, Mr. Sherman was there, making the CNN studio peal with laughter.

title: City Drops Bid to Ban Display of Cigarettes
description: A highly contested bill to require stores to keep cigarettes out of sight has been quietly dropped from a package of anti-tobacco measures that would make New York the first city to raise the legal smoking age to 21.

title: Clarksons Homecoming for the Maple Leafs Is Delayed but Hard-Hitting
description: TORONTO  David Clarkson was supposed to be the feel-good story of the summer: hometown boy signs with the Toronto Maple Leafs, the team he grew up idolizing, and hopes to make his mark right away.

title: Debate Postponed a Day, Out of Respect for Storm Victims
description: Officials have postponed by one day the final televised debate between the mayoral candidates Bill de Blasio and Joseph J. Lhota, originally set for Tuesday, after they both unexpectedly requested that the debate not be held on the first anniversary of Hurricane Sandy.

title: Budgets Challenge Libraries, a Point of Integration for Immigrants
description: You can always tell what time of year it is by the array of books that greet visitors to the Sheepshead Bay branch of the Brooklyn Public Library. These days, volumes on womens suffrage, the Constitution and democracy occupy a place of honor in anticipation of Election Day.

title: Atop Thoroughbred Racing and Remaining Positive, Despite a Painful Setback
description: NICHOLASVILLE, Ky.  Ken Ramsey, whose father was a mechanic and did not advance beyond a sixth-grade education, is joyful and proud as he details his rise to becoming one of thoroughbred racings most successful owners and breeders.

title: Red Bulls Savor Being No. 1 ... for a Night
description: HARRISON, N.J.  The Red Bulls have won nothing. The Red Bulls finished No. 1 over all in Major League Soccer, but the Red Bulls have won nothing. The Red Bulls won the leagues Supporters Shield on Sunday night at Red Bull Arena.

title: McKellen & Stewart: Playing Macbeth
description: Part 2: The actors compare their experiences playing Macbeth and reveal the surprising things theyve learned about each other.

description: Part 10: The actors explain how they put together the dual production of No Mans Land and Waiting for Godot.

description: Part 3: The actors recount their earliest experiences with each other and with Pinters No Mans Land.

description: Part 6: The actors explain how they select material.

title: McKellen & Stewart: Stage vs. Screen
description: Part 9: The actors discuss the differences between stage and screen acting, and the relationship between actors and the audience.

title: McKellen & Stewart: New York Theater
description: Part 11: The actors reflect on the very different working environments theyve experienced in New York, London and Los Angeles.

title: McKellen & Stewart: On X-Men
description: Part 8: The actors reminisce about how they became involved in the X-Men films.
