description: Part 4: The actors discuss which actors and actresses inspire them today.

title: Children, Too, Need Flu Shots
description: Seasonal flu killed 830 children from 2004 to 2012, and 43 percent of them had no high-risk medical conditions. The rest of the children had neurological, pulmonary, cardiac and other serious disorders.

title: Commutings Hidden Cost
description: My twin grandsons, now 13, walk nearly a mile to and from school and play basketball in the schoolyard for an hour or more most afternoons, when weather and music lessons permit.

title: The Marginal Tax Rate Mess
description: Nancy Folbre is professor emerita of economics at the University of Massachusetts, Amherst.

title: Word of the Day | sobriety
description: sobriety \s-bri--te, so-\ noun

title: New Milestone Emerges: Babys First iPhone App
description: Charlotte Deutsch, who will be 2 years old next month, has a look of pure delight as she swipes the screen of her mothers old iPhone, and finds a picture of herself.

title: Strange Motivations Reveal Their Logic
description: Youve been very, very brave.

title: McKellen & Stewart: Pet Causes
description: Part 14: The actors explain their charity work and what inspires it.

title: Whats on Monday
description: 9 P.M. (HBO) SEDUCED AND ABANDONED (2013) In May 2012, James Toback and Alec Baldwin (from left above) spent 10 days schmoozing their way through the Cannes Film Festival as they tried to secure financing for a proposed movie project: a political-erotic Middle Eastern adventure inspired by Bernardo Bertoluccis Last Tango in Paris and starring Mr. Baldwin and Neve Campbell as the characters played by Marlon Brando and Maria Schneider. The men filmed the proceedings  from pitches to billionaires and studio moguls to encounters with movie stars and directors  then turned it into a cinematic romp about Hollywood deal making. Seduced and Abandoned, which uses split screens much of the time, rambles entertainingly from topic to topic, Stephen Holden wrote in The New York Times. It begins with a complaint ascribed to Orson Welles that he spent 95 percent of his life running around trying to raise money for movies and 5 percent making them. There is hardly a dull moment. It may be, he added, the years most entertaining put-on.

title: Red Sox Top Cardinals to Even Series
description: ST. LOUIS  With the Cardinals down, 4-2, and with two outs in the bottom of the ninth inning Sunday, Carlos Beltran, a hitting star who represented the tying run, came to bat. The way St. Louis won the night before, he would surely hit the next pitch to the outfield seats.

title: Photo Replay: Oct. 20-26
description: Although the competition provides the primary focus, sporting events often create vivid patterns to complement the action.

title: N.B.A. Game of the Week: A Chance to Settle a Grudge
description: Every week, The New York Times will be choosing one essential game to watch, highlighting hot teams, winning and losing streaks, and statistical intrigue in the N.B.A.

title: News Quiz | October 27, 2013
description: See what you know about the news below. To prepare, you might scan the articles or summaries on todays paper. Good luck!

title: Bless This Food Delivery Guy
description: Dear Diary:

title: How the Poll Was Conducted
description: The latest New York Times/Siena College Poll of New York City consists of telephone interviews with 1,215 adult residents throughout the city conducted Oct. 21 through Oct. 26. Of these, 701 were judged to be likely voters.

title: De Blasio in Position to Win Mayors Race by Historic Margin, Poll Shows
description: Bill de Blasio is poised to win the race for mayor of New York City by a historically large margin, powered by optimism that he will bring about change and by overwhelming voter disapproval of the Republican Party.

title: The N.Y.C. Mayors Race: A Final Look
description: The New York Times and Siena College interviewed voters throughout New York City about their views on the candidates for mayor and their expectations for the next administration.

title: The Latest New York Times Polling Results
description: Full results on a New York Times and Siena College poll of voters throughout New York City conducted Oct. 21-26.

title: Week 8 N.F.L. Quick Hits: The Pure Arm of Matthew Stafford
description: Andy Benoit takes a tour through Week 8, which included another coaching masterpiece from Bill Belichick, a giveaway game by the Steelers and an irrelevant performance from the Vikings Adrian Peterson:

title: New Guidelines on Punishing Child Rape Win Praise, and Criticism
description: A string of cases this year of adults raping or sexually assaulting children has sickened the Chinese public. Last week the Supreme Peoples Court reacted, issuing a legal opinion mandating heavier punishments for sex offenders  especially state employees, including teachers, who figured in many of the cases.

title: Singapore Showcase
description: FID Fashion Week, one of the increasing number of style events in this increasingly wealthy city, presented collections by Asian and French designers.

title: Hopes of Market Reforms in China Tempered by Political Realities
description: Chinas leaders head toward a major policy-setting conference next month bearing heady expectations that they have encouraged, and a proposal from a prominent government research organization has magnified speculation that they will embrace bold pro-market overhauls.

title: Test Yourself | E.L.L. Practice, Oct. 28, 2013
description: Before Taking the Quiz

title: 6 Qs About the News | War Criminals and the World Series of 1946
description: In the This Land column A World Away, the Seventh Game; Close at Hand, Condemned Nazis, Dan Barry writes about the World Series of 1946 and the chaplains who were counseling Nazis awaiting their fate at Nuremberg prison in Germany at the time.

title: Chronicler of War Nears 100, and Counting
description: It was one celebrated photographers salute to another. With war photography in the news, wrote Bob Gomel of Life magazine, how about some recognition for Max Desfor of The Associated Press?

title: Will You Be Wearing a Halloween Costume This Year?
description: Halloween, a favorite holiday of many, will be here on Thursday.

title: South Koreans Say They Fled to North Korea for Better Life
description: SEOUL, South Korea  Six South Koreans repatriated from North Korea over the weekend said that they had fled to the North through China in recent years to escape bankruptcies and family troubles in the South and in search of a better life in the North, the South Korean news media and government officials said on Monday.

title: Spain Summons American Ambassador on New Reports of N.S.A. Spying
description: MADRID  The Spanish government on Monday summoned the American ambassador to address allegations that the National Security Agency had recently collected data on 60 million telephone calls in Spain.

title: Narendra Modi and the Calculus of Tea
description: PATNA, Bihar  Arun Pathak, a social worker, and his friends have been meeting at a tea stall near Patna Universitys College of Arts & Crafts for years. Were all regulars here, Mr. Pathak said, taking a sip of strongly brewed masala chai.

title: Behind the Cover Story: Jeff Himmelman on Rickety Boats and Threatening Ships in the South China Sea
description: Jeff Himmelman, a contributing writer for the magazine, wrote this weeks cover story about the South China Sea, where a Filipino crew on a forsaken boat is trying to hold ground as Chinese ships close in (the disputed region is home to oil and natural-gas reserves, major shipping lanes and fisheries). His last article for the magazine was on the singer Frank Ocean.

title: New York Today: Hurricane Sandy, One Year Later
description: Updated 12:14 p.m. | A human chain, wiggly and windswept, formed on Rockaway Beach in Queens on Sunday.

title: 5 People Killed After Vehicle Crashes at Tiananmen Square
description: Updated, 10:29 a.m. ET | A sport-utility vehicle crashed into pedestrians and caught fire on Monday alongside Tiananmen gate in Beijing, killing five people, including the driver and two passengers, and wounding 38 others, according to the Beijing police and the state-run Xinhua News Agency.

title: Daily Report: Twitter Readies to Meet Growing Interest in I.P.O.s
description: As Twitter begins an eight-city road show this week to pitch its stock sale to big institutional shareholders like Fidelity, BlackRock and Legg Mason, it will be entering one of the strongest markets for I.P.O.s in three years, especially in the United States. Despite Facebooks initial stumble in its market debut in May 2012, investors have shown a growing appetite for initial offerings, eager to take risks in hopes of big rewards when shares of newly public companies rise, Michael J. de la Merced and David Gelles report.

title: In the Shadow of Katrina
description: Hurricane Katrina devastated the Gulf Coast in 2005, and Louisiana's troubled housing recovery has shaped the response to every major disaster since, including Hurricane Sandy.

title: After Hurricanes, the Road Home, the Long Way
description: This weeks Retro Report video tells the story of Louisiana after Hurricane Katrina in 2005  not the levee failures, FEMAs infamous trailers or the legal battles with insurers, but the long process of rebuilding homes.

title: Sheiks and Princelings and Beeznessmen, Oh My
description: Joe Weisenthal tells us whos buying all those incredibly expensive London residences. Its not the locals:

title: Security Firm G4S Rejects $2.5 Billion Offer for Cash Transport Unit
description: LONDON  The security company G4S says it has rejected a 1.55 billion pound ($2.51 billion) nonbinding offer from the British private equity firm Charterhouse Capital Partners for its business that provides armed car and other cash transport services.

title: A Year Late, S.E.C. Weighs in With 585 Pages of Crowdfunding Rules
description: The day before the Securities and Exchange Commission voted last week to propose rules to implement the crowdfunding section of last years JOBS Act, advocates on both sides of the issue  those favoring investor protection and those eager to make it easier for companies to raise capital  appeared to fear the worst. Youve waited so long for the shoe to drop that you think its never going to, said D.J. Paul, vice chairman of Crowdfund Intermediary Regulatory Advocates, a trade association for the new industry. Now Im just afraid that the shoe might drop on our head.

title: Whats Going On in This Picture? | Oct. 28, 2013
description: Update: Oct. 29, 2013

title: AMC Networks to Acquire Chellomedia From Liberty Global
description: LONDON  AMC Networks said on Monday that it had agreed to acquire substantially all of Chellomedia, an international content division of Liberty Global, the media company controlled by John C. Malone, in a deal valued at 750 million euros, or $1.04 billion.

title: Kasparov Faces Obstacles to Leading Chess Federation
description: Garry Kasparov, the former world chess champion who retired in 2005, is preparing to re-enter the chess arena, and his next opponent may be the most formidable, and strangest, he has faced.

title: Researchers Draw Romantic Insights From Maps of Facebook Networks
description: Its not in the stars after all. Instead, it seems, the shape of a persons social network is a powerful signal that can identify ones spouse or romantic partner  and even if a relationship is likely to break up.

title: Goldmans Charitable Efforts Stoke Tensions
description: Goldman Sachs wants the world to know it has a charitable side, DealBooks Susanne Craig reports. With the same calculation that earned it a reputation as the savviest trading house on Wall Street, it has staked out a position as one of the nations leading corporate philanthropists, giving away more than $1.6 billion since 2008. As John F.W. Rogers, Goldman Sachss chief of staff, put it: Engaging wasnt just the right thing, it was necessary, especially in the wake of the financial crisis when people said we werent doing enough.

title: LG and Samsung Throw a Curve
description: TOKYO  Remember when telephone handsets were curved to bring the microphone closer to your mouth? That began back in the days of rotary dials. The smartphones of today are flat, to accommodate touch screens. But that may be starting to change.

title: BY THE NUMBERS
description: Giorgio Armani is breezily and busily approaching his fifth decade of design under his namesake label.

title: By Design | High Season for High Jewels
description: Diamonds may be a girls best friend, but next month is all about men designing and collecting some of the worlds greatest gems. The Paris-based Joel Arthur Rosenthal, known professionally as JAR  an acronym synonymous for more than 35 years with ne plus ultra jewels fashioned into spirals, flowers and butterflies  will unveil his first American retrospective, Jewels by JAR, at the Metropolitan Museum of Art in New York. Meanwhile, Sothebys will showcase the rarest pieces made by the retired Alexandre Reza, in addition to designs by his son Olivier, with an exhibition, The Extraordinary Jewelry of Alexandre Reza. Finally, Sheikh Hamad bin Abdullah Al Thani of Qatar boasts an unparalleled private collection of Indian jewels spanning the past 400 years  from handcrafted jade daggers of the Mughal courts to emerald turban ornaments favored by 19th-century maharajahs  which have been bound into a beautiful tome.

title: Confronting the Legacies of Slavery
description: DURHAM, North Carolina  Late one afternoon in March, officials unveiled a new monument at the University of the West Indies, in Cave Hill, Barbados. The ceremony featured African drumming, a historians lecture, a bishops prayer and a song performed by a school choir with the chorus, We cry for the ancestors!

title: The Curious Case of India and China
description: During his recent visit to China, Prime Minister Manmohan Singh of India said that when the two Asian giants shake hands, the world takes notice. Although the statement stands true, the real question to ask is whether the media and the security and diplomatic community in the two countries make much of this handshake. It can be argued India-China relations comprise a slew of missed opportunities, and these two have added yet another chapter to this narrative.

title: The Confidence Gnomes
description: Its kind of sad, but I suspect that half a century from now the main thing people will remember me for  if they remember anything  is the confidence fairy. So maybe I can somewhat package my attempts to debunk the Hellenization of our discourse (pdf) by pointing out that the scare stories seem to involve invoking a related set of characters, the confidence gnomes. (Theyre also related to these guys.)

title: Sounds of Continued Rebuilding
description: After Hurricane Sandy, Kim Spinella and her family spent four and a half months in a motor home parked in the driveway of their Babylon, N.Y., house. A year later, the construction goes on.

title: The Loss of Accessibility
description: When her one-story Union Beach, N.J., home flooded during Hurricane Sandy, Millie Gonzalez, who uses a wheelchair, moved in with her sister and is now in a home that does not meet her physical needs.

title: Creepy Uncle Sam Is Back, With More Bad Advice
description: The conservative group Generation Opportunity is back with another creepy Uncle Sam ad attacking the Affordable Care Act. When we last saw the health-insurance-is-evil mascot, in September, he was performing gynecological exams on young women and prostate exams on young men, in an effort to make Americans believe that the government is playing doctor.

title: Japanese Banks Inquiry Finds Details of Shady Loans
description: Updated, 7:03 p.m. | TOKYO  The used-car dealers that dot the outskirts of Tokyo and other Japanese cities are an unlikely link between one of Japans biggest banks and the countrys yakuza gangsters.

title: Cardinals Roster Feels Two Players Short
description: ST. LOUIS  The Boston Red Sox are one win away from a World Series championship while hitting .205. The St. Louis Cardinals are one game from elimination while hitting .218. No team has allowed more than four earned runs in a game.

title: Brown Rice Bowl With Oven-Baked Miso-Glazed Tofu, Red Peppers and Kimchi
description: I use the same marinade for the peppers as I do for the tofu in this sweet and spicy mix of toppings. The kimchi is the main vegetable, but if you only want it as a condiment add another vegetable of your choice  steamed or blanched broccoli or greens, for example, or roasted squash, or anything else that catches your eye in the Recipes for Health archives.

title: Farro or Bulgur With Black-Eyed Peas, Chard and Feta
description: Black-eyed peas cooked with greens is a classic Greek preparation. I decided to add a chile pepper to the beans, just to spice things up a little. I like to serve the beans with bulgur, but you can also serve them with farro.

title: Israel Agrees to U.N. Human Rights Review
description: GENEVA  Israel will participate in a review of its human rights record at the United Nations Human Rights Council in Geneva on Tuesday, a decision announced after Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu ended the countrys 18-month boycott of the council.

title: Red Rice or Farro With Miso-Roasted Squash, Leeks, Red Pepper and Tofu
description: Tofu, red peppers, leeks and winter squash all benefit from the same sweet/salty marinade in this dish. The squash sweetens as it roasts and is irresistible. I recommend that you roast more than the recipe calls for because it makes a delicious snack. The vegetables look pretty against a tawny grain like red rice or farro.

title: Millet Polenta With Tomato Sauce, Eggplant and Chickpeas
description: Millet polenta is as comforting as it gets. In season you can use fresh tomatoes in the topping, but canned will work just fine. You could also make this dish with cornmeal polenta.

title: Millet Polenta With Mushrooms and Broccoli or Broccoli Raab
description: I had envisioned serving this savory mix of mushrooms over a bowl of farro, and farro  or brown rice or barley, for that matter  would certainly work well. But I made the mushrooms on the same day that I made the polenta in Millet Polenta With Tomato Sauce, Eggplant and Chickpeas and ended up spooning them over the millet, which was so delicious and comforting that I voted on the polenta as the accompanying grain. Cornmeal polenta would also work well.

title: A Storm Still Felt
description: Readers who had been affected by Hurricane Sandy shared stories of frustrations and silver linings, offering glimpses at the physical, financial and emotional impact that remains.

title: T WINTER LUXURY
description: For the modern minimalist, dressing up really is that simple.

title: Image of the Day: October 28
Indian Officials Say Outlawed Militant Group Is Behind Patna Blasts
description: NEW DELHI  Investigators believe that Indian Mujahedeen, an outlawed Islamic group, was behind a series of explosions on Sunday that killed at least six people and disrupted a huge political rally in Patna, a senior official said Monday.

title: Today in Small Business: Prankvertising
description: Whats affecting me, my clients and other small-business owners today.

title: Calculus Made Easy
description: Updated, 8:56 a.m. | In addition to covering our weekly brain benders, wed like to open Numberplay to students or teachers who might be learning certain math concepts for the first time, or who might be looking for inspiration when teaching them. Wed also like to hear from those who have questions about numbers in the news. Please send your math questions or questions about how to understand math-based articles in The New York Times to gary.antonick@nytimes.com, with the subject heading Numberplay question. Selected concepts and suggestions will be covered at a future date.

title: Fleetwood Mac Cancels Tour as John McVie Undergoes Cancer Treatment
description: Fleetwood Mac announced on its Facebook page on Sunday that it was canceling a monthlong, 14-concert tour of New Zealand and Australia, set to start Nov. 10, because its bassist, John McVie, was scheduled to undergo cancer treatment during that period. The statement did not say what form of cancer the 67-year-old Mr. McVie had, and Liz Rosenberg, the groups spokeswoman, said she had no further information.

title: McKellen & Stewart: Roles Untaken
description: Part 16: The actors reveal the roles they most regret turning down.

title: McKellen & Stewart: Choice Lines
description: Part 15: The actors share their favorite lines of dialogue and their favorite comic actors.

title: A Trophy Thief Goes for the Gold
description: As far as heists go, the disguise was cartoonish  the thief was swaddled like a ninja from head to toe. His method was neither high-tech nor elegant  he kicked in doors and smashed glass cases. But his taste was impeccable, and sporting: his haul included the 1903 Belmont Stakes trophy, a silver Faberg soup tureen and ladle given by Czar Nicholas II of Russia to an American harness horse impresario and the United States Amateur Championship trophy that completed golfer Bobby Joness Grand Slam in 1930.

title: Strong Winds Across Europe
description: Scenes from Brussels, Amsterdam and London on Monday as a storm  which killed several people, cut power and disrupted transportation schedules  swept through the region.

title: McKellen & Stewart: Highbrow vs. Lowbrow
description: Part 13: The actors discuss the relationship between their work in the theater and their work in Hollywood.

title: McKellen & Stewart: Picard and Gandalf
description: Part 12: The actors talk about playing their iconic characters Jean-Luc Picard and Gandalf.

title: The Wicked War in the West
description: At reunions held years after the Civil War ended, Confederate veterans of the Trans-Mississippi Theater liked to tease their Eastern comrades about one of their most treasured expeditions. Jeb Stuarts ride around McClellan? they roared, Hell, brother, Jo Shelby rode around Missouri!

title: In Fashion | Minimalist Dressing Made Simple
description: For the modern minimalist, dressing up really is that simple.

title: Weekend Gun Report: October 25-27, 2013
description: Keenan A. Draughon, 23, of Clarksville, Tenn., was arrested at Kennedy International Airport in New York on Saturday when officers discovered a shotgun, two pistols and two rifles as he was checking in for his flight to Charlotte, N.C. Draughon approached a United Airlines counter and told an attendant that he had two cases containing firearmstwo 9-millimeter pistols, two magazines capable of holding 15 rounds of 9-millimeter ammunition, and two .22-caliber rifles. The rifles had been painted purple and silver, and one of them had a round in the chamber. Both were missing serial numbers.

title: In Our Pages: October 29
description: 1938 Conan Doyle Python Is Missing

title: Prisoner Release Stirs Anger in Israeli Coalition
description: JERUSALEM  The fractured politics of Israels governing coalition were spotlighted on Monday ahead of a second release of Palestinian prisoners that was agreed to as part of peace talks brokered by the United States.

title: Walkabout: A Dubai Airports Outsize Ambition; Ellis Island, Still Wounded, Reopens
description: Sizing UpThough its still years away from completion,Al Maktoum International Airport in Dubaiexpects to become worlds largest airport. Currently operating just one runway, Al Maktoum plans to ultimately operate five runways with an annual capacity of 160 million passengers. (CNN)

title: Another Way Samsung Can Copy Apple
description: Heres one idea that Samsung could safely copy from Apple: As a proportion of its $221 billion market capitalization, the South Korean giants near $40 billion cash pile is almost as big as that of its American archrival. With its reserves accumulating quickly, it can afford to mimic Apple by giving more to investors.

title: As Landlord of Brooklyn Duplex, de Blasio Gets High Approval Ratings
description: Many labels have been hauled out in the parlor game of pigeonholing Bill de Blasio, New York Citys potential mayor-to-be.

title: Conquering Fears, Without Drinking the Samples
description: I LOVE airports, hotels and anything involving getting from Point A to Point B. But it wasnt always like that. When I first started out with Belvedere Vodka more than 10 years ago, business travel involved jumping on a train and going to places like Cambridge, Bristol or Exeter to talk to anyone who would listen to me talk about Belvedere. After two years, I guess you could say I graduated from only traveling by train in Britain to traveling by plane throughout Europe and eventually to the Americas, and every place else in the world.

title: Mitsubishi, Audi and Ford to Recall Vehicles for Various Problems
description: Mitsubishi, Audi and Ford will recall vehicles for a variety of problems, according to reports posted on the National Highway Traffic Safety Administrations website. The agency is also investigating fires in Jeep Liberty models and sunroofs that shatter on Kia Sorentos.

title: A Dubai Hotel With Villas Over the Water
description: Anantara Hotels, Resorts & Spas, the upscale Bangkok-based chain, opened its first location in Dubai last month, the Anantara Dubai The Palm Resort & Spa.

title: Goldman, Feeling Robbed, Still Has to Pay for Accuseds Defense
description: A victim of a crime would never be expected to pay for the perpetrators lawyer to defend the case. But corporate law can be counterintuitive, and Goldman Sachs found itself on the wrong side of a court decision that found that the banks bylaws require it to advance the legal fees of a former employee who has been accused of stealing its computer code.

title: Its Hunting Time in France
description: Autumn signifies the opening of the six-month season, when chefs compete to transform quarry into gastronomic bliss.

title: Consol to Sell 5 Coal Mines to Murray
description: Consol Energy, the largest coal producer in the eastern United States, said on Monday that it was selling five highly automated mines  about half of its production capacity  to focus instead on natural gas and on mines that produce coal for export.

title: Turning the Hunt Into a Trip to the Market
description: PARIS  The chef Alain Dutournier was so excited about the first game meat of the season that he transformed the reception area of Carr des Feuillants, his two-Michelin-star restaurant, into a still life.

title: Speeding Up Gmail Delivery
description: Q. My Gmail on Firefox has gotten really slow lately and sometimes I cant see attachments. I dont think its my network connection and I still have plenty of space left in my mailbox, so what might be causing the pokiness?

title: Will Sandys Lessons Fade as a Sleepy Atlantic Storm Season Ends?
description: With the anniversary of Hurricane Sandys coastal assault here, The New York Times and other media have run a batch of helpful articles tracking how coastal communities are, and are not, responding to the lessons from the extraordinary surge raised by that storm  a 1-in-700-year event, by some calculations.

title: Germaine Greers Archives Are Sold to the University of Melbourne
description: Dead trees will help subsidize live ones, thanks to a deal recently reached by the feminist author Germaine Greer to sell her archives to the University of Melbourne, with proceeds donated to rainforest rehabilitation efforts in Australia.

title: A.D.H.D. Medication Is a Hit for Red Sox Hero
description: Shane Victorino has it all. He is a member of a Boston Red Sox team that is two victories away from a World Series title. He has a championship ring (won with the Philadelphia Phillies in 2008), three Gold Glove awards, and a yearly income of over $6 million. He has a beautiful wife and two insanely adorable children. He has the undying love of Boston sports fans, after hitting a pennant-clinching grand slam that sent the Red Sox to the World Series against the St. Louis Cardinals.

title: Judicial Neglect
description: MURMANSK, RUSSIA  The 30 Greenpeace activists who are in jail here and the large group of volunteers who are organizing their legal and humanitarian aid got their first ray of hope in a month on Oct. 21 when the Netherlands filed a claim in the International Tribunal for the Law of the Sea. The Dutch government demanded that Russia release the Greenpeace ship, Arctic Sunrise, which had flown the Dutch flag. The ship was seized in international waters and escorted to the port of Murmansk, where the crew and passengers from 18 different countries have been held since Sept. 24. And now, their supporters hoped, the tribunal would order them released.

title: Calendar: Coming Events in Florida; Turkey; and Wisconsin
description: Sarasota Chalk Festival, FloridaMore than 500 artists will contribute works to a street gallery in Sarasota that will eventually vanish. This year, participants will use pastel chalk to create images along the pavement on a patriotic Legacy of Valor theme (above, chalk work by Valentina Sforzini). The free event, from Nov. 13 to 18, also features musical performers, an area devoted to childrens works and a vertical gallery of street art on approved walls and other surfaces.

title: Student Uncovers Baby Dinosaur Specimen
description: At first, the bone didnt look like much. But when we walked around to the other side, we saw the skull, Kevin Terris said. We figured the whole skeleton must be there, or at least a good portion of it.

title: Lawyers Challenge Judges Authority in Trial of Chinese Activists
description: HONG KONG  A court in eastern China adjourned the trial of three human rights activists on Monday after their lawyers unsuccessfully challenged the authority of the judges to hear the case, according to two of the lawyers and a daughter of one of the defendants.

title: Hoagies Groove, by SoldierKane
description: A music sample.

title: What Causes a Neck to Crack?
description: Q. Why do necks crack?

title: Explaining a Collider and Poisons Power
description: EXHIBITIONS

title: Obama Reassures F.B.I. at Ceremony for New Director
description: WASHINGTON  President Obama on Monday assured employees of the Federal Bureau of Investigation that he would fight to keep politics from interfering with their mission as the agency struggles to contend with budget shortfalls.

title: New F.B.I. Director Is Introduced
description: President Obama welcomes James Comey, the newly sworn-in head of the F.B.I.

title: Penn State to Pay Nearly $60 Million to 26 Abuse Victims
description: Penn State has agreed to pay $59.7 million to 26 sexual abuse victims of the former assistant football coach Jerry Sandusky in exchange for an end to their claims against the university, Penn State announced Monday.

title: TimesTalks | McKellen & Stewart: Preview
description: The distinguished actors discuss their long careers and their revivals of No Mans Land and Waiting for Godot.

title: McKellen & Stewart: Intro
description: Part 1: Carol Olsen Day, director of TimesTalks, introduces the actors Ian McKellen and Patrick Stewart.

title: Ugandas Neglected Epidemic of Breast Cancer
description: KAMPALA, UGANDA  Dr. Henry Ddungu held the hand of a thin, frail-looking woman as he led her into the outpatient clinic at the Uganda Cancer Institute. Scowling, he said, we are having an epidemic of breast cancer and pain.

title: A Premium Brand Reaches Out to the Discerning Vodka Fan
description: Belvedere Vodka, the Polish premium brand, has introduced its largest global ad campaign, with new television spots that stress its knowledgeable fans, composition and distillation process.

title: Giorgio Armanis Dolce Vita
description: It is one of the fashion industrys more epic feats of longevity that Giorgio Armani is breezily approaching his fifth decade of design under his namesake label. But you dont create a multibillion dollar empire that spans clothes, home dcor, hotels, restaurants and even the silver screen without raising a few eyebrows. After all, this is the man responsible for shifting the boundaries of permissible images of male eroticism with Richard Geres wardrobe in American Gigolo, and for helping to define the prowess of grab-and-greed 1980s power-suit dressing for women  which, by extension, has become the uniform of choice for Hollywood honchos, Wall Street bigwigs and red-carpet mainstays to this day. But as is the Armani M.O., all epoch-making moments appear as effortless as his signature bronzed physique and glowing white smile.

title: Netflix to Add Dexter in Deal With CBS Corp.
description: Netflix continues to sweep up high-profile television shows for its online subscription service, completing a deal Monday for Dexter, which has been the biggest hit series so far for the Showtime network.

title: The Perils of Ascribing Meaning to a Random Event
description: Carl Richards is a certified financial planner in Park City, Utah, and is the director of investor education at the BAM Alliance. His sketches are archived on Your Money.

title: Robotic Crowd Pleasers of the Past
description: They could talk, sing, smoke, shoot guns  early humanoid robots were created in our image, but without anything close to the technology needed to be truly autonomous.

title: The Automatons of Yesteryear
description: The metallic monster had slanted, yellow eyes, skin like a suit of armor, and the halting, unsteady movements of one of Frankensteins creations. On a bright September day in 1928, a curious crowd of onlookers got their first glimpse of Eric the Robot. The mechanical man rose from his chair, stretched out an arm for silence, and made a speech, of which few people understood more than a few words. In a special cable to The New York Times, one reporter remarked on the event, held at the exhibition of the Model Engineers Society of London: Of all orators, Eric seemed the coldest and most lacking in magnetism.

title: Star Withdraws From Lyric Operas Otello
description: The South African tenor Johan Botha has withdrawn from the Lyric Opera of Chicagos production of Verdis Otello because of what the company described as severe back pain caused by a previous injury.He has gone to Vienna for treatment.

title: Humanoid Robots
description: Fully programmable robots were on display at the Humanoids 2013 conference in Atlanta. The goal is to enable them to work effectively and even autonomously in emergency situations.

title: Entering a New Era of Robots
description: In a shift away from strictly industrial use, they are being designed to collaborate with, and even look like, human beings.

title: For Lou Reeds Chefs, a Walk on the Mild Side
description: For a handful of chefs and restaurateurs in downtown Manhattan, Lou Reed, the iconic New Yorker and rock pioneer who died of liver disease on Sunday at age 71, was more than just the man associated with songs like Heroin, Sweet Jane and Satellite of Love. He was a devoted customer, and they spent years trying to keep him in good health.

title: Making Robots More Like Us
description: On a recent morning Natanel Dukan walked into the Paris offices of the French robot maker Aldebaran and noticed one of the companys humanoid NAO robots sitting on a chair. Mr. Dukan, an electrical engineer, could not resist. Bending over, he kissed the robot on the cheek. In response the NAO tilted its head, touched his cheek and let out an audible smack.

title: Danny Bowiens Mission Cantina Opens Soon
description: During four days in Mexico City last summer, Danny Bowien and his chefs, Angela Dimayuga and Zach Swemle, ate in 35 restaurants. Call it homework for Mission Cantina, the Mexican restaurant theyre opening in three weeks on the Lower East Side.

title: Chamber Music Society Will Summer in Saratoga Springs
description: Saratoga Springs has long drawn summer visitors with the promise of thoroughbred racing, and, more recently, performances by the Philadelphia Orchestra and New York City Ballet at the Saratoga Performing Arts Center. This summer it will add a new attraction: the Chamber Music Society of Lincoln Center announced Monday that it would become the resident chamber music ensemble at the performing arts center, with a three-week chamber music festival planned for August.

title: Japanese Autos Lose Ground in Consumer Reports Reliability Ratings
description: After results of Consumer Reports Annual Auto Reliability ratings were released on Monday, there appeared to be a crack in the dominance of Japanese brands over automotive reliability. Two of Americas most popular cars, the V-6-equipped Honda Accord and the Nissan Altima, no longer have the consumer advocacy publications coveted Recommended rating, according to the report.

title: Wynton Marsalis to Lead Jazz Studies at Juilliard
description: The Juilliard School has appointed the trumpeter Wynton Marsalis director of its jazz studies program. Mr. Marsalis, who is the managing and artistic director of Jazz at Lincoln Center  and a Juilliard alumnus  officially takes up the appointment on July 1, but will actually start a few months earlier, overseeing spring auditions for the schools fall 2014 class. He succeeds Carl Allen, the programs director since 2008.

title: Obamacares Losers and Why They Matter
description: Once youve finished reading my Sunday column on what Obamacare will mean for health insurance if and when HealthCare.gov gets fixed, here are a couple of places to turn next. First, as a supplement to some of my points about the laws impact on existing coverage, heres the weekends much-discussed Los Angeles Times story on Californians who arent happy with their premium increases under the new system, which kicks off with the following case study:

title: A Life in Pursuit of Health
description: Josephine Baker was a wise woman, a graceful writer and a visionary whose insights remain intensely relevant today.

title: Ask Well: Glucosamine and MSM for Joint Pain?
description: Question:

title: Learning Moderation From the Marathon
description: This coming weekend, I had planned to join 47,000 of those crazy masochists known as runners at 5 a.m. in Staten Island, lacing up and stripping down for that most peculiar of parades, the marathon. It was supposed to be a celebration of everything I care about and work for.

title: Weekly News Quiz | Oct. 22-28, 2013
description: Answer the 10 questions below to see what you know about the people and events making news this week.

title: If Prices Go Up, Incomes May Lag
description: My Sunday article about the benefits of moderate inflation drew a lot of skeptical responses, many about the premise that rising prices would lead to rising wages.

title: T Luxury 2013
description: Richard Meier and Tavi Gevinson take on snacks, architecture and books.

title: Oyster as Climate Protection, Hackable Defibrillators, Robots in Our Image
description: On the anniversary of Hurricane Sandy, we look at one New York waterway restoration project that predates the storm surge; Dick Cheney thinks his medical implant is susceptible to digital intrusion  is he right?; robots are starting to move around in the world, sort of like us.

title: Ex-Prison Chief Guilty Amid Cases Against Georgian Officials
description: TBILISI, Georgia  In the first major conviction to result from a string of prosecutions of former high-level officials in the Georgian government, a judge on Monday found a former head of the countrys prison system guilty of abuse of power in connection with the deaths of seven inmates in a prison riot.

title: Neglected Diseases Still Are, Well, Neglected
description: Despite much progress in the last 35 years, a new study has found that major gaps persist in the effort to prevent and treat the neglected diseases of the poor.

title: Judge in Texas Partly Rejects Abortion Law
description: A federal judge in Texas on Monday blocked an important part of the states restrictive new abortion law, which would have required doctors performing the procedure to have admitting privileges at a nearby hospital.

title: Quit Smoking? Its Probably Monday
description: If you are thinking of quitting smoking, it is probably Monday.

title: Pictures of the Day: Turkey and Elsewhere
description: Photos from Turkey, China, Egypt and England.

title: Algorithm Can Identify Dolphin Whistles
description: A computer algorithm used to identify songs can also identify the signature whistles of bottlenose dolphins, a new study reports.

title: Powerful Storm Lashes Northern Europe, Paralyzing Travel in Much of Britain
description: LONDON  One of the most powerful storms in Europe in years left at least 13 people dead, hundreds of thousands without power and many stranded on Monday when trains, planes and ferries were canceled after high winds battered the northern part of the Continent.

title: Charges of Racial Profiling in Manhattan Stores Deserve Attention in The Times
description: Reports about racial profiling at Barneys New York, the upscale store, have appeared in The Detroit News, The Las Vegas Review-Journal, USA Today and other newspapers throughout the nation and world, but not in the pages of The Times  despite the stores location in Manhattan.

title: A Dual Review of Whats New, Starring Richard Meier and Tavi Gevinson
description: Richard Meier, the Pritzker Prize-winning architect who created the Getty Center in Los Angeles and the Jubilee Church in Rome, and Tavi Gevinson, the Chicago-based fashion blogger and actress, take on Ari Seth Cohens new book, David Chipperfields design for Museo Jumex and diamond earphone covers.

title: Monday Motorsports: Vettel Wins His Fourth Consecutive World Championship
description: Sebastian Vettel, the Red Bull Infiniti driver, clinched his fourth consecutive Formula One championship with a victory Sunday in the Indian Grand Prix at the Buddh International Circuit near New Delhi. Vettel now joins Juan Manuel Fangio and Michael Schumacher as the only drivers to win four titles in a row. (Alain Prost won four, although not consecutively.) Fangio ultimately won five titles, while Schumacher went on to collect an unparalleled seven.

title: An Insect? For Me? You Shouldnt Have
description: When mating, some male nursery-web spiders offer their female companions a nuptial gift: an insect wrapped in white silk. Now researchers in Europe and South America have found an evolutionary basis for the practice: females were more likely to store sperm from gift-giving males, and their eggs were more likely to hatch. No wonder the spider, Pisaura mirabilis, has evolved in favor of generosity: more presents seem to mean more spiders.

title: Now, a Kiss Isnt Just a Kiss
description: Editors note: Heres one of our favorite stories from the archives with a helpful tip for Smarter Living.

title: Search for Atypical Yields Diverse Program
description: The American Composers Orchestra started its Orchestra Underground series a decade ago to showcase works incorporating eclectic influences, unusual instruments and multimedia components. The lineup on Friday evening at Zankel Hall honored that mission with four recent, diverse pieces.

title: Apples Profit Falls Despite Higher Sales of iPhones
description: SAN FRANCISCO  Apple now has more product offerings. And Apple now sells its products in more places. But for the third consecutive quarter, Apple does not have more profit.

title: Picasso Museum Makeover Drags On
description: PARIS  Metal scaffolding laces across a regal 17th-century building in the historic Marais district here. Home to the worlds largest collection of works by Pablo Picasso, the building has been closed because of renovations for the last four years.

title: Seeking Inspiration, to Be Served Well Chilled
description: Dancing on ice skates isnt easy. At the Sky Rink at Chelsea Piers on Friday, the distinguished Canadian ballerina Sonia Rodriguez performed at a gala in her honor. Wearing ballet slippers, she had to be carried by three male skaters, who passed her around as she danced through the air with prettily pointed feet. Then they left her stranded on a bench.

title: Mayor 2013: Also Running ...
description: Click on the video above for more on the minor-party candidates.

title: Natural Allies for the Next Sandy
description: The floodwaters from Hurricane Sandy had barely receded in New York last fall when the suggestions started coming for ways to keep the city and other low-lying areas safe in future storms.

title: CDs From Mallu Magalhes, the Necks, and Lily & Madeleine
description: MALLU MAGALHES

title: Voters, in Midterm Elections, Give New Momentum to the Opposition in Argentina
description: BUENOS AIRES  After a decade of family rule in Argentina, the political tenor has begun to change.

title: A Boys Life With Cerebral Palsy, Revealed in Tumblr Aaronverse
description: Hidden in Tumblrs bottomless trove of illustrated quotations, posts debunking falsely attributed illustrated quotations, pornography and obsessively composed photos of huckleberry muffins, is a blog written by a twelve-year-old from the Bronx named Aaron Philip.

title: Three Centuries of Debt and Interest Rates
description: Aha  somehow I didnt know this existed. The Bank of England has produced some very, very long-term series; spreadsheet can be downloaded here. Heres debt and interest rates since the Bank was founded:

title: Jump-Starter Kits for the Mind
description: Whether its hitting a golf ball, playing the piano or speaking a foreign language, becoming really good at something requires practice. Repetition creates neural pathways in the brain, so the behavior eventually becomes more automatic and outside distractions have less impact. Its called being in the zone.

title: The Native Pizzas of Staten Island
description: Distinctive pies, holding strong one year after Hurricane Sandy.

title: A Prosaic View of Hurricane Sandy
description: Hurricane Sandy killed more than 40 people in New York City alone and wreaked billions of dollars in destruction. The waters eventually receded, but the damage to the citys infrastructure  and psyche  lingered.

title: Double-Decker Vertigo Is Coming to Take You Away
description: The set dazzles in Ben Gassmans The Downtown Loop, at 3LD Art & Technology Center. Designed by Dave Ogle, it simulates the top of a double-decker New York City tour bus, albeit at an incline. Audience members are seated on the bus, while actors portraying tour guides walk the aisle bisecting the rows of seats. There is also a hot dog stand offering actual hot dogs that greets arriving spectators. And floor-to-ceiling video images by Jared Mezzocchi surround the set on three sides, providing a vertiginous theme-park-style panorama in motion of Manhattan streets.

title: American Songbook Series Sets Its Lineup, Except for the Opener
description: The 16th season of Lincoln Centers American Songbook series will begin Jan. 22 with a free concert featuring an artist yet to be named at the David Rubenstein Atrium. Resuming Jan. 28, with James Naughton singing the songs of Randy Newman, this adventurous, far-reaching series  its programming encompasses Broadway, indie rock, gospel and alt-country  will continue through March 8 at the Allen Room in Jazz at Lincoln Center.

title: N.Y.C. Voters Views on the Statewide Casino Referendum
description: The New York Times and Siena College interviewed New York City voters for their opinion on the state-wide ballot measure about casino gambling.

title: The International Fate of 12 Years
description: LOS ANGELES  A darling of the movie awards set, 12 Years a Slave could make history as the first film by a black director to win the best picture Oscar.

title: Poetry and Blogging
description: A non-economics, non-policy post; I just want to give a shoutout to a book Im reading, and really enjoying: Tom Standages Writing on the Wall: Social Media  The First 2,000 Years. Ive been a big fan of Standages ever since his book The Victorian Internet, about the rise of the telegraph, which shed a lot of light on network technologies while also being great fun. Now hes done it again.

title: Gaming Chinas Art Market With Expert Forgeries
description: In a workshop strewn with plastic, metals and the sound of crickets, craftsmen in the village of Yanjian, in Henan Province, are busy producing bronze works: horses, daggers, bells and ritual vessels  and all made to look like ancient Chinese relics.

title: Images of Smoke Above Tiananmen Deleted From Chinese Social Network
description: Last Updated,Wednesday, 12:02 p.m. | As my colleague Austin Ramzy reports, immediately after a fatal car crash near Tiananmen Square in Beijing on Monday, Chinese officials scrambled to clear every trace of the incident from the physical site and government censors scrubbed the Sina Weibo social network of images uploaded by witnesses.

title: Bookshelf | An Erotic Magazine for Voyeurs and Literati Alike
description: On Saturday night, the downtown set gathered in a photo studio in Chelsea to celebrate the introduction of a new literary and erotic magazine called Adult. Stepping off of the quiet street and into the large, vaulted space  barely decorated but stocked with an abundance of beer and bubbly, a few bowls filled with nostalgic Halloween candy like Dubble Bubble and standard issue lollipops, a couple of penis-shaped piatas hanging next to a stage (where Kelela and Lauren Devine performed later in the night), and old-school pornography, projected onto a large white wall for the partys duration  was like discovering a clandestine and slightly naughty affair, which is the same experience the founding editor Sarah Nicole Prickett wants you to have when opening her inaugural issue. I wanted Adult to feel like a secret, she said about the quarterly magazine, which will hit select newsstands, including Marc Jacobss bookstore, BookMarc, and the Museum of Modern Art, in mid-November. Despite the Not for sale to minors disclaimer on its cover, Prickett isnt shy about hoping the young and curious find it, even if they have to steal it. I want to go on the record as being very pro-minors, she said. I love teen girls. I wish I could have been one  I was awful at it. The best I can hope for is the feeling I had as a teen, which is that I couldnt wait to get older. I want people to feel like that until theyre 70.

title: Full Results of The New York Times/Siena College Poll on Casino Gambling
description: Read the full results of The New York Times/Siena College Poll on casino gambling.

title: Staying Serious, to a Joyful Beat
description: The rollout for Arcade Fires fourth studio album, Reflektor, released on Tuesday, has been all about fun. On television and YouTube, the band introduced new songs wearing glittery mock-1970s costumes, sandwiched between comedy bits. Billed as the Reflektors, Arcade Fire has been staging pop-up shows that come on as dance parties, with the band performing onstage between disc jockey sets, while mirror balls gleam overhead. The initial musical impression of Reflektor, the song that starts the album, is the happy thump of its disco beat.

title: Barenboim to Leave La Scala in 2014
description: Daniel Barenboim plans to leave his post of musical director of the Teatro Alla Scala in Milan at the end of 2014, two years before his contract is set to expire, The Associated Press reported Monday.

title: Staten Island Pizzas That Stood the Test of Time
description: Though Staten Island has harbored a thriving Italian community at least since the exiled patriot Giuseppe Garibaldi lived there in the 1850s, it wasnt until the Verrazano-Narrows Bridge opened in 1964 that legions of Italian-Americans moved there from Brooklyn. Today more than one-third of the population can claim Italian ancestry.

title: New York City Voters Back Adding Casinos, Poll Finds
description: New York City residents are not eager to have a full-scale casino in the five boroughs. And if new casinos are built upstate, most city residents say they would not be interested in visiting.

title: Bolshois Plans for New York Remain Unclear
description: The Bolshoi Ballet has drawn more notice recently in the United States for the offstage acid attack on its artistic director, Sergei Filin, than for its onstage artistry and virtuosity, but that could change next year when the company plans a series of tour dates in Washington and New York.

title: Replace the Sequester, Not Sebelius
description: An embarrassing mistake, which should be considered a scandal, has caused the Internal Revenue Service to perform far fewer tax reviews and cut back its fraud investigations, costing the Treasury billions of dollars. Have there been any angry House hearings? No.

title: High-Flying Tourism, Toddlers Who Read Faces
description: Up, up and away in my beautiful space balloon. Price: $75,000.

title: Selling as Hard as He Can
description: Amazon.com was named after the Amazon River, the largest river on the planet (by volume). According to Brad Stones absorbing new book, The Everything Store, some of the other names its founder, Jeff Bezos, initially considered were MakeItSo.com (after the command used by Captain Picard on Star Trek: The Next Generation), Awake.com, Browse.com, Bookmall.com and Relentless.com.

title: T WINTER LUXURY
description: Using basic geometries and the most elemental of materials, the Belgian designer Michael Verheyden creates objects of sublime beauty and remarkable spiritual power.

title: F.C.C. Seeks Better Phone Service for Rural America
description: WASHINGTON  At a time when consumers can use a hand-held device to have a video chat with someone on the other side of the globe, it is hard to believe that some places in the United States have trouble getting traditional long-distance telephone calls.

title: Checked Baggage Fee? Thats Not the End of It
description: IT used to be youd run into the sales technique called the upsell mostly when you bought a car and the salesman dragged you into that little cubicle where you get the hard pitch on extras.

title: Beijing Crash May Be Tied to Unrest in Xinjiang
description: BEIJING  Five people were killed and 38 were injured on Monday when a speeding vehicle careered along a crowded sidewalk in the ceremonial heart of the Chinese capital and burst into flames at the entrance to the Forbidden City, billowing black smoke that obscured the iconic portrait of Mao Zedong.

title: Tennis and Modern Architecture Converge in Beverly Hills
description: var data;function jsonSlideshowCallback(response){data = response;}NYTD.options = {source: data,cropType: 'blog480',appendTo: 'fullScreenSlideShow',showHeadLine: 'false', renderstyle: "embeddedSlideShowTmag"}

title: Academic Freedom Against Itself: Boycotting Israeli Universities
description: I hate it when I have a book in press and people keep writing about the subject anyway. You would think that they would have the courtesy to hold their fire until I have had my say. I raise the issue because my book on academic freedom (Versions of Academic Freedom: From Professionalism to Revolution) will be out in about a year and the online Journal of Academic Freedom (published by the American Association of University Professors) has just posted its fourth volume consisting of essays on a topic that figures prominently in my analysis  the boycott of Israeli universities by academic institutions and scholars housed in other countries.

title: In Performance: RoosevElvis
description: Kristen Sieh and Libby King play the spirits of Theodore Roosevelt and Elvis Presley in RoosevElvis, a new work by the theater collective the TEAM, at the Bushwick Starr.

title: Britain Embraces Halloween and Cashes In on Ghoulish Celebration
description: LONDON  This Halloween, skintight full-body leotards are a sellout in Britain.

description: BRUSSELS  Can shaded boxes help break Googles stronghold on the European online search market?

description: To the Editor:

title: Shadows Over Central Park
description: TWENTY-SIX years ago this month, a coalition of New Yorkers led by Jacqueline Kennedy Onassis won a historic victory for Central Park. At issue was a planned building on Columbus Circle by the developer Mortimer B. Zuckerman with 58- and 68-story towers that would cast long shadows on the park. After a lawsuit by opponents of the plan and a rally in Central Park at which over 800 New Yorkers with umbrellas formed a line to simulate the buildings shadow, Mr. Zuckerman relented and agreed to scale down his design, which eventually became known as the Time Warner Center.

title: A Bid to Keep Youths Out of Adult Prisons
description: DENVER  James Stewart died alone.

title: Ryanair, Scorned in Europe, Turns on the Charm
description: LONDON  Charging 60 euros, or $82, for carry-on bags deemed too large to go in the cabin.

title: Warily, Schools Watch Students on the Internet
description: SAN FRANCISCO  For years, a school principals job was to make sure students were not creating a ruckus in the hallways or smoking in the bathroom. Vigilance ended at the schoolhouse gates.

title: Red Sox Beat Cardinals, 3-1, in Game 5
description: No controversy, no ill-timed mistakes. Game 5 brought the World Series back to pure baseball.

title: Junior Varsity Is Where the Work Gets Done
description: Six years ago I published my second book, a novel for adults featuring a brutalized teenager and snappy conversation on yachts. After my commercial debut, I had museum-hush hopes that this follow-up was Literature. But in retrospect all Id written was a strange, unwieldy novel, which my publisher quietly escorted out back to sink into the bog. It didnt even go paperback, and my editor was always out to lunch when Id call to ask why. A review summed the books prospects up in one word: grim.

title: William H. Sullivan, U.S. Ambassador to Volatile Laos and Iran, Is Dead at 90
description: William H. Sullivan, a career diplomat who spent much of the 1960s and 1970s in volatile parts of the world  notably Laos, where he oversaw a secret bombing campaign, and Iran, where he was the last United States ambassador before militants took embassy employees hostage in November 1979  died on Oct. 11 in Washington. He was 90.

title: Microcredit for Americans
description: On a recent Thursday, dozens of Latina immigrants clustered in a small, noisy second-floor office in the Jackson Heights neighborhood of Queens, waiting for one of a half-dozen loan officers to call their names and hand over a check. Children loitered in the stairwell or sprawled, calflike, over their mothers laps.

title: William C. Lowe, Who Oversaw the Birth of  IBMs PC, Dies at 72
description: William C. Lowe, who supervised the creation of IBMs first personal computer, a technological touchstone that he insisted  and proved  could be conceived, engineered and manufactured in a single year by a company not known for speeding products to market, died on Oct. 19 in Lake Forest, Ill. He was 72.

title: Painting a Room With Blues, or Hip-Hop, or Mozart
description: RECORD companies have long promoted music for helping to set a mood, and paint brands similarly highlight the power of a coat of well-chosen paint to create the right ambience. Now a paint company is marrying those notions, with a smartphone app that suggests paint colors based on consumers favorite songs.

title: U.S. Health Insurance Websites Problems Continue Despite Improvements
description: WASHINGTON  The Obama administration on Monday reported improvements in the operation of the federal health insurance marketplace, but insurers said that severe technical problems were still making it difficult to enroll new subscribers.

title: Texas: Deal Reached Over Claims That Company Misused Visas
description: Federal prosecutors in Texas have reached a civil settlement with Infosys, an Indian outsourcing company, over charges that it misused temporary visas to bring Indian technology workers to the United States, justice officials said. In an investigation started in February 2011, prosecutors have examined whether Infosys systematically used short-term visitor visas to bring software programmers and technology engineers from India to work in American companies, instead of more costly H-1B visas, deceiving immigration authorities and undercutting wages for American workers. Infosys has said it set aside $35 million for the settlement, which will be announcedon Wednesday.

title: A Bold Bid for Better Schools
description: If theres a key to this nations sustained competitiveness, its education. And if theres a key to the kind of social mobility thats integral to our countrys cherished narrative, to its soul, its giving kids from all walks of life teachers and classrooms that beckon them toward excellence. But like all aspects of American policy making these days, the push to improve public schools bucks up against factionalism, pettiness, lobbies that wont be muted and sacred cows that cant be disturbed. Progress that needs to be sweeping is anything but.

title: Ortiz, a World Series Veteran, Savors the Moment, and Makes the Most of It
description: ST. LOUIS  It had dawned on David Ortiz, as it does for everyone at some point in life.

title: Frenzy of Deals, Once Expected, Seems to Fizzle
description: It was mere months ago when headlines were blaring news of the return of merger mania.

title: Should You Bribe Your Kids?
Greeces Aggressive Pursuit of Tax Evaders Appears to Collect More Anger Than Money
description: ARCHANES, Greece  The tax inspectors swept into this picturesque village in Crete during the middle of a saints day celebration recently, moving from restaurant to restaurant demanding receipts and financial records. Soon, customers annoyed by the holiday disruption confronted them. Pushing, shoving and angry words followed, and eventually the frightened inspectors were forced to flee.

title: Keeping Up Carrie Street
description: Carrie Street resembles many blocks in Detroit, with residents like Broderick Hunter trying to maintain community and security amid blight.

title: If Not Yet a Winner, the Giants Are a Different Team
description: Approaching their bye week, the Giants on Monday scattered around the country. The perpetually occupied Tom Coughlin was talking wistfully about his time off, recalling boyhood days of raking leaves by the side of the family home.

title: In Testimony, Michigan Governor Says Bankruptcy Was Right Call for Detroit
description: DETROIT  Gov. Rick Snyder of Michigan, in testimony on Monday, forcefully defended Detroits bankruptcy filing as a last-ditch effort to stem the citys decades-long financial decline.

title: Ohio Governor Defies G.O.P. With Defense of Social Safety Net
description: COLUMBUS, Ohio  In his grand Statehouse office beneath a bust of Lincoln, Gov. John R. Kasich let loose on fellow Republicans in Washington.

title: Aqueducts Defenders Volunteer to Fill Breach in Upkeep of Park
description: ROME  In their day, Romes aqueducts  11 elevated pipelines that carried more than 3,400 gallons of water per second to the ancient capital  stood as the height of public administration, providing the best water service in the ancient world and perhaps of any era, in the words of one archaeologist, Filippo Coarelli.

title: Stabbing Suspect Silent; Grieving Goes On
description: His dark hair spiked and his gaze fixed, Mingdong Chen appeared in a Brooklyn courtroom on Monday, saying nothing as he was charged with five counts of murder in the stabbing deaths of his cousins wife and her four young children. But the reverberations of the tragedy could be keenly heard in Sunset Park, by the familys home and at an elementary school, suddenly confronted with the deaths of three of its students.

title: House, Set to Vote on 2 Bills, Is Seen as an Ally of Wall St.
description: WASHINGTON  To Wall Street, this town might seem like enemy territory. But even as federal regulators and prosecutors extract multibillion-dollar penalties from the nations biggest banks, Wall Street can rely on at least one ally here: the House of Representatives.

title: With Suit, Parents of Boy With Seizures Press Arizona Officials on Marijuana Act
description: PHOENIX  Arguing that medical marijuana has been the most effective treatment for their sons seizure disorder, the parents of a 5-year-old boy filed a lawsuit here on Monday to force state officials to include marijuana extracts  oil-like resins with very low levels of the psychoactive ingredient THC  as a legal product under the states medical marijuana act.

title: Sandys Unfinished Business
description: A year ago Tuesday evening, Hurricane Sandy slammed into the Eastern Seaboard, destroying lives and homes and entire neighborhoods. On the first anniversary of the storm, politicians are busily touting what theyve done since, while, at the same time, assiduously dodging legitimate complaints from people who are still suffering.

title: A Delayed Deadline Could Disrupt Reform
description: It is no surprise that Congressional Republicans are seizing on problems with the federal health insurance website as reason to delay by a year the deadline for enrolling in new plans under the Affordable Care Act. It is their latest ploy to disable a law that they have tried repeatedly to repeal.

title: The White House on Spying
description: Update:The Obama administration said late Monday that it was considering banning eavesdropping on the leaders of American allies.

title: Fox Failed to Keep Lens on the Ball
description: The obstruction call that ended Game 3 of the World Series on Saturday offered a television lesson on how to correctly cover a critical play. Fox did not let its cameras stray too long from the field, and was thus able to properly cover the dramatic end of the game.

title: Health Site Puts Agency and Leader in Hot Seat
description: WASHINGTON  Ten days before HealthCare.gov opened for business, Marilyn Tavenner, the obscure federal bureaucrat whose agency oversaw the creation of the troubled online insurance marketplace, had a bad omen. It was a Sunday, and her mobile device was on the fritz, forcing her to go into the office.

title: Make Em Pay
description: Where do you go if youre a Deadliest Catch kind of guy, manliest of manly men, but couldnt fish for king crab because some jelly-bellied Republicans threw a tantrum 5,000 miles away and shut down the government?

title: Pentagon Says Shabab Bomb Specialist Is Killed in Missile Strike in Somalia
description: WASHINGTON  The United States military carried out a missile strike against a top Shabab operative in Somalia on Monday, according to Defense Department officials, three weeks after a Navy SEAL raid in another part of the country failed to capture a senior leader of the Somali Islamic militant group.

title: Tadeusz Mazowiecki, Ex-Premier of Poland, Dies at 86
description: Tadeusz Mazowiecki, who went from editing small Roman Catholic intellectual publications to becoming prime minister of Poland  and the first non-Communist to head an Eastern bloc nation since the late 1940s  died on Monday in Warsaw. He was 86.

title: The Storm Inside
description: A year ago, when Hurricane Sandy struck New York City, our son, William, was heavily sedated in St. Lukes Hospital in Manhattan, never conscious of the storm outside or its aftermath.

title: In Pay-to-Play Albany, Contributors Win Favors
description: Each June the great pile of stones that is the New York State Capitol in Albany doubles as a legislative bakery, and its denizens serve up a stream of outlandish delights for their favored clients.

title: Monthlong Chase Around New York City for Banksys Street Art
description: New Yorkers have stolen it, painted over it, urinated on it, tagged it, charged for it, venerated it, fought about it, sneered at it, guarded it, sold it to the highest bidder and chased it to corners of the city that they had heretofore never been.

title: Obama May Ban Spying on Heads of Allied States
description: WASHINGTON  President Obama is poised to order the National Security Agency to stop eavesdropping on the leaders of American allies, administration and congressional officials said Monday, responding to a deepening diplomatic crisis over reports that the agency had for years targeted the cellphone of Chancellor Angela Merkel of Germany.

title: The King and His Courting
description: A new N.B.A. season is upon us, and competition for the leagues most coveted prize figures to be fierce. We refer here not to the Larry OBrien Championship Trophy, but to the king of potential free agents.

title: Turning Hurricane Sandys Scars Into Badges of Survival
description: It was a foul, filthy thing that marred the aesthetics, something to scrub off or paint over, something to just get rid of. It stood for what once was: a sour reminder of the thundering water, unimaginable wreckage and exponential wounds.

title: U.S. Disrupts Afghans Tack on Militants
description: KABUL, Afghanistan  A bungled attempt by the Afghan government to cultivate a shadowy alliance with Islamist militants escalated into the latest flash point in the troubled relationship between Afghanistan and the United States, according to new accounts by officials from both countries.

title: Lottery Numbers  for Oct. 28, 2013
Behind 2 Killings in Brooklyn: Drugs, Beer and an Exploding Temper
description: Outside the G & P Gourmet Deli in East New York, Brooklyn, everyone seemed to know Raul Correa. The 59-year-old Mr. Correa could usually be found there drinking a Heineken on a lazy afternoon or helping out in the back making sandwiches.

title: Marathon Runners Build Their Sport Stride by Stride
description: The modern marathon boom was born in the shadow of terrorism: the massacre of 11 Israeli athletes and coaches at the 1972 Munich Olympics.

title: Corrections: October 29, 2013
description: FRONT PAGE

title: Word of Qualification
description: TUESDAYS PUZZLE  This is a nice, basic word can go before/after another word theme, with the reveal smack in the center of the grid, for all you reveal fans who dont want to wait until the end of the puzzle.

title: A Fairy Tale, but Not to Read to Your Children
description: The lecture has only just begun on the Shiva stage at the Public Theater, and yet, already, your eyelids are getting heavy, so heavy. That disagreeable man at the podium, shiny with self-satisfaction, has promised to read from his memoirs, and the tome in front of him is the size of the collected works of Joyce Carol Oates. His voice is a nasal, complacent drone that could put a rabid pit bull to sleep.

title: Jets Forgo Film Review When Woes Are Obvious
description: FLORHAM PARK, N.J.  It happens every time the Jets absorb a 40-point loss under Rex Ryan, a tradition like no other. The morning after, he cancels film review. No need for a teamwide rubbernecking session.

title: Mystery Surrounds Motive of Man With Bomb Parts in Bag
description: OTTAWA  The contents of a 71-year-old mans carry-on bag disrupted flights at Montreals airport for hours over the weekend and led to a partial evacuation of the mans neighborhood there.

title: Wall St. Lobbyists and Financial Regulation
description: Citigroups lobbyists redrafted a derivatives trading bill in the House, striking out certain phrases and inserting others, according to documents reviewed by The New York Times.

title: Lhotas Years Working for the Dolans
description: He pressed a financially strained city for millions of dollars in corporate subsidies. He opposed a law requiring paid sick leave for workers. He fired scores of blue-collar technicians during a union organizing drive.

title: For Subway Riders, Fallout From Hurricane May Last Years
description: Early on, the effects of Hurricane Sandy seemed quantifiable, if unprecedented, for New York Citys transportation system: flooded tunnels, entire stations temporarily wiped from the subway map, and, according to initial estimates, about $5 billion to rebuild all that was damaged.

title: Iran: Dispute with Azerbaijan Over Polo
description: Iran said Monday that it would oppose attempts by Azerbaijan to officially register polo with the United Nations as a purely indigenous sport, arguing that polo is an international game and Azerbaijan has no right to claim that it originated there. The official Islamic Republic News Agency quoted Mohammad-Ali Najafi, the head of Irans Cultural Heritage, Handicrafts and Tourism Organization, as saying in a letter to Unesco that Iran strongly requests the rejection of Azerbaijans application to register polo  which both nations call chogan  as an entry on the Intangible Cultural Heritage of Humanity list. Iran, Afghanistan, Pakistan and India are among the countries that also have a claim on the game, the worlds oldest known competitive team sport, in which players on horseback use mallets to swat a ball through the opposing sides goal posts. Unesco  the United Nations Educational, Scientific and Cultural Organization  will decide on Azerbaijans application during a meeting of its Intergovernmental Committee for the Safeguarding of the Intangible Cultural Heritage to be held in Baku, Azerbaijan, Dec. 2-7.

title: Banksy in New York
description: The British street artist Banksy has been busy in all the boroughs during his one-month residency in New York.

title: New Jersey School District Cancels Testing After Exams Are Leaked on the Internet
description: Testing of public school students in a New York City suburb was canceled on Monday after someone anonymously posted several of the exams on a public website, officials said.

title: Chief of Ryanair Hasn't Been Able to Get Hands on Aer Lingus
description: LONDON  Another casualty of Michael OLearys irreverent persona, in some analysts view, has been Ryanairs ambitions to acquire Irelands struggling flag carrier, Aer Lingus, in which it already owns a 29 percent stake.

title: Ellis Island Welcoming Visitors Once Again, but Repairs Continue
description: Some of the buildings bear plywood scars from the storm, and a million artifacts are still in storage in Maryland. But on the eve of the anniversary of Hurricane Sandy, Ellis Island, the American gateway for millions of immigrants, reopened to the public on Monday, one of the last major parks or monuments damaged by the storm to do so.

title: Rams Cede Spotlight to World Series
description: ST. LOUIS  The Seattle Seahawks offense was huddling, and the St. Louis Rams defense was waiting, hands on hips, when the crowd at Edward Jones Dome roared on Monday as loud as it had all night.

title: U.S. Publisher Said to Have Acquired Morrissey Autobiography
description: The autobiography of the pop star Morrissey, which has become a quick sensation in Britain, has found an American publisher. G.P. Putnams Sons, an imprint of Penguin Random House, acquired the memoir, two people involved in the negotiations said on Monday.

title: Rangers Fail to Sparkle in Debut at Refurbished Home
description: Tomas Plekanec and his Canadiens teammates have dominated the Rangers in recent years. A fresh season and a renovated Madison Square Garden made no difference.

title: Banksy Takes New York
description: The English street artist Banksy has posted photos of a new graffiti stencil, sculpture or installation, along with its general location, sending people off on a treasure hunt to find it before the work gets painted over or removed.

title: Ike Skelton, Former Congressman From Missouri, Dies at 81
description: Ike Skelton, a Democratic congressman who was ousted in the Republican sweep of 2010 after serving his Missouri district for more than 30 years, died on Monday in Arlington, Va. He was 81.

title: One Win Away and Headed for Home
description: ST. LOUIS  There were no bizarre endings involving obstruction or pickoffs, this time, no balks or hidden-ball tricks, either, to end the game in some confusing and stunning fashion.

title: A New View of the Corporate Income Tax
description: Bruce Bartlett held senior policy roles in the Reagan and George H.W. Bush administrations and served on the staffs of Representatives Jack Kemp and Ron Paul. He is the author of the forthcoming book The Benefit and the Burden: Tax Reform  Why We Need It and What It Will Take.

title: Augusto Odone, Father Behind Lorenzos Oil, Dies at 80
description: Augusto Odone, an Italian economist with no medical training who flouted scientific protocol and doctors advice to help concoct an experimental medicine that extended the life of his terminally ill son and inspired a Hollywood film, Lorenzos Oil, died on Friday in Acqui Terme, in northern Italy. He was 80.

title: Word of the Day | peroration
description: peroration \per--ra-shn\ noun

title: Quotation of the Day for Tuesday, October 29, 2013
description: Im concerned about the fact there seems to be a war on the poor. That if youre poor, somehow youre shiftless and lazy.

title: Imax to Begin Producing Home Theaters in China
description: HONG KONG  Imax Corporation, the Canadian company that has long designed and manufactured large-screen cinema equipment on the outskirts of Toronto, plans to announce on Tuesday in Los Angeles that it has set up a joint venture with a Chinese company to develop and manufacture $250,000 home theater systems in China.

title: New Vulnerability Found in Apps Using Wi-Fi
description: Public Wi-Fi networks are notoriously insecure, and now theres this: Mobile security researchers have discovered a new way for attackers to access mobile phone apps from Wi-Fi networks.

title: Inspectors Visit All but 2 of Syrias Declared Chemical Sites
description: GENEVA  International inspectors have completed verification of Syrias chemical weapons arsenal at 21 of the 23 sites identified by the government, but they have been unable to visit the other two because they are in contested areas in Syrias civil war, the Organization for the Prohibition of Chemical Weapons said in a statement on Monday.

title: Police Examine Possible Xinjiang Link in Deadly Tiananmen Crash
description: Updated, 6:14 a.m. ET | Hours after the crash at the entrance to the Forbidden City that killed five people and injured 38, the police sent a notice to hotels in Beijing seeking information about suspicious guests. They named two suspects from Xinjiang, the troubled region in Chinas far west whose ethnic Uighur population has become increasingly disenchanted with Chinese policies.

title: Whats On Tuesday
description: 8 P.M. (13, 49) THE AFRICAN AMERICANS: MANY RIVERS TO CROSS Henry Louis Gates Jr., above, continues his exploration of African-American history in The Age of Slavery (1800-1860), which picks up with Eli Whitneys cotton gin, the second middle passage and Nat Turners rebellion. Mr. Gates  the Harvard professor, author and critic  is highly visible, interviewing historians, talking to older black Africans who acknowledge that their ancestors became wealthy through the slave trade, chatting with contemporary black Americans over Hoppin John and iced tea, standing at seemingly innocuous city intersections where shameful history unfolded, Anita Gates wrote in The New York Times. It is revelatory just how different a story sounds when it begins with There, at the door, stood an enslaved man, rather than a slave.
