description: OMAHA  Nebraska has not elected a Democrat to the House of Representatives since 1992, and until this month, prospects for changing that were dim at best. Of the states three House seats, a Democrat has a fighting chance only in the district encompassing Omaha and its suburbs. And the partys sole hope there, Omahas popular City Council president, had declared that he was not going to run.

title: Why Some People Cant Keep Their Insurance Plans
description: Despite President Obamas assertion that people can keep their health plan if they like it, some are being forced to buy new plans.

title: Winning Lottery Numbers for Oct. 30, 2013
Intel Is Said to Weigh Sale of Online Cable TV Venture
description: Intel may bow out of its ambitious cable-television-via-the-Internet venture, known as OnCue, by selling it to Verizon, according to people with direct knowledge of the talks between the two companies.

title: Safety Steps Urged as 2 More Die in New York City Fires
description: A deadly blaze at a house in Brooklyn early on Wednesday was another frustrating reminder for firefighters of how many fire deaths are preventable.

title: In Michigan, Sidelines Are Offices Of Neurologists
description: ANN ARBOR, Mich.  Most neurologists conduct concussion assessments in the safe, beige-walled, soft-elevator-music confines of a medical office. Their patients are not usually fired up on adrenaline, a 100-piece band is not blaring in the background, and tens of thousands of very partisan fans are not standing and screaming during the exam.

title: Activists Feel Powerful Wrath as Russia Guards Its Arctic Claims
description: MOSCOW  Gizem Akhan, 24, was about to begin her final year studying the culinary arts at Yeditepe University in Istanbul. Tomasz Dziemianczuk, 36, took a vacation from his job as a cultural adviser at the University of Gdansk in Poland that has now unexpectedly turned into an unpaid leave of absence.

title: Endless War, Endless Suffering
description: Add a potential polio epidemic to the threats that innocent civilians now face because of Syrias civil war. It is part of what American officials say may be the worst humanitarian disaster since the 1994 Rwandan genocide that killed an estimated 800,000 people. But while the tragedy is unfolding in full view, many countries, including Russia and China, have given hardly anything to the United Nations campaign to meet the Syrians basic needs.

title: Scott Stringer for New York City Comptroller
description: Scott Stringer, the Manhattan borough president, faced a tough primary battle for New York City comptroller against a far richer and better known candidate, Eliot Spitzer. But when Democratic voters considered their choice  the solid public servant or the scandal-scarred former governor  they elected Mr. Stringer by a wide margin. Now Mr. Stringer faces the Republican, John Burnett, in the general election on Nov. 5.

title: N.S.A. Said to Tap Google and Yahoo Abroad
description: WASHINGTON  The National Security Agency and its British counterpart have apparently tapped the fiber-optic cables connecting Googles and Yahoos overseas servers and are copying vast amounts of email and other information, according to accounts of documents leaked by the former agency contractor Edward J. Snowden.

title: Alrosa, a Russian Rival to De Beers, Enters Public Trading
description: Investors now have an opportunity to bet directly on diamond mining, as the Russian government moves to spin off a 16 percent stake in Alrosa.

title: Quotation of the Day for Thursday, October 31, 2013
description: Hold me accountable for the debacle. Im responsible.

title: As Interest Fades in the Humanities, Colleges Worry
description: STANFORD, Calif.  On Stanford Universitys sprawling campus, where a long palm-lined drive leads to manicured quads, humanities professors produce highly regarded scholarship on Renaissance French literature and the philosophy of language.

title: Tap on Merkel Provides Peek at Vast Spy Net
description: WASHINGTON  It was not obvious to the National Security Agency a dozen years ago that Angela Merkel, a rising star as the leader of the Christian Democratic Union, was a future chancellor of Germany.

title: The Ad Campaign: De Blasios Tone Poem to a Diverse City
description: Bill de Blasio, the Democratic nominee for mayor, on Wednesday released his latest television ad. Titled Our City, the 30-second commercial is running on broadcast and cable channels across New York City.

title: Troubled Texas Utility Said to Lean Toward Debt Payment
description: The day of reckoning for Energy Future Holdings, the troubled Texas utility haunted by a huge private-equity buyout, may be delayed by a few more months.

title: Documents on Prosecuting Mortgage Fraud
description: Leon W. Weidmans used an obscure federal law has underpinned the governments campaign to punish Wall Street for the financial crisis.

title: Held 3 Years, French Hostages Return Home
description: PARIS  Free after years being held hostage in the deserts of West Africa, four Frenchmen, two with eyes downcast, two appearing joyous, stepped out of a plane and into a fine autumn morning south of Paris on Wednesday. Their families had gathered on the empty tarmac with President Franois Hollande. It had been three years, six weeks and three days since their kidnapping by Islamist fighters in Niger, and just hours since their release.

title: Corrections: October 31, 2013
description: FRONT PAGE

title: Howard Be Thy Name
description: THURSDAYS PUZZLE  Happy Halloween! Lets start off with a comment from puzzle master Will Shortz: This is probably my favorite daily puzzle of the week. The trick at 65A is downright mean!

title: No U.S. Action, So States Move on Privacy Law
description: State legislatures around the country, facing growing public concern about the collection and trade of personal data, have rushed to propose a series of privacy laws, from limiting how schools can collect student data to deciding whether the police need a warrant to track cellphone locations.

title: Tennessee: Guardsman Is Indicted in Armory Attack
description: A National Guard soldier was indicted Wednesday in connection with a shooting in West Tennessee last week that wounded three of his superiors. A federal grand jury in Memphis charged the soldier, Sgt. First Class Amos Patton, with nine counts, including assault with a deadly weapon and unlawfully attempting to kill four soldiers. Sergeant Patton, 42, is accused of opening fire at an armory in Millington after officials told him that he was likely to face severe penalties, including dismissal from active service as a National Guard recruiter, for previous misconduct. The soldiers who were hurt in the shooting last Thursday were treated and released.

title: When Mac Retired Yaz to Stun the Red Sox
description: BOSTON  The final stop of the baseball season is the oldest address in the game: 4 Yawkey Way, Boston, Mass. Fenway Park. Green walls and red bricks. One hundred and one years of history.

title: South Carolina: Five Are Killed in Custody Dispute
description: A gunman in Greenwood County killed five people, including two children, because of a custody dispute, the authorities said Wednesday. Sheriff Tony Davis said that the man, Bryan E. Sweatt, 27, had fatally shot Chandra Marie Fields, with whom he had a 7-month-old daughter, along with her parents and two of her young nephews, and then killed himself. Ms. Fields had clashed with Mr. Sweatt about visiting privileges for their baby, who was unhurt, Sheriff Davis said. Three other children were also unharmed. The other victims were identified as Richard Fields, 51; his wife, Melissa Fields, 49; William Robinson, 9; and Tariq Robinson, 11. Sheriff Davis said Mr. Sweatt had an extensive criminal history.

title: American Candy Makers, Pinched by Inflated Sugar Prices, Look Abroad
description: READING, Mass.  Inside the Chocolate Truffle candy shop in this Boston suburb are chocolate pizzas, chocolate buffalo wings, even a chocolate wingtip shoe. The owner, Erin Calvo-Bacci, would like to expand her business close to home, but is instead thinking of moving her operations to Canada, where the sugar essential for her products costs far less.

title: Cilics Return Raises Questions About Antidoping Protocols
description: PARIS  Marin Cilic lost to Juan Martn del Potro in the second round of the ATP Masters event in Paris on Wednesday, but his overall feeling was one of relief.

title: Boston Fans Set for Party After Years of Buildup
description: BOSTON  Bostons four principal sports teams have had an unusually impressive stretch of success, a run of seven championships that began when the New England Patriots won their first Super Bowl, after the 2001 season. (An eighth title was within reach Wednesday night.)

title: Chamblee Resigns From Golf Magazine After Critical Remarks on Woods
description: Brandel Chamblee, the Golf Channel commentator who suggested on Golf magazines website that Tiger Woods was a cheater, resigned from the publication on Wednesday but will stay at the television network. His assessment earlier this month was part of Chamblees season-ending PGA Tour report cards for various golfers. Chamblee gave Woods an F.

title: Bitcoin Pursues the Mainstream
description: The currency known as bitcoin  a much-hyped and much-doubted type of digital cash that can be bought with traditional money  has mostly attracted attention for its popularity in the black market, and for its wildly gyrating valuation.

title: An Abridged History of Bitcoin
description: What started as an idea in 2008 has since become a currency found in automated teller machines, used by black markets and put in portfolios that some investors want to trade like stocks.

title: Closing of Live Poultry Markets Is Called Effective in Flu Fight
description: Shutting down live poultry markets is extremely effective in preventing human cases of avian flu and should be considered if the disease reappears this winter, researchers in China reported Wednesday.

title: China: Brother of Tibet Religious Leader Details Circumstances of Siblings Death
description: The brother of a prominent Tibetan religious leader, Choje Akong Rinpoche, who was stabbed to death in China on Oct. 8, has said Mr. Akong had not been assassinated. The brother, Lama Yeshe Losal Rinpoche, the abbot of Samye Ling Monastery in Scotland, released a statement that said: Unfortunately I used the word assassination in respect of the killing of my brother Akong Rinpoche. English is not my first language and I did not appreciate that the word means killing with a religious or political motive. I never intended to imply that there was such a motive. State news media reported three suspects had been detained and had had an economic dispute with Mr. Akong.

title: In Final New York Mayoral Debate, Rivals Mock Each Others Rsums
description: Bill de Blasio said he needed no backup plan: Skeptics aside, Albany would approve his plan to raise taxes on the rich.

title: United Nations Proposes to Bolster Force in Somalia
description: Four months after a deadly attack on the United Nations compound in Mogadishu, a senior United Nations official on Wednesday called for an expansion of an international security force. Jan Eliasson, the deputy United Nations secretary general, pressed the Security Council to bolster the international force, specifically with guards to protect United Nations staff members.

title: On Council, de Blasio Blended Idealism With Push for Power
description: The Brooklyn Democrats had always been a sleepy, collegial group on the City Council. Until Bill de Blasio made his first big play for power.

title: Knicks Show Promise, and Flaws, in Debut
description: The Knicks were never shy in the preseason about their championship aspirations. It was bold talk given the strong competition in the Eastern Conference and their own mishmash of aging parts, so Coach Mike Woodson always made certain to couch his optimism. His team, he said, was a work in progress.

title: Rebuilt Nets Still Need Fine-Tuning
description: CLEVELAND  Kevin Garnett lacked the precise word to describe the prodigious anxiety and eagerness he and his teammates felt walking onto the court here Wednesday night, so he contorted his face into an exaggerated snarl and let out a comical growl.

title: Canadian Cyclist Admits Short-Lived Drug Use
description: OTTAWA  Ryder Hesjedal, a Canadian cyclist who was a teammate of Lance Armstrongs and won the Giro dItalia last year, admitted Wednesday that he had used performance-enhancing drugs.

title: Red Sox Hold Strikeout Mark Along With the Series Trophy
description: If the Mighty Casey, baseballs most famous mythical character, were to come to life, he would fit right in with the world champion Boston Red Sox.

title: At the Milan Interiors Firm Studio Peregalli, Old World Traditions Live On
description: At their Milan atelier, one of the last truly Old World interiors firms, Studio Peregalli, is making history  mining everything from the high Renaissance to the Victorian era  to create deeply poetic spaces that transcend the bounds of time.

title: Countess Marina Cicogna, a Woman of the World
description: The Italian countess Marina Cicogna has lived her life on her own terms  photographing her jet-set companions, winning highest honors at the Venice Film Festival and throwing parties that are still talked about decades later.

title: Whats Your Fitness Age?
description: This article appears in the Nov. 3, 2013 issue of The New York Times Magazine.

title: A Fat Dad Halloween (Hide the Candy)
description: Every year after trick-or-treating for Halloween, I used to hide my candy in a little paisley suitcase under my bed. Just to be safe, I even locked it so my dad would not devour the contents in one night.

title: Word of the Day | witticism
description: witticism \wi-t-si-zm\ noun

title: The Perils of a Free Trade Pact With Europe
description: Simon Johnson, former chief economist of the International Monetary Fund, is the Ronald A. Kurtz Professor of Entrepreneurship at the M.I.T. Sloan School of Management and co-author of White House Burning: The Founding Fathers, Our National Debt, and Why It Matters to You.

title: Red Sox Rout Cardinals to Win World Series
description: BOSTON  For much of the 20th century, the Boston Red Sox were a symbol of frustration and pain for an entire region. As popular as they were in their corner of the nation, either they were good enough to lose in agonizing fashion on baseballs grandest stage, or they were just plain bad.

title: Boston Leaves Worries Behind and Learns to Be Happy
description: BOSTON  They dont even worry about the Red Sox here anymore. Why would they? With another championship, their third in 10 years, the Red Sox have the finances, the farm system and the fan base to succeed for years to come.

title: Iran: Official Says Arrested Men Were Thieves, Not Nuclear Saboteurs
description: The minister of intelligence, Mahmoud Alavi, said Wednesday that recent claims that four nuclear saboteurs had tried to steal secrets from a power plant were inaccurate. The accusations had been made by Ali Akbar Salehi, Irans top nuclear official. Mr. Alavi said the four suspects had been seeking scrap metal, according to the semiofficial Islamic Students News Agency. The men, who were arrested, had dug a hole under a fence around the power plant in order to sneak the purloined scrap metal out and sell it, he said. These people were thieves, not nuclear saboteurs, the minister said. They were from a village close to the power plant, and they had done such things before.

title: Whats On Thursday
description: 9 P.M. (Sundance) THE RETURNED In an idyllic French mountain town, a random collection of people  a boy killed during a robbery, a teenager who died in a bus wreck, a bridegroom who committed suicide, a serial killer buried alive by his brother  find themselves in a state of confusion as they try to return to their homes. What they dont realize is that theyve been dead for several years, and no one is expecting them back. Worse, their arrival coincides with a series of gruesome murders bearing a chilling resemblance to the work of a serial killer from the past. Above, Clotilde Hesme and Pierre Perrier. Writing in The New York Times, Alessandra Stanley called this series, adapted by Fabrice Gobert from Robin Campillos film Les Revenants, strange and strangely suspenseful and compared it to The Walking Dead  only the zombies are sentient, and hungry for cassoulet, not human flesh.

title: N.F.L. Week 9 Game Probabilities: Patriots Passing Decline
description: First, fifth, second, second, fourth and 31st. Those are the league rankings of the Patriots net passing efficiency with Tom Brady at the helm since New Englands record-breaking 2007 season. The Patriots currently rank second to last in the most important and most consistent of all facets of team performance.

title: News Quiz | October 31, 2013
description: See what you know about the news below. To prepare, you might scan the articles or summaries on todays paper. Good luck!

title: Mayor 2013: The Final Debate
description: Bill de Blasio and Joseph J. Lhota repeatedly challenged each other over experience and values in the final televised debate, which was also heavy on detailed policy proposals.

title: Scenes From a Series
description: In a World Series notable for strong pitching and strange blunders, the Red Sox earned the third jewel in their championship crown over the last 10 years, and their eighth over all.

title: A Conversation With: Jazz Pianist Vijay Iyer
description: Vijay Iyer, 42, is an Indian-American jazz pianist and composer. His albums incorporate a mixture of traditional jazz, Indian classical fusion, and various other eclectic musical styles. Apart from producing music, Mr. Iyer also has a Ph.D in cognitive science of music and has written extensively on the relationship between music and society. Mr. Iyer was recently awarded the MacArthur Genius grant and appointed a professor in the department of music at Harvard University.

title: Manilas Mayor to Address Tensions With Hong Kong
description: MANILA  A former Philippine president, Joseph Estrada, now the mayor of Manila, hopes to accomplish in the next few weeks what the national government has failed to do in three years: mend strained ties with Hong Kong over a botched hostage rescue attempt in 2010 in which eight tourists from there were killed.

title: Revenue Slumps at BNP Paribas, but Profit Rises on Cost-Cutting
description: LONDON  The French bank BNP Paribas reported better-than-expected earnings in the third quarter despite lower overall revenue and a nearly 11 percent decline in its investment-banking business resulting from a lackluster economic environment.

title: Test Yourself | English, Oct. 31, 2013
description: Use context clues and your knowledge of word roots to find the meaning of an unfamiliar word.

title: Movies Flop Contributes to a Loss for Sony
description: TOKYO  After tantalizing investors with signs of a financial turnaround in the spring, Sony said on Thursday that it swung back to a loss in its summer quarter as strong sales of smartphones were not enough to overcome a dismal performance by the companys Hollywood arm.

title: 6 Qs About the News | How a Tick Sticks
description: In the article How Does a Tick Do Its Dirty Work? Research Video Offers a Clue and related video, James Gorman explains what scientists have learned about how ticks latch onto skin.

title: Should We Rethink How Long Students Spend in High School?
description: High school in the United States traditionally lasts four years. But should it?

title: Duane Michals: Heart of the Question
description: We highly recommend viewing the slideshow in full-screen mode.

title: The Pills of Last Resort
description: It was shortly after the breadbasket arrived last year at the Temple Bar near Harvard Square that Sarah Broom first told me about the last-ditch plan to save her own life.

title: Syria Destroys Chemical Sites, Inspectors Say
description: BEIRUT, Lebanon  Syrias ability to produce chemical weapons has been destroyed and its remaining toxic armaments secured, weapons inspectors said Thursday, as President Bashar al-Assad has offered unexpectedly robust cooperation, at least so far, with a Russian-United States accord to dismantle his arsenal.

title: Q. & A.: Philip Potter on the Growing Risk of Terrorism in China
description: The Beijing police say that the vehicle crash and explosion near Tiananmen Square on Monday, which killed five people and injured 40, was a terrorist attack and have arrested five members of the Uighur ethnic minority group whom they have labeled as Islamic extremists.

title: New York Today: Lil Lhota vs. de Blasio Jr.
description: Updated 11:09 a.m. | We wanted to cover Halloween today. And mayoral politics.

title: Wheelies: The Cash for Clunkers Edition
description: A roundup of motoring news from around the web:

title: Daily Report: States Take Lead in Online Privacy Legislation
description: State legislatures around the country, facing growing public concern about the collection and trade of personal data, have rushed to propose a series of privacy laws, from limiting how schools can collect student data to deciding whether the police need a warrant to tap cellphones, Somini Sengupta reports.

title: Jobless Rate in Euro Zone Stays at Record
description: FRANKFURT  The economic recovery in the euro zone is feeble. Employment continues to suffer. And the patient is likely to be getting around on crutches for months if not years to come. That was essentially the prognosis from two key economic indicators published Thursday and from economists assessing the latest conditions.

title: Profit Margins Squeeze Shell and Exxon Mobil
description: LONDON  Royal Dutch Shell, Europes largest company by market capitalization, reported sharply lower earnings for its third quarter as weak profit margins in refining, and disruption in Nigeria, one of Shells leading production areas, hurt results.

title: Chegg Seeks to Raise Up to $172.5 Million in I.P.O.
description: Chegg, a start-up focused on textbook rental and academic services, said on Thursday that it hoped to raise up to $172.5 million in its initial public offering.

title: The Royal Family on Twitter: Approved Disclosure, in Short Bursts
description: LONDON  To follow Britains royal family on its Twitter accounts is to enter a universe that Shakespeare, with his battle-scarred kings and anguished princes, would not recognize.

title: Seeing a Turning Point for Chinas Thinking on Terrorism
description: One of Chinas leading experts on counterterrorism and foreign policy predicted on Thursday that the fiery crash of a vehicle three days earlier near the Chinese leaderships compound at the edge of Tiananmen Square would lead to a broad reassessment of domestic security and Chinas diplomacy.

title: 3 Star Deal Makers Form London Advisory Boutique
description: LONDON  They could call themselves the three Simons of investment banking.

title: Digging Into Deep Pockets at Auction
description: Its strange to think that just a decade ago, Christies entire evening sale of postwar and contemporary art totaled $62 million. On Nov. 12, during the second of the two big auction weeks that start in New York on Monday night, Christies is offering one painting  a Francis Bacon triptych  that is expected to bring $85 million. Its archrival, Sothebys, has a 1963 Warhol that it anticipates will sell for $60 million to $80 million.

title: Afraid of Snakes? Your Pulvinar May Be to Blame
description: Multiple Walter Whites will walk the streets on Thursday in search of candy. But some frights endure the fashion cycle and never go out of style.

title: Black and White and in the Red
description: WITHIN a month of taking over as editor of The Hatchet, George Washington Universitys student newspaper, Cory Weinberg knew that something had to change. Advertising dollars had been steadily declining. Printing costs continued to rise. At the same time, visits to the website were up. The number of students reading articles on their mobile devices had doubled. Traffic from Twitter had increased 300 percent in the last year.

title: 1961: Rue des Mauvais Garons to Keep Name
description: PARIS The City of Paris came to the defense of its rowdy past today when Prefect Jean Benedetti refused to change the name of the Rue des Mauvais-Garons (Street of Bad Boysor hoodlums in French slang).

title: Trick-or-Treating, Honestly
description: Dear Diary:

title: Times Co. Posts a Loss, Hurt by Sale of The Globe
description: The New York Times Company reported a quarterly loss on Thursday, attributable in large part, the company said, to expenses related to the sale of the New England Media Group, which included The Boston Globe, and some pension expenses.

title: Time Warner Left Bruised in Fee Battle With CBS
description: The CBS blackout in homes with Time Warner Cable ended in early September. But the damage from the feud is still being tallied up  and it may be lasting.

title: Some Essential Reading (and Viewing) on Government Surveillance and the Press
description: On the endlessly fascinating subject of journalists, press rights and government surveillance, in what might be called the Snowden era, a few recently published articles (and a television interview) may be of interest.

title: Acrostic
description: Acrostic puzzle for November 3, 2013

title: Acrostic Answer
description: Acrostic answer for November 3, 2013

title: Young, Restless and Indian
description: MUMBAI, India  Back in 2003, when I lived in a small, liberal California town near Berkeley, the prospect of George W. Bushs re-election filled my neighbors and me with palpable dread. At our annual block party some of us facetiously repeated things hed said, Bushisms like I know the human being and fish can coexist peacefully. What we really meant was that we could not coexist with Bush, peacefully or otherwise.

title: In Shadows, Hints of a Life and Even a Job for Snowden
description: MOSCOW  On very rare occasions, almost always at night, Edward J. Snowden leaves his secret, guarded residence here, somewhere, in Russia. He is always under close protection. He spends his days learning the language and reading. He recently finished Crime and Punishment.

title: After a Run of Growth, Concern Over Japans Next Moves
description: HONG KONG  Nearly a year after the Japanese began to hope that their economy could turn around under new leadership, a sense of realism is replacing the euphoria.

title: A Doggie Bag for Your Jeep
description: Just about anyone with a large dog can appreciate a vehicle with a large rear compartment. The trouble is, with all that space back there it can be difficult to keep things secured in one spot  particularly an animal with a mind of its own. Many dog owners buy those cagelike steel partitions that mount just behind the rear seats of a sport utility vehicle, crossover or wagon, but what if you want to drive a car that doesnt look like a mobile animal control unit?

title: Loud and Colorful, With Total Recall
description: In 1967, the same year that the playwright Tennessee Williams found himself in the depths of substance abuse, depression and critical failure, a short, busty, outspoken 17-year-old named Susana Ventura completed her tenure in reform school and ran away from working-class New Britain, Conn. She moved to downtown Manhattan, was sheltered by drag queens and fell under the tutelage of gay artists including Andy Warhol; the filmmaker and performance artist Jack Smith; and John Vaccaro, founder of the avant-garde Play-House of the Ridiculous theater group.

title: And a Child Shall Lead Them Into Space Battle
description: At one point in Enders Game, the boy brainiac Ender Wiggin stands on a podium waving his arms. A vast, immersive image of outer space is spread out before him, and if you didnt know better, you might think he was playing Wii on an Imax screen. Its an amusingly self-reflexive moment in a humorless movie about children who play war games as part of their very grown-up military training. As he furiously moves spaceships and troops across computer screens, he looks, by turns, like a superexcited kid, an orchestra conductor, Mickey Mouse as the Sorcerers Apprentice and even a Christ figure. Childhood can be tough in movies, but rarely do screen children suffer for our sins as they do here.

title: Free Speech, for the Loudest
description: Even those who oppose New York Citys stop and frisk policy should be chagrined about the way noisy protesters at Brown University on Tuesday greeted the citys police commissioner, Raymond Kelly.

title: Filling Cavities Can Be a Laugh, but Dentists Still Suggest Limiting Gummies at Halloween
description: No Sour Patch Kids, no Skittles, no Swedish Fish. Same goes for Starbursts, gummi bears and Nerds.

title: A Journalist With a Mission
description: RIO DE JANEIRO  A young American lawyer comes to Brazil in 2005, falls in love, finds that his gay relationship confers greater legal rights than back home, starts a blog called Unclaimed Territory focusing on illegal warrantless eavesdropping by the National Security Agency, takes a place in the hills of Rio with a bunch of rescue dogs, denounces the cozy compromises of establishment journalists, gets hired to write a column by Britains Guardian newspaper, is sought out by the N.S.A. whistle-blower Edward J. Snowden, becomes the main chronicler of Snowdens revelations of global American surveillance, is lionized for work that prompts a far-reaching debate on security and freedom, files repeated thunderbolts from his leafy Brazilian perch, and ends up, in just eight years, as perhaps the most famous journalist of his generation.

title: Another Delay for Small-Business Health Exchanges? Depends on Whom You Ask.
description: If you thought that the small business health insurance exchange would be fully working Friday, prepare for some disappointment. On Tuesday, while testifying at a House hearing, Marilyn Tavenner, the head of the Center for Medicare & Medicaid Services, the government agency implementing the federally run health insurance exchanges, said that the Small Business Health Options exchanges would be functional at the end of November.

title: On the Trail of a Nuisance
description: Dusty Kennedy and Clint Watson head out with their dogs to hunt feral hogs.

title: Slower Growth: Its Not Just Government
description: Jared Bernstein is a senior fellow at the Center on Budget and Policy Priorities in Washington and a former chief economist to Vice President Joseph R. Biden Jr.

title: F.A.A. Approves Use of Devices on Flights
description: Its game on, quite literally, for airline passengers who want to use their cellphones and other portable electronics during flights. The Federal Aviation Administration announced Thursday morning that it has approved the use of electronic devices during all phases of a flight, with a few exceptions, according to a release from the agency.

title: Poetry Pairing | The Fisherman
description: Two well-known Irish poets are remembered in this Poetry Pairing, which features the nearly 100-year-old poem The Fisherman by William Butler Yeats, and the August 2013 obituary Seamus Heaney, Irish Poet of Soil and Strife, Dies at 74 by Margalit Fox.

title: F.A.A. Moves to Ease Electronics Ban, Opening the Runways to Angry Birds
description: WASHINGTON  The days of airline passengers being hounded to turn off their tablets or e-readers for takeoff and landing are coming to an end.

title: Baby Book as Battleground
description: At first glance, you might mistake this little book for one of those slightly old-fashioned illustrated stories grandparents give preschoolers as holiday gifts. It could be a Golden Book, say, illustrated by Garth Williams. This one is already inscribed: To my little birthday bunny on his special day. Love, Gran Gran. The note appears to have been written in ballpoint by someone who studied penmanship. But below that inscription, the books title has been defaced: What was once Birthday Bunny has been scrawled over, with a marker and in a far less steady hand. It now reads, Battle Bunny.

title: The Gun Report: October 31, 2013
description: The police chief in Sanford, Fla., where George Zimmerman, a neighborhood watch volunteer, shot and killed 17-year-old Trayvon Martin last year, is set to unveil rules stressing that volunteers are not to carry guns or follow suspects. In a community meeting next week, Police Chief Cecil Smith, who took over the department in April and quickly and suspended the neighborhood watch program, will emphasize that members are to call police when they see a suspicious person or activity. Zimmerman was acquitted of second-degree murder in July.

title: The Less-Skilled Surgeon
description: Video from a study in The New England Journal of medicine demonstrating a less-skilled surgeon. Warning: Graphic content.

title: The Highly-Ranked Surgeon
description: Video from a study in The New England Journal of medicine demonstrating a good surgeon. Warning: Graphic content.

title: Reshuffling at Time Inc. to Set Table for Spinoff
description: Seeking to increase revenue by building a closer partnership between business and the newsroom, Time Inc. said on Thursday that the editors of its individual magazines would report directly to the companys business side for the first time in its history, instead of the editor in chief of Time Inc.

title: James Blake Wins Britains Mercury Prize
description: James Blake, a pianist and singer whose music is a blend of gentle, soulful ballad structures with beats and electronic textures, was awarded this years Barclaycard Mercury Prize for his second album, Overgrown, at a ceremony at the Roundhouse in London on Wednesday. The $32,000 prize, which was established in 1992 by the British Phonographic Industry and British Association of Record Dealers, is for the best British or Irish album of the year, selected by an anonymous jury.

title: A Property Fight in the Adirondacks, Brewing for a Century, Is on the Ballot
description: TOWNSHIP 40, N.Y.  There are no road signs leading to this place, a square swath of Adirondack Park greenery in Hamilton County. There is no Welcome to... or Thanks for visiting... sign. Indeed, visitors would have to be a cartographer, or maybe an environmental lawyer, to know they were there.

title: M.V.P. Goes to a Most Valuable Papi
description: BOSTON  David Ortiz had done everything else right in this World Series. He had hit just about every pitch. He had said the right things, at the right moments. Now, he could make one more memory. He held the World Series Most Valuable Player trophy high, in his right hand, looked out at his people, and shouted, This is for you, Boston!

title: T WINTER LUXURY
description: At their Milan atelier, one of the last truly Old World interiors firms, Studio Peregalli, is making history  mining everything from the high Renaissance to the Victorian era  to create deeply poetic spaces that transcend the bounds of time.

title: Performing Global Warming
description: You may have already heard Daniel Crawford perform his cello composition A Song for Our Warming Planet, built with notes representing each years global average surface temperature:

title: Intimidating Pakistans Press
description: LONDON  The Shura-e-Mujahedeen, a group affiliated with the Pakistani Taliban, recently reissued a year-old fatwa describing Pakistani journalists and media outlets as enemies of the mujahedeen. The decree threatened several radio stations and included photographs of the popular political talk show hosts Hamid Mir and Hasan Nisar, accusing them of promoting secular and Western values and spreading anti-Muslim propaganda. The fatwa was first issued following widespread condemnation by Pakistani journalists of the Talibans attempt to kill the teenage education activist Malala Yousafzai in October 2012. The announcement raises concerns about journalists safety in a country that is already among the deadliest in the world for reporters.

title: Fantasy Football: Week 9 Matchup Breakdown
description: In a season in which Knowshon Moreno, who was undrafted in some leagues, is fantasy footballs No. 2 running back and Doug Martin, who was supposed to be fantasys No. 2 running back (based on average draft position), is probably available on your leagues waiver wire, nobody should be surprised that the rookie Marvin Jones (CIN) is suddenly a top-15 wide receiver.

title: Scores of Migrants From Niger Found Dead in Sahara
description: DAKAR, Senegal  The decomposing bodies of 87 migrants from the impoverished West African nation of Niger were discovered in the Sahara this week just a few miles from a well, apparently stranded after a desperate search for water, said the head of a local humanitarian organization who helped bury many of the bodies.

title: The Dreams of War
description: The Civil War placed new and unique strains on Americans, and their dreams reflected those hardships. Sometimes the war intruded on peoples slumber, vividly bringing to life the horrors of the conflict; for others, nighttime was an escape from the hard realities of life and death in wartime. When Americans recorded their dreams in their diaries, letters and memoirs, they sought to make sense of the changing world around them, and to cope with the confusion, despair, and loneliness of life amid the turmoil of a gigantic civil war.

title: Former Premier Can Be Charged, Czech Court Rules
description: PARIS  The Czech Supreme Court ruled on Thursday that former Prime Minister Petr Necas was not entitled to immunity from prosecution for the period when he was head of government, clearing the way for prosecutors who have been seeking to charge him with corruption.

title: U.S. Teams Up With Operator of Online Courses to Plan a Global Network
description: Coursera, a California-based venture that has enrolled five million students in its free online courses, announced on Thursday a partnership with the United States government to create learning hubs around the world where students can go to get Internet access to free courses supplemented by weekly in-person class discussions with local teachers or facilitators.

title: A Play Thats Sure to Make You Sweat
description: THE Russian and Turkish Baths on 10th Street in the East Village is a place where people (including, legend has it, Frank Sinatra, Timothy Leary and John Belushi) have gone for escape for more than a century. But the baths could easily pass for a place you would want to escape from, under different circumstances. Inside, they are dark and dank and sweaty, packed with masses of hot, sagging flesh, a spa version of Dantes City of Dis, where the heretics are punished in burning stone coffins.

title: Are Caregivers Healthier?
description: The idea that caring for a chronically ailing or disabled family member might be good for you is so startling, so counterintuitive, that it sends researchers rummaging through their data to see where they went wrong.

title: What to Do When Your Child Asks About Your Income
description: Of all the money questions that our kids will eventually ask, the inquiry about our income may be the toughest one of all to answer. Why, exactly, do they want to know how much money we make? And what are they going to do with the information?!

title: A Grim Aftermath
description: Residents of Centro do Meio, Brazil, are still dealing with an attack on a soccer field that left two men dead. It began with a yellow card.

title: Cirque du Soleil Facing Fines in Death of Performer
description: After a four-month investigation the Nevada Occupational Safety and Health Administration has fined Cirque du Soleil and the MGM Grand Hotel and Casino in Las Vegas for safety violations that the agency said led to the death of a 31-year-old French acrobat, Sarah Guillot-Guyard, in a fall during a performance of KA on June 29.

title: In Our Pages: November 1
description: 1888 Zola Condemned

title: Best Illustrated Books
description: The New York Times Best Illustrated Childrens Books of 2013, with sample artwork from each.

title: Walker Tower Penthouse Under Contract
description: A full-floor penthouse atop Walker Tower, a newly converted luxury condominium in Chelsea, has gone into contract for more than $50 million, a new high for a condo sale in downtown Manhattan.

title: Image of the Day: October 31
Kerry to Visit Saudi Arabia to Smooth Relations
description: Secretary of State John Kerry will begin a nine-day trip to the Middle East, Europe and North Africa on Sunday by stopping in Saudi Arabia for talks with King Abdullah, a major ally who is angered over what he sees as Obama administration failures on Syria, Egypt, the Palestinian-Israeli conflict and relations with Iran.

title: One Complicated Life, Illustrated
description: In her engaging and ultimately sad biography of Norman Rockwell, Deborah Solomon fills in the partly known life of one of Americas most famous and popular illustrator-artists. Because Rockwell has been well documented  from his own autobiography in 1960 to periodic monographs from art-book publishers in later decades  a skeptic might ask if a new accounting is needed. Well, no and yes.

title: If Your Child Was Bullied, When Did You Intervene and When Did You Stay Out?
description: It is a very painful and scary thing for parents to learn that their child is being bullied. Though my four  now young adults  were relatively popular and athletic kids, I watched them go through bullying several times. It was one of the the harder problems I faced as a dad, and its the topic we are asking our readers to discuss this week: Do I intervene on behalf of my children or hold back and let them work out the problem themselves?

title: A Vital Measure: Your Surgeons Skill
description: To those of us in training, the hospital was cursed. At least when it came to a certain operation.

title: Ann Patchett: By the Book
description: After the novelist, memoirist and author of This Is the Story of a Happy Marriage read Charlottes Web at age 9, she became so obsessed, she got a pet pig: Thats impact.

title: Changes on In-Flight Electronic Devices
description: Michael P. Huerta, the head of the Federal Aviation Administration, explained the relaxed rules on using electronic devices during flights.

title: Planned Obsolescence, as Myth or Reality
description: The new iPhone is out. That means, as I wrote in a column for the coming issue of The New York Times Magazine, that conspiracy theories again abound about ways that older models start to become more unattractive and dysfunctional around the time that a shiny new upgrade is available.

title: MARKET REPORT
description: From cocktail dresses to jewelry, blue feathers are marking their territory as a timeless wardrobe addition.

title: A Second N.F.L. Player Signs Public Offering Deal
description: Fantex, the company that introduced the first initial public offering for an athlete, has signed its second client.

title: Air France-KLM Writes Off Alitalia Stake
description: PARIS  Air France-KLM, the French-Dutch airline, said Thursday that it had written off the entire value of its 25 percent holding in its partner Alitalia, raising doubts that it will take part in a plan to inject 300 million euros into the struggling Italian flag carrier.

title: Booker Joins the Senate and Casts His First Vote
description: WASHINGTON  Cory A. Booker, who gained celebrity as a danger-defying, super-tweeting mayor of Newark, was sworn in as New Jerseys junior United States senator on Thursday. He is the first African-American to be elected to the chamber since Barack Obama in 2004.

title: Jane Austen Portrait Intrigue Deepens
description: Jane Austen may have been dead for nearly 200 years, but she continues to make waves in Britain.

title: G.O.P. Filibuster of 2 Obama Picks Sets Up Fight
description: WASHINGTON  Senate Republicans on Thursday thwarted the confirmation of two of President Obamas nominees, one to a powerful appeals court and another to a home-lending oversight post, setting up a confrontation with Democrats that could escalate into a larger fight over limiting the filibuster and restrict how far the minority party can go to block a presidents agenda.

title: A Landmark Turn in Indias Medical Negligence Law
description: Anuradha Saha died painfully in May 1998 at the age of 36, her skin sloughed off all over her body, except for her skull. She was encased in bandages meant to prevent infections that had already lodged in her system. Her immunity had been compromised after receiving a high dosage of steroids from some of the top doctors in Kolkata.

title: Love Trouble
description: It should not be strange to encounter any of Shakespeares plays at any time of the year, so firmly ensconced are they in the canon. And yet theres something a little startling in the arrival of a production of A Midsummer Nights Dream opening in November, as Julie Taymors upcoming production at Theater for a New Audience will. The play is among Shakespeares most beloved and most frequently produced, but it has mostly become a rite of summer, often performed outdoors, with picnickers sharing bottles of wine and children romping on grass.

title: As Security Deteriorates at Home, Iraqi Leader Arrives in U.S. Seeking Aid
description: WASHINGTON  When Prime Minister Nuri Kamal al-Maliki of Iraq last visited the White House, he and his host painted a glowing picture of the situation in Iraq after the withdrawal of American forces.

title: Australia Said to Play Part in N.S.A. Effort
description: BEIJING  Australia, a close ally of the United States, has used its embassies in Asia to collect intelligence as part of the National Security Agencys global surveillance efforts, according to a document leaked by the former agency contractor Edward J. Snowden and published this week in the German newsmagazine Der Spiegel.

title: When Joy Storms the Field
description: Crowds of emotional fans have often created a memorable pandemonium after the winning of a pennant or a World Series.

title: Profit Margins Squeeze Exxon Mobil and Shell
description: HOUSTON  Exxon Mobil and Royal Dutch Shell reported sharply lower third-quarter earnings on Thursday because of weaker profit margins in refining and a sluggish global economy.

title: Starting Windows 8.1 in Desktop Mode
description: Q. I read that you can make Windows 8.1 start directly in desktop mode instead of going to the Start Screen apps, but how?

title: Fantasy Football: Week 9 Tiered Rankings Overview
description: In this statistical model, I apply a clustering algorithm called the Gaussian mixture model to an aggregation of expert ranking data provided by Fantasypros.com. The algorithm finds natural tiers and clusters within the data. The charts that result visualize the tiers and help you decide your starting lineup each week.

title: Today in Small Business: Drones That Deliver Pizza
description: Whats affecting me, my clients and other small-business owners today.

title: Tablets on a Plane
description: It took a while, but common sense has finally prevailed when it comes to the rules governing travelers use of electronic devices on planes. The Federal Aviation Administration announced on Thursday that passengers could soon be allowed to use tablet computers, e-books, music players and other devices in planes at almost all times as long as their wireless functions are disabled by putting the device in airplane mode. (The editorial board backed changing F.A.A.s policies earlier this month.)

title: A Call for Scrooge McDucks to Pinch Fewer Pennies
description: The billionaire bond analyst Bill Gross is calling on the Scrooge McDucks of the world to share a little more of their wealth.

title: Booker Is Sworn In as Senator
description: Cory A. Booker, the former mayor of Newark, became the newest member of the Senate after he was sworn in by Vice President Joseph R. Biden Jr.

title: On-Screen Frights
description: Select offereings in the Scary Movies series at the Film Society of Lincoln Center.

title: Dwight Merriman of MongoDB on Leading by Enthusiasm
description: This interview with Dwight Merriman, chairman and co-founder of MongoDB, an open-source document database, was conducted and condensed by Adam Bryant.

title: In Saudi Arabia, Even Writing About Female Drivers Can Mean Trouble
description: A columnist in Saudi Arabia who published a commentary on womens rights has been detained by the authorities as they cracked down on a campaign by the kingdoms women this month to defy a ban on driving.

title: Toronto Police Chief Says Mayor Appears in Video Uncovered in Criminal Investigation
description: Updated, 3:09 p.m. | Torontos police chief, Bill Blair, revealed at a news conference on Thursday that Mayor Rob Ford does appear in a digital video file uncovered in the course of a criminal investigation into his friend and sometime driver.

title: Batistas Bravado, Even After His Companys Bankruptcy
description: Even bankruptcy cant subdue Eike Batistas bombast.

title: In Amish Country, on the Train to Paradise
description: The double hoot of a steam train jolted me awake. I peeked out the window above my bed. A wispy gray tuft billowed behind a massive coal-burning locomotive as it chuffed across fields of Amish farmland toward Paradise, Pa.

title: In Stockholm, ABBA, Alcohol and Animals
description: Buzzy new gastropubs and drinking salons have been proliferating throughout Stockholms urban islands, from pockets of the tourist-heavy Gamla Stan to hip Sodermalm, which today is a virtual Little Brooklyn with its bars, body art and beards. But Djurgarden, the tranquil two-mile-long island in the middle of the capital, had largely been a stalwart against these waves of change. Dense with meadows, an aging amusement park and staid museums, Djurgarden lacked the dynamic appeal that pulses in nearby areas. But recent openings on the western edge are infusing new life into this oft-overlooked island.

title: After Fraud, the Fog Around Libor Hasnt Lifted
description: The Libor market, we now know, was a fraud. There were few  if any  real trades backing the indicator.

title: Student Contest | 15-Second Vocabulary Videos
description: Update, Dec. 20: Winners have been announced!

title: In Namibia, Conservation and Tourism Intersect
description: Uamunikaije Tjivinda squatted in the sand and threw a few strips of dried giraffe meat into a pot of boiling water. Like many Himba women in the arid, northwestern part of Namibia called Kaokoland, she wore sandals, a goatskin skirt and little else. Her skin and long, plaited hair were a striking rust-red, rubbed with ocher dug from the earth.

title: A Mood Change at Security Checkpoints
description: Mood lighting and upbeat music arent revolutionary ideas for romancing a date, but they may be for wooing travelers at airport security checkpoints. At least thats the hope of the creators of a new security experience being tested at the Charlotte-Douglas and Dallas-Fort Worth International Airports over the next few months.

title: Jos. A. Bank Says It May Raise Bid for Mens Wearhouse
description: Jos. A. Bank said on Thursday that it was willing to raise its takeover bid for Mens Wearhouse, but only if its target was willing to begin merger talks.

title: Parents Group Challenges Theaters Policy on Blue Is the Warmest Color
description: Soon after church groups denounced Monty Pythons Life of Brian as blasphemous, John Cleese was asked, in a television interview, what he thought of the ruckus. These people have made me, he said, calmly, and with a dramatic pause, a very rich man.

title: 10,000-Year Study Finds Oceans Warming Fast, But From a Cool Baseline
description: I had a fascinating and fruitful chat with Yair Rosenthal of Rutgers and Braddock Linsley of Columbia University  two authors of an important new Science paper extracting 10,000 years of temperature changes in fairly deep Pacific Ocean waters from fossil plankton buried in the seabed off Indonesia.

title: When Joy Storms the Field
description: On Wednesday night, after the Red Sox took a 6-0 lead against the St. Louis Cardinals in Game 6 of the World Series, the Boston police were getting ready for an onslaught of emotional fans, announcing on Twitter, Anyone who is not in a bar and does not have a ticket to the game must leave the permitter area around #Fenway.

title: Recovered Video of Mayor Roils Toronto
description: OTTAWA  Canadas largest city, Toronto, was in political turmoil on Thursday after the police said they had recovered a video apparently showing Mayor Rob Ford smoking crack cocaine.

title: Work by Britten Resurfaces at American Ballet Theater
description: A Benjamin Britten orchestration of Chopin piano music that was believed to be lost will re-enter the repertory on Friday night when American Ballet Theater uses it for its performance of Michel Fokines Les Sylphides at the David H. Koch Theater.

title: Google Announces New Phone and Updates Operating System
description: SAN FRANCISCO  Every day, Google crawls and indexes the entire Internet to help deliver the best search results on its website. Now the company wants to apply the same firepower to dig through applications on smartphones that run the Android operating system.

title: A Southwest Orientation
description: With the opening in June of Palomino, Rafael Palomino added to his nuevo Latino restaurant holdings, which include the perennially popular Sonora, in Port Chester, N.Y.; Bistro Latino and Pacifico, both in Connecticut; and Mesa, Pacifico and Tapas on Main, all in Pennsylvania. (There has been some shuffling: this Palomino is not to be confused with Palomino in Old Greenwich, Conn., which became Greenwich Tavern and then Bistro Latino; Bistro Latino in Tuckahoe and Pacifico in Port Chester have closed). The author of several books, he also runs a consulting company, Latino Chef, and a catering company, Pasin. With his jazzy branding and meticulously built dishes, Mr. Palomino has made a name for himself.

title: Set for Marathon, Ex-Addicts Find Their Way
description: CORIANO, Italy  It is still dark when Sara Floriddia laces her shoes and goes running on the hilltop roads near the Adriatic coast of Italy. With every mile, she leaves her past further behind.

title: Timetable for Opening of Small Business Exchanges May Not Represent a Delay
description: Another Delay for Small-Business Health Exchanges? Depends on Whom You Ask.

title: Gastronomia Culinaria
description: Inside the Upper West Side restaurant that evokes a small Roman trattoria.

title: Ewan McGregor to Make Broadway Debut in Real Thing
description: Updated, 6:13 p.m. | Ewan McGregor will follow in the footsteps of Roger Rees, Jeremy Irons and Stephen Dillane when he stars in The Real Thing, the 1982 play that many theatergoers consider Tom Stoppards best.

title: A Modest Reminder of Rome
description: The bread lay on a notched wooden board, anchored by a saucer of something creamy and wildly green that evoked pesto but tasted like ocean floor. When asked about the ingredients, the waiter looked startled. I do not know the name for this in English, he said. Rucola? Also a small fish. Arugula and anchovy, a woman at my table suggested. He smiled, shrugged and vanished.

title: A Yellow Card, Then Unfathomable Violence, in Brazil
description: PIO XII, Brazil  It was midafternoon that Sunday when Otvio Jordo da Silva Cantanhede left on his bike to play pickup soccer. His father said he did not see him tuck a knife into his shorts or slide a blade into his backpack.

title: Pictures of the Day: Italy and Elsewhere
description: Photos from Italy, the West Bank, the Philippines and India.

title: The Weekly Health Quiz
description: In the news: tainted spices, commutings costs and smokings quit day. Test your knowledge of this weeks health news.

title: To Boldly Go, but Not to Blog
description: Busy day, not sure if I will manage to get anything up. But for your surreal pleasure: the US Navy has a brand-new super-high-tech ship, the Elmo Zumwalt  stealth, incredibly long-range weapons, etc.. And who is the new vessels captain?

title: Decision From the United States Court of Appeals for the Second Circuit
description: Read the full decision from the United States Court of Appeals for the Second Circuit.

title: Social Network for Opinions Gets a Dose of New Money
description: Its not hard to find people who express strong opinions about politics, social issues and their favorite movies on Facebook and Twitter. In fact, theres a whole cottage industry of researchers and entrepreneurs dedicated to mining social networks using language analysis tools to measure sentiments.

title: Court Blocks Stop-and-Frisk Changes for New York Police
description: A federal appeals court on Thursday halted a sweeping set of changes to the New York Police Departments practice of stopping and frisking people on the street, and, in strikingly personal terms, criticized the trial judges conduct and removed her from the case.

title: Activism Is Going Global, Citi Warns Clients
description: Citigroup has a message for the international companies it advises: Watch out for the activists.

title: Writing Bytes
description: The Internet has changed (and keeps changing) how we live today  how we find love, make money, communicate with and mislead one another. Writers in a variety of genres tell us what these new technologies mean for storytelling.

title: Russian Diamond Firm Closes Higher After Offering
description: MOSCOW  Shares of the Russian diamond-mining company Alrosa closed slightly higher on Thursday in their first day of trading, indicating some investor enthusiasm for a stock that offers a way to place a market bet on the price of diamonds.

title: Market Report | Timeless, Feathery Finds
description: The plume briefly disappeared from the fashion scene after last years Catherine, Duchess of Cambridge-inspired fascinator craze died down. But now its back, this time on clothes and accessories and in varying shades of blue, from deep sapphire to a bluish gray. Feathers complement satinas a shapely detail on a Christopher Kane cocktail dress, a dangling tassel on a Roger Vivier heel and on the diamond-encrusted face on a Harry Winston watch;and take center stage as the main material of a Louis Vuitton handbag. Fanned around a white gold and diamond cuff from Wilfredo Rosado, sapphire feathers add interest to any evening look. And unlike the fascinator, Stephen Russells archival feather brooch, made entirely of actual sapphires and diamonds, will never go out of style.

title: An Abundance of Asian Flavors
description: If youre trying to find Aja, a pan-Asian spot on Route 1 North in New Brunswick, look for the multicolored lights swooping across a lumber framework that hides the buildings origins as a Fuddruckers. (The Aja sign is illegible at highway speed.)

title: Hydrangea Hyperbole at New York Botanical Garden
description: Seed catalogs can tell tales, and not just about shifting tastes in flower-bed palettes. In 19th-century America, these promotional booklets tried to convince customers that gardens could change the world.

title: 'Promises'
description: The most recent ad from the Lhota campaign features the candidate speaking directly to the camera.

title: Oracle Shareholders Oppose Compensation for Ellison
description: A majority of Oracle shareholders demonstrated their opposition to the compensation of the software giants chief executive, Lawrence J. Ellison, on Thursday, voting against a nonbinding resolution on the companys pay practices.

title: Sophie Calle: Absence
description: Paula Cooper Gallery

title: Richard Hollis
description: Artists Space: Books & Talks

title: Workers TB Investigated at Hospital
description: An employee who worked in the maternity ward of a Manhattan hospital tested positive for tuberculosis, setting off a search for anyone who might have come in contact with the infected worker, including dozens of newborn babies.

title: Michaela Eichwald: Ergriffenes Dasein: Artist, Writer, Mentalist
description: Reena Spaulings Fine Art

title: David Shaw: Eat Out
description: Feature Inc.

title: Farrell Brought Consistency to a Franchise in Chaos
description: BOSTON  A year ago, the Boston Red Sox opened Fenway Park for Halloween. Children paraded around the warning track in costumes. There were face painters, magicians and balloon artists. Will Middlebrooks, Rich Gedman and Wally the Green Monster greeted fans.

title: What You Cant See Is Even Cooler
description: Mordecai-Mark Mac Low, a curator at the American Museum of Natural History, was showing off an exhibit about the history of the universe outside the Hayden Planetarium there eight years ago, he says, when a schoolteacher approached him and said, You dont really believe all this Big Bang stuff, do you?

title: Daniel Lopatin Music at MoMA PS1, and Drama at Theater 167
description: The composer Daniel Lopatin has attracted a lot of attention over the last few years for someone working in the avant-garde of electronic dance music under the almost farcically unwieldy name Oneohtrix Point Never.

title: A Bluesy Voice for Country, Heavy on Experience
description: If there was ever a time to be young and female and blond in country music, it was the mid-2000s: the era of Taylor, of Carrie, of Miranda. All of a sudden, the genres innovation was coming from its female stars, leaving their male counterparts to atrophy on the vine.

title: American Davis Cup Team Warms to Clay Courts
description: PARIS  To beat back the British, the United States Davis Cup team is prepared to get dirty.

title: A Floating Historians Hot-Air Adventure
description: Richard Holmes, author of Falling Upwards, takes a ride in a balloon.

title: Salonen Meets Sibelius
description: During his adventurous 17-year tenure as music director of the Los Angeles Philharmonic, the conductor Esa-Pekka Salonen was so preoccupied with his work there, and with carving out time to compose, his top priority, that he had limited occasions for guest appearances with American orchestras, including the New York Philharmonic.

title: Where Horses Wet Their Whistles
description: So, with both main mayoral candidates opposed to allowing horse-drawn carriages in the streets, a major chapter in the history of New York may be about to close. The first horses served man here no later than the 1620s, and since then they have pulled, plodded, trotted and galloped in our service.

title: Imagining the First Strains Wafting, When the Ink Was Scarcely Dry
description: The handwritten score on display at the Morgan Library & Museum is open to a passage near the end of Beethovens Ninth Symphony: As the orchestra and chorus are ecstatically hailing Joy, the bright spark of divinity, the musics reins are suddenly pulled back, the meter shifts, and exuberance gives way to majesty.

title: Conservative Group Tests New Attack on Health Law
description: A promise President Obama may come to regret  If you like your health care plan, you can keep it  is the centerpiece of the latest web video attacking the Affordable Care Act, released Thursday by Americans for Prosperity, the conservative advocacy group that is working to undo the health law.

title: The Philanderer Reconsiders
description: A Perfect Man is a platitude-packed romance that might never have seen the light of day had its star, Liev Schreiber, not hit a career high with the success of Showtimes Ray Donovan. As it is, this feature debut from Kees Van Oostrum, set in Amsterdam among the members of an unpleasant clique of upper-middle-class malcontents, is one of those projects whose very existence should baffle anyone hardy enough to endure all 94 minutes.

title: A Dogs Tail Wag Says a Lot, to Other Dogs
description: When dogs wag their tails, they can convey not just happiness but a wide array of emotions. As Italian researchers reported in 2007, a wag to the left indicates negative emotions; a wag to the right indicates positive ones.

title: Oh, to Slip the Bonds of Earth
description: MIDDLETOWN, N.Y.  The first rule of ballooning, Richard Holmes said, is to forget all your troubles and let the world fall away. Almost as soon as he spoke, the wicker basket in which he was standing, attached to a 100-foot-tall hot-air balloon, began to rise, goosed by a blast of flame from its propane burner, and before long, he was skimming over the treetops here in Orange County. As the balloon slowly ascended, the landscape underneath increasingly resembled a train set. Startled, a buck down below began crashing through bushes. A moment later, the balloon drifted over a quiet country road, and a tractor-trailer gave a three-honk salute.

title: Renaissance Prayer Book Is Set for Auction
description: HIGH-PRICED PRAYER BOOK

title: Making a Home for Pakistani Runaways
description: Asad, a kind young van driver in Karachi, Pakistan, carries two kinds of passengers: lost children and corpses. He takes the children to a home for runaways or back to their parents; he is paid (usually) for the corpses.

title: Strident Video by Chinese Military Casts U.S. as Menace
description: A conspiracy-minded 100-minute film produced by the Chinese military that was circulating widely on the Internet Thursday accuses the United States of trying to undermine the Communist Partys control of the Peoples Liberation Army and impose American values on China.

title: Book Details Obama Aides Talks About Replacing Biden on 2012 Ticket
description: President Obamas top aides secretly considered replacing Vice President Joseph R. Biden Jr. with Hillary Rodham Clinton on the 2012 ticket, undertaking extensive focus-group sessions and polling in late 2011 when Mr. Obamas re-election outlook appeared uncertain.

title: The Politics of Acoustic Guitars
description: Even if you cant tell the difference between a soundboard and a fretboard, Musicwood will hold your attention. Merging the sustainability worries of guitar enthusiasts and environmentalists with the hard-cash concerns of logging corporations and Native American land developers, Maxine Trumps thoughtful documentary wrests clarity from complexity.

title: A Harmonic Marriage
description: Children and Art, John Pizzarelli and Jessica Molaskeys wonderful new show at the Caf Carlyle, isnt just the title of a Stephen Sondheim song from Sunday in the Park With George. This reflection on what matters most is paired with Children Will Listen, from Into the Woods, to make a sweeping reflection on the rewards and stresses of balancing the roles of parent and artist by musicians who are married with two children. Both songs address personal responsibility for that which we create and leave behind: Careful the things you say/Children will listen.

title: Pairings for Tasting Menus: A 30-Piece Puzzle
description: Setting out on the madcap journey through a chefs imagination that is otherwise known as a tasting menu can be a delight. It requires a commitment of time, attention and money, and the right mood and the company, but the results can be dazzling.

title: Shaping the Future, in the Kitchen and Beyond
description: Shoehorned into half the Museum of Modern Arts design department, Designing Modern Women 1890-1990 is a confusing exhibition but an excellent conversation starter.

title: A Little Shop of Possibilities
description: Sweet Dreams, a documentary about efforts by the Brooklyn-based Blue Marble Ice Cream company to help a group of Rwandan women open their own shop, could have come off as insensitive or twee. And in the first 10 minutes, I worried that it was, indeed, about how artisanal food could save Africa.

title: Q. & A.: Jung Chang on Censors, Bound Feet and the Chances of a Woman Leading China
description: It was first thing Thursday morning, and the author Jung Chang, in a dramatic emerald cloak, was already holding court in a suite overlooking Hong Kongs skyline. She was in town to promote her latest book, Empress Dowager Cixi: The Concubine Who Launched Modern China, which she wrote after gaining access to historical documents in Beijing that she says have not been seen or used outside the Chinese-speaking world.

title: Leaping Into a New Home, With Poetry and Storms
description: The David H. Koch Theater is fast becoming New Yorks prime year-round dance house. With its large upstairs foyer, its also a happy home for galas, and on Wednesday, American Ballet Theater opened its first season there in 37 years with a night that was seriously glamorous. That foyer was transformed into a spectacular alternative set for The Tempest  the evenings main event  with vast pillars and successive thunderclaps.

title: Rituals of Rented Island
description: A new show at the Whitney takes a look at performance arts beginnings.

title: Nothing to Spend, Nothing to Lose
description: With the end of daylight saving time this weekend, well set our clocks back an hour. But already in New York this fall, American art has been set back 40 years. Its the early 1970s again, with abstract painting and performance art the fashionable modes.

title: TV Talk: Midseason Renewals
description: The Times reporters Bill Carter and Brian Stelter discuss this weeks TV cancellations and renewals.

title: The Ad Campaign: Lhota Issues Warnings and Makes Promises
description: Joseph J. Lhota, the Republican nominee for mayor, released his latest television ad on Thursday. Titled Promises, it is airing on broadcast channels across New York City.

title: Shrimp, Grits and Everything in Between
description: Jonathan Harris has a talent for grits. A native of North Carolina, Mr. Harris is the executive chef at J. Christians in Wallingford, where he has been offering his version of the Southern specialty since the restaurant opened in 2010. Cooked in a mixture that is equal parts chicken stock and milk, the grits are made lusciously creamy and gooey with Asiago cheese. Why Asiago? Wallingford is an Italian town, Mr. Harris explained on the phone after my visits. I figured if I threw Italian cheese into the Southern grits, they would catch on faster.

title: Taking On Broncos and a Plague
description: Skinny as a whippet and fierce as a snapping turtle, Matthew McConaughey brings a jolt of unpredictable energy to Dallas Buyers Club, an affecting if conventional real-life story of medical activism. The film, directed by Jean-Marc Valle from a script by Craig Borten and Melisa Wallack, tells the story of Ron Woodroof, a Texas electrician and rodeo rider who, after receiving a diagnosis of H.I.V. in 1985, took his treatment into his own hands and helped others with the disease obtain medication not legally available in the United States at the time.

title: Where Photography Alone Wasnt Enough
description: A new show of portrait photography at the Rubin Museum of Art, Allegory and Illusion is a fascinating little piece of a very complicated puzzle. Ostensibly a focused, regional exhibition, it has much to say about the larger relationship between photography and colonialism (a subject big enough to fill several museums).

title: Comedy Listings for Nov. 1-7
description: For news about comedy and humor, including critical commentary: nytimes.com/arts. A searchable guide to these and other shows is at nytimes.com/events.

title: Todays Scuttlebot: Michael Arringtons Conflicts, and Rewarding Amazon Reviewers
description: Every day, The New York Timess staff scours the Web for interesting and peculiar items.

title: A Veteran Wave Rider Tells His Life Story in Art
description: Surfing to me is metaphysical yoga, the surf icon-turned-art world fixture Herbie Fletcher said. When youre in big waves and you take a drop, you lose your mind. Its being in the void. Theres no thought. Its bliss for a moment. Thats the state of mind these paintings are in, he said about the work on view in Path of the Wave Warrior, a massive exhibition of his paintings, collages and sculptures on view at Known Gallery on North Fairfax Avenue in Los Angeles, through Nov. 9.

title: Manly? Yes, in That Present-Day British Way
description: It is about time we addressed the crisis of British manhood. The once proud nation that in the last century gave us such vital and varied paragons of masculinity as Winston Churchill, Laurence Olivier, Mick Jagger and Morrissey is now represented in the popular imagination mainly by rabbity, passive-aggressive stammerers. With all due respect  or maybe just, sort of, well, just the tiniest smidgen of due respect, if you see what I mean  to Hugh Grant, it all seems to be his fault. When he sweet-talked Julia Roberts in Notting Hill, the whole world swooned, and the sun slid further below the horizon of John Bulls manly old empire.

description: Ratings and running times are in parentheses; foreign films have English subtitles. Full reviews of all current releases: nytimes.com/movies.

title: Poland, Wedded to Coal, Spurns Europe on Clean Energy Targets
description: BELCHATOW, Poland  They call it Polands biggest hole in the ground.

description: Approximate running times are in parentheses. Theaters are in Manhattan unless otherwise noted. Full reviews of current productions, additional listings, showtimes and ticket information are at nytimes.com/theater. A searchable, critical guide to theater is at nytimes.com/events.

title: Former American Embassy in Iran Attracts Pride and Dust
description: TEHRAN  Dusty and dilapidated, dwarfed by the modern high-rises of the Iranian capital, the former United States Embassy building stands in a vast compound in the center of Tehran, a forlorn symbol of what increasingly seems like a bygone era here.

title: Help for Some Sandy Victims
description: A temporary change in a federal loan program for the rehabilitation and repair of houses may provide a new option for financing repairs to homes damaged a year ago by Hurricane Sandy.

title: Opera and Classical Music Listings for Nov. 1-7
description: Full reviews of recent classical performances: nytimes.com/classical. A searchable guide to these and other performances is at nytimes.com/events.

title: GTT
description: Our quirky, discerning picks for

title: What I Love | Christian Siriano
description: A look inside the Chelsea home of the Project Runway winner and his partner.

title: Christian Sirianos Walk-Up World
description: Its been an arduous journey for the fashion designer Christian Siriano: winning Season 4 of the reality show Project Runway, a triumph that his publicist asked not be mentioned here (sorry); collecting a group of celebrity clients (Taylor Swift, Christina Hendricks, Sarah Jessica Parker and Victoria Beckham among them); and finally establishing himself as a credible  and fierce  brand.

title: App Lets Riders Forgo Cabs and Ignites Debate on Dallas Code
description: When Uber, the San Francisco-based company that allows customers to order rides with a cellphone app, expanded its operations to Texas, it chose Dallas as its starting point.

title: A River in Trouble, a Question of Who Has to Sacrifice
description: Like nearly every other river in Texas, the 600-mile Colorado River  which flows from West Texas to the gulf coast  is under serious threat. Drought and surging population growth have taken their toll on the waters flow and its wildlife and, by extension, on the farmers and fishermen who rely on it.

title: Dance Listings for Nov. 1-7
description: Full reviews of recent dance performances: nytimes.com/dance. A searchable guide to these and other performances is at nytimes.com/events.

title: Tussle in G.O.P. As Challengers Eye Primaries
description: This is not unusual: Candidates lining up to challenge incumbents in primary elections. That is a simple risk of political life.

title: A Wave of Good Indicators
description: We lived in Boulder, Colo., in a townhouse along a narrow creek. My boyfriend, Brian, and I, along with my three children, our dogs and cat, were shoehorned into the three-level home, with the childrens bedrooms in the basement.

title: Tipping Points
description: I recently moved to the mecca of small coffee shops. Many have tip jars on the counter. When I receive my change, I usually drop the coins into the jar. I figure this is better than no tip at all, and I dont like carrying lots of change. But it occurs to me that this may come across as cheap and insulting. If I were a barista, I might not want a customers dimes and pennies. Should I tip? And if so, only with dollar bills?

title: Bahrain Crackdown Extends to Exhibit on Crackdown
description: One day after the police in Bahrain raided the offices of an opposition party to confiscate materials being used in an exhibition on the security crackdown following the 2011 uprising, the authorities released a video statement in which a spokesman contended that the display of painting, spent tear-gas canisters and the belongings of dead protesters was being used to illegally reinforce hatred.

title: British Tabloid Editors Charged in Hacking Scandal Had Affair, Prosecutors Say
description: LONDON  A high-profile phone hacking trial in Britain turned considerably seamier on Thursday when the prosecution revealed in court that the two most senior editors of the tabloid The News of the World had an affair lasting more than six years  during the period at issue in the trial, and also while both of them married other people.

title: Buckyball Recall Stirs a Wider Legal Campaign
description: Over the last three weeks, more than 2,200 people have placed orders for $10-to-$40 sets of magnetic stacking balls, rising to the call of a saucy and irreverent social media campaign against a government regulatory agency.

title: Building a Portfolio With a Focus on a Single Sector: Water
description: In the late 1990s, David Henderson and Khalil Maalouf bet big on young telecommunications companies, as industry landscape was changing drastically. Then the bubble burst, and the two investors got burned.

title: Earthquake Shakes Remote Area of Taiwan
description: HONG KONG  A strong earthquake shook a remote, mountainous area of central Taiwan on Thursday evening, but there were no immediate reports of injuries or damage.
